text: Maggiano's downtown may become a staple for me and the young lady. We've gone twice in the past 6 weeks and both times have been excellent. We didn't make a reservation last night so we had to sit in the front "bar" section, but there were plenty of good seats available with room and we had the pleasure of Amy being our waitress. She was very nice and attentive and informed us of the great deals. The food was outstanding and we have plenty of leftovers for the next day. See you again soon Maggiano's!

Maggianos is that perfect family restaurant but they are starting to rebrand as spot to bring your girlfriends or spend Happy Hour (I believe they have a $6 Long Island and other drink specials). The real draw is the pasta dinner for two. It's under $50 and you get 2 meals each out of it.  Marco's Meal for Two Choose any Appetizer or Flatbread or Two Side Salads Choose Two Classic Pastas Choose One Dessert Plus Two Classic to Take Home! I like the atmosphere and environment here. Their pasta is good (minus their fettuccini - I wasn't impressed). Their Chicken  Parmesan and spaghetti and one giant meatball are my favorites. Their lasagna is also good. In terms of drinks, their sangria is weaker but flavorful and we had two pitchers of the red sangria during our girls night. As far as brunch is concerned, they really out did themselves. Their lemon ricotta pancakes are insanely good and fluffy. Their crab benedicts make my mouth water just thinking about them.  Love this location and the food.

I've been dining here for many years. It might not be as nouveau Italian as some restaurants in the city but it does deliver on hearty old school Italian dishes.  Service is usually very good, at times that can vary depending on servers. Nonetheless if you're looking for a pleasant place to celebrate an occasion or a family dinner check it out. You will not leave hungry.

Decently good restaurant with great value but for all the Italian places around town, you could probably do better. We got a two person meal that included one starter, two pastas, one dessert. Bruschetta sampler was hit and miss. The classic was hard as a rock. Some interesting flavours though. Pastas were on the salty side but decent. You could choose one to eat and take one pasta home in pre packed boxes. The tiramisu was the definite star of the night though. It was double the size you'd normally expect and was delicious in all the right ways.

Maggiano's has good food, and you know what else?  REALLY good allergy accommodations.  I took my son here for his second restaurant visit ever.  The menu is somewhat limited if you can't have dairy, but they were very very conscientious about preparing a safe meal for him.  It was awesome.  Thank you Maggiano's!
Pleasant servers and overall nice ambiance.  The marinara pasta was pretty average, but the meatball had nice flavor. I'd definitely recommend the mushroom ravioli and the tiramisu cake.

Maggiano's was one of the best authentic Italian restaurants that I've ever been to. This location downtown was a very good experience. They have various seating options. The main dining room requires a reservation, the lobby area and patio are usually available for seating in a few mins.  Go ahead and pay for valet ($20)  because downtown parking is just downtown parking lol. The staff is very greeting and attentive. The food is even better. We got food to go with our meal for free. Also they gave my wife and I a free dessert for anniversary. The chef brought us our food and the GM came out and talked to all the guests on the patio. By far some the best service we've had.

I have been here many times, one of my favorite company Christmas parties was held here. I enjoy the decor of the place, it is very nostalgic, I expect Frank Sinatra to walk in at any minute. The food is very good too. The have your basic pastas that are very reasonable, tastes great, and they give you another one to take home. Then they have their specialty pastas, these are excellent, and sometimes you get a free one with the pasta of the day. The teas, and lemonades are very good, and they make some decent cocktails too. I find the gin and tonic's here, very refreshing. My favorite dish is the basic baked ziti, I love it. I hate to say that this time here, my server was not very good. He was MIA several times, we had to grab passing servers in order to get another drink, or more bread. Overall though it was a very good experience.

Love this place! The service is always fantastic, and the staff is always pleasant. I ordered my meal with a few exceptions and it came just like I ordered. Love the fact that they offer a "lighter" version. Finished off our meal with the cake bites. Fabulous!

Tiramisu was heavenly!! Meat ball pasta & Meat sauce was good. Tuscan shrimp & chicken wow! But, Sautéed veggies - they put cauliflower instead of broccoli yuck. And the photographer was an amateur. We clicked beautiful pics from our phone. Overall awesome food and ambience. Service done by Ali was great. She was very sweet and friendly.
I think the restaurant is over rated. I had the gnocci, it was tasteless and mushy. The portion was enough for three. Service was excellent.

As long as I've been in Chicago, I've never been to Maggianos. I don't really care for Italian food that much. However, I went for a friends birthday. The place was decent and the server was very pleasant.  I only ordered side ceasar saslad and fries zucchini. They were both good but not the best. My girls live Italian food and they enjoyed their dishes. One dis comment that hers lacked a bit if seasoning.  I would come back.

I truly believe a server here did something to our food funny thing is I tipped the man 25% but I guess with stereotypes waiting black tables just screams "I'm not getting ripped so I don't care about this table"..... needless to say my daughter threw up and I threw up my food.... I never throw up food my stomach is not weak by any means necessary .... therefore I know there was something done to our food..... but besides that the environment is not welcoming we waited about 6 minutes before someone greeted us:....  it's no wonder this place isn't busy for lunch.... they don't want to work....:. I'll never grace this establishment with my presence again

Came here for lunch with a co-worker, it was not busy they sat us down right away. There were about 5 other tables with people...sat for 20 minutes no one acknowledged we were there or even said they would take our order... we got up and left....huge disappointment! The hostess that sat us was cheerful and said bye thanks have a nice day??? Did they even realize they never took our order and ignored us for 20 minutes......

Service here depends on server because the food is always the same & consistent.  Tonight I had a great server named Robert.  He came to the table at least every 10 minutes.  I made reservations which were not needed.  Love the music, cleanliness.  I always order the done for 2 special so worth it at $43 though it has increased it still is a great buy.  Make sure u sign up for the email/b'day club.  They will send u a $10 off coupon.
It's just, I prefer the Oak Brook location. There's always an error when ordering take out at this one.

My friend and I decided to take in the Riverwalk last Saturday night. I decided we should eat Italian that night. My friend had a gift certificate for any lettuce entertainment restaurants. I called Maggiano's for dinner reservations and talk to Kyle. When we arrived. The staff treated us like royalty. We selected the dinner for two. DAMN!, not only was the food incredibly. But we when home with plenty of food to feed us the next day. I want to say thank you to Kyle, the manager of the restaurant who made us feel at home, and and our waiter who in my  mind was the best. I worked twenty five years at the Chicago Hilton. I have to say that this was one of favorite restaurants. I definitely will be back.

My friend  and I always heard about this restaurant. So we decided to go, we not disappointed we we were greeted at the door by Kyle who was super our waiter was very good and the manager came to our table to personally greet us food great service excellence a must-stop when visiting the Windy City

So a little story before i go into details.  My boyfriend and I have been wanting to go eat and he suggested pasta places to go eat. We were right around the Trump hotel because our first suggestion was this place across the trump hotell. We were in briefly to check the menu and ' alfredo pasta ' was not there, so we left onto another restaurant. There was a place right across the place we were previously at and so we check at the place, the menu of course and we did not see alfredo pasta. At the point, we were already burnt out and tired from all this walking since we walked from the bean which isn't really far, but it was pretty hot.  After stopping at two pasta places, my boyfriend simply typed in ' alfredo pasta ' into google hoping for a suggestion. We were so tired and I said ' this is our last chance, if it does not go right, we're cooking. " So, we popped into Maggiano;s and of course, i asked nicely for the menu. The server/host gives me the menu and finally, we are so happy and thrilled. My boyfriend literally smiled through his whole excitement, it made me so happy honestly.  At this point, I'm relieved because the inside of the building is so fancy, and EVERY TIME i go to a italian restaurant with the exception of Olive Garden, my boyfriend and I drop into one of those fancy places, but like we aren't even dressed up not knowing how it is. So, we go in there really casual, i mean it's a nice day out, so :)  Anyways, as we sat down, we had two different servers and the reason is because one was leaving, so someone else took care of us. But the first one made sure we were comfortable, asking if we needed anything to start off with. Someone from the kitchen brought bread for us to chow down on, which was pretty fresh and good! :)  After being served bread, i took forever to make my decision and my boyfriend obviously wanted his pasta ( alfredo ) w/ shrimp. I'm more of a marinara person, so i ask about the soup for the day and the new guy, Jake describes it, and i got it. Tasted pretty good ( clam chowder ), their version is red on that day, but i don't know about the other days. So i order my pasta and i was so happy, it tasted so good, and we even had dessert.  Before I go on about my dessert, it was buy a pasta, take one home. Basically, buy one, get one free and we took all the food home that we couldn't finish in addition to what they gave us for free. Alright, time to spark up this story. I mean, how do you eat lunch/ dinner, idk, we got dessert even though we were filled to the extreme. My boyfriend got some like chocolate-cake truffles/ balls, they're white chocolate if I'm not mistaken and I got a spark of their creme brulee. I love creme brûlée, i would have it any day. After paying for our thing, our server came and still asked if we needed anything, when we were done. 10/10 service. After this, their manager came up to us and greeted us. Wait, before i continue, the server greeted us welcoming us, since it was our first time there. So, let me continue my story. The manager gave us little coupons and asked us about the food and experience and other locations they have around a few different states. Lovely!  The service, food, people, everything. I would rate this place higher if possible ! 11/10!  :)  well done, thank you so much! :)

We came last week and OMG IT WAS AMAZING! We had been there once before but this was beyond amazing! We had a group of 10 and our server was the lovely Ms. Katie!! (Would highly recommend) She was a small bundle of delight and spunk! She knew all her stuff and helped us out with anything we had questions on. We did the family style dinner- which was expensive but totally worth it! Portions were huge though which wasn't bad! We ended up packing 6 boxes to feed to the homeless because we were so full!  It was like I was back in Italy! She sold us on everything! Everything about our experience was AMAZING! Must try food and experience!

Made a last minute reservation here on a Friday night. They didn't have any space in the dining area but were able to accommodate us on the bar side which still had nice tables and was quiet. My friend and I opted for the meal for 2 - 1 appetizer, 2 classic pastas for now AND 2 to take home, plus a dessert for about $43. It was a great deal as one signature pasta will run about $18. That being said, we had A TON of leftovers! I had the baked eggplant parmesan which was pretty good and not fried. I took a Mom's lasagna home which stayed good for 2 more meals. The tiramisu was fantastic, one of the best I've had out of the Italian restaurants in the area.  The service was also great! My friend is severely allergic to all nuts and they actually brought the head chef out to talk to her and he personally took her order to ensure that it would be safe. Very accommodating and would highly recommend if allergies are an issue!

Although my review is late the food was outstanding. A bit pricey, but good food usually is. We had the family style service and if you've got a group to feed that is definitely the route to take. The salmon was delicious and blackend just enough so you can taste the fire. The meatballs were okay, could've been bigger though. Eggplant arm with lots of cheese. Bread and more bread to so more to say. It is an endless amount of food until you say stop. If you have a celebration this is your place.

Our 2nd time dining for brunch and just as delicious as the 1st..! ANY of the brunch selections will amaze you..!  My sister had the Chicken Francase Benedict and I had the Smoked Salmon and Spinach Benedict.  Both were marvelous..!  And the Vesuvio style potatoes are positively delish..! We saved room for the Lemon/Ricotta pancakes.  Could possibly be the finest pancake we've ever tasted..!  We had a side of the Nueske bacon; kudos to the Nueske Family..! Our server was very friendly and accommodating.  Very, very gracious..! The chef even stopped by to ask us how things were..!  We lauded his food and our server..! Just saying that this is a fantastic Saturday/Sunday, in the city, brunch destination..!

Went for lunch on a beautiful day and got to sit on the patio. I would say good for groups  as portions are meant for sharing except the shrimp fra diavlo which was excusable as I ordered the lighter fare.

I'm a huge fan of Italian food and Maggiano's does a really good job of putting Olive Garden to shame. I love the family style aspect of it all. The amount of food you get in one sitting is amazing. The food always tastes good and the service was on point. Being that it was a Friday evening, it was a little crowded but the food more than made up for it. I would definitely come back to a Maggiano's for some home style Italian.

I was in the Chicago restaurant on Sunday evening. I wanted to commend the hostess as she was very pleasant and accommodating. She made us feel welcomed. I did not mind the 30 minute wait because my family and I typically enjoy dining at Maggiano's. Unfortunately I will not be returning after my experience I had tonight. I had to ask 2 different people to bring my drink out after 25 minutes of waiting. The raspberry iced tea was pure syrup and I did not enjoy it. I also asked a food runner, host, my server, and one more person if they could bring some more bread out. It wasn't until I asked the server a third time that she brought out more bread, and this was when our dinner already arrived. I asked if the pasta would be cooked "al dente" and she said yes. When we got the pasta, it was very soft. Overall I was not pleased with the dinner experience. This is a shame because my family and I usually enjoy spending our night at Maggiano's.

Great ambiance and decor. The food was just right. We ordered the seafood food pasta and it was a generous portion that can be shared by two. We had our pasta with garlic sauce and it was amazing Great service, great food overall a great place to dine in

The food here is amazing and worth the prize.  The last time I attended this place, I hosted a private event in their banquet area.  Every course I chose was DELICIOUS.  Parking:  There's pay box-street parking and valet parking available.  Valet is $15 for 3 hours but if you're hosting or attending there for a private event, the $15 will cover your entire length of stay. Food Recommendation:  baked eggplant parmesan, stuff mushrooms, fried zucchini, chopped apple/walnut salad, chicken piccata, and warm apple crostada. Be aware that this location has 2 different areas--general dining area (located directly at the corner of Grand and Clark) and banquet/private event area (located in between Dearborn and Clark on Grand).

Ended up Maggiano's after a long time. I would expect a traditional Italian food but not what I expected. Ordered eggplant park and it was blend. Had to ask for extra sauce to add test. Not sure if it was eggplant itself. Service was great.

My fiancee and I have been going to Maggiano's since one of our first dates and have not stopped.  Our first visit was in Boston, where we lived at the time, and it could not have been a better experience.  After that, it was the place where we introduced our parents, and the place we held our engagement reception.  We then moved to Chicago and immediately sought out the nearest one, which is this one and not far from our home in Wrigleyville.  Our very first server was Kevin.  He hit it out of the ballpark, no pun intended.  By far he exceeded every expectation we had.  He anticipated what we needed before we needed it which made me in awe of him.  After that we came back and had Jake who was no different with his style in service.  Most recently we went back to celebrate my being sworn into the Illinois State Bar and made sure we were sat with either Kevin or Jake.  Kevin was not working at the time but Jake was so imagine our excitement.  Rashida, the most amazing hostess (and also a superb actor as I am told) ensured we were sat with Jake.  Again Jake exceeded our expectations always ensuring we had what we wanted to make our experience awesome without being over burdensome.  This company has the highest standards for there guest service and we appreciate that.  I have been in the service industry for over 15 years and held every position from dishwasher to general manager and worked in places from quick service to the utmost fine dining establishments.  The mantra that we live by is if a restaurant has the best food ever but terrible service we will never return, not even for a second chance as there are too many other restaurants out there to try.  However, even if an establishment has mediocre to good food and excellent service we will go back over and over again because service is what makes the dining experience memorable.  Maggiano's is that special place that happens to have really great food and some of the best service professionals in the business.  Thank you so much Maggiano's for everything you do and thank you Kevin, Jake, and Rashida for being the best at what you do and giving us fantastic memories.  We cannot wait to return.

Went here for a networking event yesterday. Although we did not get to order food, there was a small buffet available for us which included meatballs, mushroom ravioli, chicken rolls, grilled veggies, and a few other small things. The food that I had was really good. The mushroom ravioli was probably my favorite thing from the night. It had a great rich flavor. The meatballs were also really good and you could tell the marinara sauce it was with had real tomatoes in it.  In addition, the service we received was impeccable. There were close to 30 people in our group and the servers were constantly clearing the dirty dishes from the tables, refilling the food, and attentive to our drink needs. Thank you for a wonderful night!

I tried to dine at your establishment, but was treated so rudely, my party of 6 had to walk out before even enjoying a glass of water.   i had a reservation 6 ppl on 4/22 through opentable.  we thought the reservation was for 730pm and 3 of the 6 attendees showed up at 730.  we were informed that the reservation was for 8pm so we were happy to wait till a table opened up OR our 8pm reservation time, whichever came first.  we stood around waiting and watched multiple parties come in and get seated, some with reservations and some without.  We checked in with the hostess around 750pm to see the status of our table and she informed us that the table was still not ready.  We waited some more.  At 8pm, our reservation time, we again approached the hostess and she said she would check in on the table and sent us away.  She never came to tell us about the status of our table.  At 815, we again approached the hostess and she said they were "finding" us a table. waited another 10 minutes, another member of our party showed up by then.  At 825pm, I went up to the hostess and she informed us that the table was about ready and told us to wait.  I told her multiple parties have come and been seated before us, some being larger parties as well.  She just told us to wait.  A tall man with a beard came and approached us minutes later and seated us at a table.  As we sat down, one chair had some leftover food (dried up lasagna) on it so my friend had to clean her own chair off.  We sit down and notice that the table is wobbly.  The bearded man leaves saying he will find a way to fix the table.  In the meantime, the waiter starts to pour the water and literally spills water all over one of the empty chairs nearly missing one of my friends heads.  He doesn't apologize or bring a towel to clean up the mess.  A lady in a suit approaches us and apologizes for the table and says we can wait another 20 minutes for a different table to be available. HOW RIDICULOUS!  We had an 8pm reservation and now we will not get seated until 845pm!  What was the point of making a reservation?!  We were so disappointed in the service.  We walked out of Maggianos with little hope of returning or recommending this location to our friends or family.

I had brunch at the restaurant on Easter.  I was very disappointed with the amount of food compared to the price.  We had the eggs benedict with crab cakes, and the chicken and waffles, not that good at all.  The waitress was ok, but certainly didn't do anything above the minimal expectations.  She walked by our table multiple times without asking how the food was or checking in.  I had been looking forward to trying the brunch, and will now be looking forward to going elsewhere.

Come on, Maggiano's, I used to love you so thought that a DoorDash delivery would be perfect for a night in. Pasta was fine, but take a look at our $15 Maggianos chopped salad....which is supposed to have Crispy Prosciutto, Red Onions, Blue Cheese, House Dressing. Where were the onions, prosciutto and blue cheese?!?!?! Boo. Clearly they don't QA takeout like they do dine in. Super disappointing.

My fiancé and I came here the day after we got engaged. The waiter was attentive, knowledgeable and sweet. He brought the manager over to see us who presented us with a card of congratulations and a free appetizer coupon. They also brought out lemon cookies and champagne. We left stuffed and happy. We had such a lovely time that we chose to have our wedding reception here this coming July. I can't wait.

The food was pretty good here. Not the best Italian food I have had, but certainly in the top twenty five. The bruschetta was good, the calamari was so-so and the mains were good.  Portions were generous and they one extra star for carrying the beer Moretti La Rosa, one of my all time favorites! The service can be a little slow if you are a big group. But it was within the acceptable limits before I would complain.

My husband and I went to Maggiano's   Last night for dinner, a surprise anniversary dinner.   Our waiter, John, was super!  Very friendly, quick service and when he found out it was our anniversary he brought us a complimentary glass of Perseco wine.    Our dinner was superb, delicious and our choice of Malbec wine topped off the perfect combo.    John had a new waiter in training shadowing him, Patrick, who was equally polite and friendly.   Thank you men for a delightful dinner experience!     When we go back we will ask to be seated in John's section.    A great waiter!

I been hearing lots of great things from this restaurant and decided to give it a try today. I went in on my lunch break at around 12:30pm with my coworker. We were seated right away and knew what to order but once seated we were not a knowledged by any wait staff. We had waiters pass by and no one came to take our order. We waiting a good 5 minutes and mind you the restaurant was completely empty, no more than 3- 4 tables were occupied. So if it was busy I would understand the wait but at least come introduce yourself , bring some water etc.  I don't know if it's because we were not dressed up fancy enough for their liking since I was wearing my nursing scrubs and maybe they thought we weren't able to afford it??  We got up and left and most likey they didn't even notice. I never got a chance to their food but it's okay, there's lots of places that will gladly    provide great service.. oh and btw for  being "a fancy restaurant" please make sure you wash your glassware and utensils property as they looked dirty! Will absolutely never return!

I've only been to the banquets area, so this review is limited in scope. Servers are friendly, attentive, and fast, but food isn't that great. They serve all the Maggiano's staples, but in the banquet hall, seems like the quality goes down in the mass production of food. Everything is mediocre, from the salads to the cookies.  That said, I really like the event space. Dark wood everywhere and a large room that can seat probably up to 200. The bathroom is upstairs, which is inconvenient, but it's clean, kinda fancy, and has lots of mirrors (thought that would be a plus if you're having a wedding reception here). There are a couple of bar areas off to the sides of the entrance, which is nice. Overall, a good option if you're looking for a traditional event space, and don't care too much about the food being off-the-charts.
Delicious salmon dinner and chicken piccata. Wonderful waiter and all staff very attentive.
Best Italian food I've ever had! It's too bad I'm a tourist and can't eat here whenever I want. Must try the Sicilian mixed drink. It was great! Dessert was great too

excellent service the waiter john was very polite and attended my girlfriend and i perfectly! also the food was delicious i will definitely come here again and recommend it to everyone! it was a great anniversary dinner! and they even brought out cookies with a decoration saying "happy anniversary" thank you john lester and thank you maggianos

The food was absolutely amazing here. Service was great and I can't wait to come back for the food. Definitely recommend the bruschetta bar it will not disappoint! Thank you for making our time in Chicago wonderful!

As someone with a gluten sensitivity, I really appreciated that the chef came out to our table and explained all of my options...and there were a lot of them! Food and service were great. Also, they have a great deal where you can bring home dinner for the next night. Thanks for being sensitive to my gluten sensitivity! :)
Franklin, Our waiter made me the best Cosmo EVER! & Delicious calamari & The Tuscan shrimp and chicken was to die for

Good customer service and really good food. Waiter was a bit more chatty than we cared for but it's all good. He meant well and yes, we tipped him well. Loved the ambience and will return if I'm ever in that neck of the woods.

Let me just begin by saying that the staff here is wonderful. Definitely the best part of our experience here. Our waiter was attentive, and the manager stopped by to ask about our experience at the end of our meal. I can't speak much for the food - to me, pasta is pasta unless it's REALLY good pasta. We did the Meal for 2: for about $45 you get a starter or 2 salad, 2 entrees, 2 entrees to TAKE HOME with you (!!!), and a dessert to share. The portions were generous and we had to take our dessert home because we were so full. Our take-home bag was FULL when we left the restaurant. It seems like a good place for families with plenty of large-group seating, but also a good place for a casual date. Very satisfied with this place!
Good chopped chopped salad with tasty and light house dressing, avocado, and blue cheese. Add the salmon for a good meal.

I cannot wait to come back here again! Everything about my experience this past Saturday was phenomenal. My boyfriend and I did not intend to go here but when we couldn't find our original destination we figured why not give it a shot; BEST ACCIDENT EVER. Our waitress was Katie in the lounge area and I do not think either of us have ever had a better waitress. Katie had great recommendations, and such a positive attitude. She made the meal a whole event for us and truly made us feel welcomed. Because of her she has started a new tradition for us for date nights. As far as the food (which is why everyone is going there obviously) each course got better and better. We chose to do the Marcos meal which was a great deal, an appetizer, two classic pastas(which we did the five dollar upgrade for chicken parm for one entree), a dessert and then two pastas to take home! We started with the chicken and roasted pepper flat bread which we could have made a meal out of alone, then the chicken parm was delicious but what really stood it was the mushroom ravioli. It was recommended by Katie and the couple next to us who have made it a tradition to return (from Portland) just to this Maggianos for this ravioli. We ended the meal with the tiramisu that was super light and worth cramming in our tummys. As you can tell I have nothing but great things to say about this restaurant, and it's because it is very well deserved. Truly a memorable date night for us and a meal I look forward to indulging in again.

Our server (Emil) was extremely patient with us, a group of ten. Gave my table 7 bread refills and dealt with someone spilling water. True champ, and very nice. Location is great and food was delicious. Had a nice time celebrating 6 birthdays and everyone enjoyed the desserts. Definitely recommended the place.

Customer Service was fantastic.  Celebrated 6 different birthdays with a group of 20 people. We had two separate tables of 10 with two separate waiters. The waiter for my table did an excellent job at taking care of us. Someone at our table has messed up and spilled water all over the table within the first ten minutes of being there and out waiter took care of it calmly and professionally. Had everything ordered fast and refills before the cup was even empty. Excellent service! Would come here again.  Food/Deserts: The deserts were great! 8/8 Our table got 5 different deserts that were all huge and we were able to share with our entire table of 10 people and some to our friends at the other table. We also got a ton of lemon cookies with birthday candles on them. At the end of the day we had more food and deserts than we could handle, proportions were huge, so keep that in mind when you come here.

Look, it's been a while since I've been inside a Maggiano's, and even then, I used to do family style all the time here. But Mom sent me a gift card for Christmas last year, so I had to find a way to spend that bad boy...and I did, this past weekend, with Mom, my wife, and two kids in tow. It was a glorious return to form. I had the gnocchi with Italian sausage, the crispy zucchini fritte, and the chocolate zuccotto cake.  It was way too heavy, too rich, and too good for me to come back here regularly, but while I was sitting inside the restaurant I was very happy.  (Naturally, the doggie bag thing is still a thing here.) With so much good Italian in Chicago, it's hard to imagine making this a regular occurrence, but for one night, it was fun rolling back down memory lane.  Next time, though, I'm doing family style, especially if it's still the same deal--two dishes each from the five major sections (apps, salads, sides, entrees, desserts).  I miss being able to eat everything in sight, but when you hit your 40s, the portion size thing is a thing!

As always, delicious food! We got chicken parm, bruschetta, and fettuccine alfredo, all the out. Everything was perfect EXCEPT the bruschetta had olives.... LOTS OF OLIVES. And it has never had them before when I always get bruschetta from a different Maggianos location next to my house. Also, we ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo Light, but they gave us the regular.  Their service was very, very mediocre, our food wasn't ready by the time they said it would be and I had to wait about 8 extra minutes for it. No thank you, or any words except for "sign here" for the credit card receipt. Also, keep in mind, they carry out section is completely separate from the actual Maggianos restaurant. So when I walked into the actual restaurant, since it was my time, I walked in and nobody came to seat me or acknowledged me until I walked over to the bar after a couple minutes and the bartender, in a rush (even though there were no other customers at the bar) told me that I'm in the wrong place and I have to go around from outside, make a left and then it'll be the next door to my left. Once again, very, very mediocre service. Because of all this, I will probably refrain from ordering takeout again unless it is just chicken parm, but their service and timing is not that great. I work super close by and it's very disappointing to know that I probably will not get take out from here as much as I would have liked to because of their lack of consideration for my time and unprofessional attitudes.

I am a big fan of Maggiano's and I have always loved the food and service. A few weeks ago I went to this Maggiano's downtown with my husband and UNFORTUNATELY our waiter was MICHAEL. He was RUDE, CONDESCENDING AND LACKED KNOWLEDGE OF THE MENU.  He was unpleasant and felt the need to inform me that 8 ounces is bigger than 6 ounces when ordering wine.  When we asked for a beer (Corona, which we have drank many times at different Maggiano's restaurants) he said with sarcasm "this is an Italian restaurant". EXCUSE ME...? Are all of your beers Italian? Are all of your wines Italian? NO! We ordered the take home pastas which are included in the price but this waiter did NOT want to give them to us! That had never happened to us. We will not be going to this Maggiano's again.  Michael should be trained again.  Worst service ever.

This is my second review here. Been there on the valentine's night again. I am so happy I considered that option. They never disappoint you. This time we ordered Chicken Piccata, Spaghetti and meatball. The Piccata was awesome. I loved being here again. Will visit again I guess. Please try Creme Brulee, its the dessert from the heaven.

I've actually never been in the venue - but I frequent this place through the Doordash food ordering app. It has slowly but surely become my favorite Italian restaurant to order from! While I can't speak about the ambiance of the venue, the food also comes packaged nicely and with saran wrap so nothing leaks or spills out. They also are very fast about starting my order and getting it to me while it's still warm. They always make sure to include bread and butter with my take out order so I get the full dining experience at home! My go-to order is the eggplant parm and it is amazing. Just writing about it is making me crave it! Their tomato basil soup is also super creamy and hits the spot on a cold Chicago day.  I will continue to order from Maggiano's Little Italy and hopefully I can come in person one day!

I came here last night for a work event and had a really nice time!  The food was mostly apps and drink wise it was just wine but it was super classy and the food was tasty.  Perfect place for a networking event!

What's not to like about Maggiano's? Sure it's a chain, but it's a small chain with delicious homestyle Italian cooking, great deals, and consistently good service.  Their buy one get one pasta deal is seriously superb. You basically can pick from a variety of dishes for dinner, and get to bring one home for leftovers (or work lunch the next day for me!) they also have a deal on their menu that is perfect for a date night! It's around $43 total and includes one appetizer, 2 pasta dishes, 2 leftover pasta dishes, and dessert! It's such a steal, and I leave feeling like I'm going to burst every single time. We've come here for many celebrations, and the staff always makes sure to bring out cookies or some other surprise to help make the moment special! All in all, fabulous service and fabulous food, can't go wrong with Maggiano's!

From the moment I sat down, I knew this was going to be great place to have dinner. I came with a group and the waiter was just amazing! He was so polite and informative about everything. From the drinks to dessert he made it comfortable and very welcoming to dine there. At one point I think I ended up calling him sir because he was so polite. By the end of our meal, our waiter came out and let us know that we were getting tons of extra pasta dishes to take home, compliments from the chef he says. We were in awe. Overall, I would come back here in a heart beat, no questions asked. Service was AMAZING!!!

The 4 of us (wife,daughters, myself) went for dinner Saturday night to celebrate wife's birthday.  We had reservations and were seated promptly.  Out server was fantastic.  If you are going to eat there ask to have Katie as your server.  She was very knowledgeable about the different foods, drinks, desserts, history of restaurant etc..   We took her recommendations and they were spot on.  She was very attentive and made a real attempt to connect with everyone at the table.  We figured she'd been working there for years, but it was only her 2nd month.  We had Calamari appetizer, my wife had Chicken picatta, I had Chicken Marsala, 1 daughter had the lobster linguini special and the other had the mussels dinner.  All of them were perfect as we taste tested each others meals. Katie's wine suggestions were also great.  We had the pound cake dessert, and they brought a special birthday dessert for us also (lemon cookies). The evening was relaxed, we didn't feel rushed, dining room was filled with other diners enjoying themselves, making it a perfect night out. We even got a 4 cheese ravioli serving to take home due to getting one of the evening's dinner specials.

Main reason was to visit with the Banquet Sales Manager Nicole. But how could you not stay to enjoy lunch!!! Our fav is the spaghetti with meat sauce. Especially my 2yr old favorite!!! Says it is Delicious!!! The staff is amazing! Never have a bad any issues. I've celebrated my 30th there, my 2nd Mothers Day and now we will be going there to have our wedding reception/dinner.   Nicole was absolutely friendly and awesome for meeting with us on such short notice. And our waiter David was a pleasure, our experience today was like all the others. Great!! I really enjoy the food here!!!
I love this place if you come to Chicago you need to come here customer service great!!food excellent

If you want great Italian food for a reasonable price in the city, plus the BEST service you could ask for go to Maggianos! I've had numerous extremely pleasant times at this location just considering the service alone. (Shout out to Tom and Michael at this location for being the reason I write this review.) Everyone is on their A game I have 0 complaints. As far as food, I would not go as far as to say it's the best Italian you can find, but it's consistent and if you want the most bang for your buck while still going on a nice, classy date this is your best bet. Bread and oil of course, calamari is light and crisp, and I would highly recommend their Famous Rigatoni D if you're in the mood for pasta. Never disappointed. Also tried their lemon ricotta cookies last time - quite the little delicacy! Thank you, we will keep returning.

One of the BEST restaurants in Chicago! The Food, Fantastic! The Service, 2nd to None! Whoever is managing this place is doing a Superb Job, EVERYONE was equally kind and courteous! Will return EVERY time we come to Chicago! Instant Classic!
The food her is awesome. The ravioli was to die for. Nice place. Worth the visit

There were four of us dining and all of us enjoyed what we ordered. The service was good, though could have been a little more attentive. The lighting, music, and atmosphere were just right for a nice dinner. The next time I am in the area, I would go back.
Amazing food and amazing service. You get the ambience and feel of a very pricey restaurant but it's affordable and family friendly. I will definitely be back.

Came in a party of 4 on Dec 24 dinner. The service is below average. Our waiter showed up once every 15 minutes. One of our dishes did not come. No one bothered to check our dishes. One of our drinks did not come. Our breads did not come. We expect good food AND good service ( not self service). I understand that it is a busy day( Xmas Eve); however, the service is way below average.

My favorite Italian restaurant.   My favorite items are the zucchini appetizer, the mushroom ravioli al forno and Nonna's pound cake.  I really like the house salad and dressing.  The chopped salad is great also.  Been here many, many times... Have never been disappointed.

This has always been one of my favorite Italian restaurants not only because it's good food, but they have a very good gluten free menu and the chef always comes out to talk to me about what's safe.  The buy one take one home meals are our family favorites and my husband likes the salmon. Everyone leaves full and happy every time.

I live a short mile from this restaurant and have always enjoyed dining there for both its value,  good tasting italian food and especially it's bread.  We always bring our family here for special occasions.  I am writing this review solely as a tribute to the exceptional service of our waiter tonight...RAUL.  His positive attitude and desire to please us was so exceptional that he deserves credit by having his own review here now.  When we return we will ask specifically for him as you should!

I went yesterday with a friend and got the Marco's meal for 2. We got two side salads, which were quite large, and we each got to pick a pasta AND take one home with us! We has the tiramisu for dessert which was delicious. If you're looking for a pasta recommendation you MUST try the mushroom ravioli!!!! We were seated very quickly and we had great service. We were in a rush and our server was so helpful with that.
I was underwhelmed by my primavera BUT my husbands dish ( a pasta special with pork belly I think)  was phenom!  I forgot what it was called but the flavor was great...

This was my first time and it did not disappoint! I loved the cozy, authentic atmosphere. We sat in a nice corner booth in the bar area and had a friendly server who was very attentive and knowledgable. He did not seem too overwhelmed to chat with us even though it was a packed Saturday night. (My group waited at least an hour but that was expected for 6 people walking in). The food was awesome! Granted, we were all completely starving but the wait was well worth it. The bread was simple but good and the house-made parmesan mixed with the olive oil was AMAZING! I ordered a Caesar salad to start and it was prepared my favorite way: covered in creamy dressing with croutons and shredded parmesan. For my entree I don't usually order lasagna at Italian restaurants because it seems like a "boring" choice. But something told me this would be good. This was one of the entrees that included a to-go pasta also. They give you a whole other entree to take home and reheat when you leave. I ordered lasagna for now, ziti to-go. My sister and I planned on sharing our meals but after one bite of my lasagna I conveniently forgot about that....(she was ok with it.) The creamy, cheesy goodness was unlike any lasagna I'd ever had. So rich and flavorful. It had ground up sausage and meatballs with marinara. I devoured the whole thing! I also changed my to-go order to another lasagna and explained to the waiter that it was the best thing I'd ever tasted. I am anxiously awaiting tomorrow when I get to heat up the bonus order!  I also had a Kettle One dirty martini that was dirtier than my taste but could easy be specified in the future. It was still great...Everyone was happy and full when we left and that was the plan from the start. Can't wait to go back!

Better than good.  My compliments to the chef and everybody that made my meal memorable. I haven't been to this Maggiano's in a long long time, so far back I don't even remember when I was here last. I think it's because there's been such a proliferation of new restaurants in this area that I have a tendency to overlook the older establishments in favor of the newer hipper kid(s) on the block. Which in hindsight have been either a hit or miss for me. So when I reluctantly went to this place last night, I didn't have high hopes.  I thought it would be tired, have lower food quality and sluggish service, in other words, not as good as it use to be.  So much for my bias!  Which is a shame because this place still serves excellent tasting Italian food at reasonable prices considering the quality.  I say reasonable in the sense they don't stint on the ingredients, everything here is first-rate.  Funny I ended up here because originally I was going to eat at Bub City but they were so crowded and noisy I decided to go here instead.  Maggiano's at the time I went, around 8PM on a Wednesday night was more quiet, comfortable and spread out, so I knew I could have a peaceful meal all to myself without bumping elbows.  I had just come from one of those long drawn out focus groups and I was literally starving to death, so at that point I was ready to eat the table, that's how hungry I was.  I also remembered that they had good lasagna and tiramisu on past visits.  The moment I walked in I was surprised it had a good vibe, the greeter was cheerful and very accommodating and let me sit wherever I wanted.  I sat on the bar side only because there weren't as many people there as in the main restaurant.  Plus it wasn't cramped and lo and behold they had those old leather banquettes!  Talk about comfortable. This time though I ordered the chicken saltimbocca, which I had never tried before.  But as luck would have it I got the *wrong order, instead I received a dish called chicken francese, which turned out to be a blessing in disguise, it was simply sublime.  The chicken was topped with a light parmesan crust & lemon butter sauce and came with crispy vesuvio potatoes and a side order of linguini.  Honestly words can't describe how delicious this whole meal was...it was that good.  Let's just say it was lick the plate good...although I literally had to restrain myself from making a fool of myself in font of the whole restaurant!  BTW, I also ordered their spinach salad, suggested by Nick my unobtrusive server.  Now that's a delicious salad in and of itself, it comes with pine nuts, crispy Applewood smoked bacon, red onions and a nice splash of balsamic vinaigrette.  Tasty. I think the real reason I enjoyed this meal so much was because I hadn't eaten for several hours, my stomach was past empty, plus it was extremely cold and damp outside.  All which conspired to rev up my appetite even more.     No dessert this time, but definitely will order the next time when I'm by this way again. This was a great meal! *Nick offered to buy me a glass of wine the next time I go there because of the mix-up.  Thanks Nick.

My boys took my wife and I to this Chicago location to celebrate my birthday earlier this year (April 2016).  Since then we visited the St. Louis, MO location as well this past Black Friday.  Very good food at both locations and great ambiance. Only reasons for giving 3* are: two regrets/complaints :  the bread takes for ever to be served,  At the Chicago location the bread was served after we finished our main course.  Additionally the sever never gave us the free complimentary pasta to take home at Chicago location.  Maybe they were too busy or maybe customer is required to ask for it specifically.

Family friendly restaurant in the middle of the Loop.  I'd probably give it 3.5 stars if I could.  The restaurant has the feel of a classier Olive Garden, right down to the BOGO menu for various pastas (including that yummy pesto alfredo 4-cheese ravioli and lasagna).  If you're willing to pay an upcharge on the BOGO menu, the gnocchi is worth the extra couple of dollars.  The portions are generous and if you're there on a date, I'd recommend the Dinner for 2 option.  You'll get one appetizer/flatbread, 2 BOGO pastas, and a dessert. While the food is pretty good, the service is fairly slow and you should let your waiter know if you're in a hurry if you're trying to catch a show downtown or get somewhere after your meal.  My boyfriend and I went on a Friday night and yes, it was crowded, but we both finished our iced teas while eating our appetizers and didn't get a refill until well into our entrees after we flagged someone down.  Overall though, it is a great family restaurant where you can have a good, casual time.

This was a wonderful experience.  I had high expectations and they exceeded them in outstanding service. The ambience is dim, but not dark.  The atmosphere is rustic Italian.  Very much makes me want to experience Italy in the flesh. The wait staff was attentive, knowledgeable and available when needed, but not over bearing.   The appetizer was amazing.  The Panzerotti it was like Italian empanadas.  The exterior was perfectly crispy and was well balanced with the cheesy, saucy interior.  The sauce was fresh tasting not likely pre-made or out of a can.  Highly recommended. I had the Linguine De Mare.  It was overall prepared very well.  The pasta was perfect.  The sauce was amazing, a bit spicy which I loved.  The lobster and some of the mussels were a bit overcooked.  Not bad, but worth noting.  My wife had the Shrimp Fra Diavol.  It was perfect the flavor was amazing, perfectly blended and rounded.  Everything was perfectly cooked.  The fresh in house pasta was perfect and the shrimp was done exactly as it should be. The lemon cookies are dynamite.  Worth trying without question.  Light enough to eat even after a big meal, but still fulfilling.
Great atmosphere! Great food! And waitstaff are awesome! Seasoned employees and very attentive. Portions are huge and food is never disappointing

Wonderful lunch of fettuccine Alfredo chicken lite fare option. Delicious. Chopped Salad is very favorful. And I would recommend the carrot cake for dessert. Biggest piece 4 of us couldn't finish it. Best carrot cake I ever had.

I love this Location! The best staff, food, and atmosphere! I love it for date nights, girls night out or any celebration! If your from Chicago or visiting Chicago you have to experience a meal in the best Maggiano's! Cheers!

I know Maggiano's is a chain.....but I love it! LOL. The food here is consistently delicious and I've never had a bad experience. In my opinion, it's not necessarily the type of place you just go to. I normally end up at Maggiano's for corporate events or for an occasion like a baby shower or something of that nature. I happen to go to Maggiano's this past weekend to try their Bruschetta bar. It was sooooo good! So many different flavors combined and it satisfied the sweet and savory. While there I also partook in the happy hour. From 3:00 to 6:00pm they have limited drinks for $6.00 and limited food items for $4.00. I highly recommend the Pomegranate Martini and the sausage and pepperoni flat bread. I love that the flatbread had an extra thin crust.  I also have to mention the service cause our waiter was excellent! I didn't get his name, but we were sitting outside around 6:00pm on a Friday (9/16). Whoever he was I'm a fan. I will definitely be back for happy hour in the near future. :)

If you enjoy a private dining room (almost empty at Noon and no additional guests arrived over the hour), classic red sauce and Frank Sinatra crooning through lunch, this is the place for you.  The portions are huge and you'll take home enough food for your next four meals, the service is attentive and the prices make Maggiano's a good value.  I wish there was a little more company in the dining room... it's lonesome to be two of six diners in a room that seats 60+.

Amazing on all counts. Friendly front desk, professional and knowledgeable server, and perfectly personable manager. Shout out to fellow Virgo, Trebia, for making my birthday celebration extra special! Loved! Definitely a highlight of an unexpected weekend in Chicago!
Great food and great service. The Gnocchi was awesome. The manager Trebia Bowman was great and went out of her way to give us a good experience.

We came in on a late Wednesday evening, our server's name was Mr. John Lester. He was very professional and most definitely knew what he was doing, unfortunately the restaurant ran out of the special Nutella desert but Mr. Lester made sure we didn't leave with out our chocolate craving with an on-the-house chocolate mouse cake. Food was phenomenal, service was over the roof, we will most definitely be back after this great experience. Thank You John!
Looks 3.  Dance 3.  Food was basic.  Had sat around for some time before coming to us..  Service was good, but couldnt cover up the poor food.

What happened to the service here???  We had a miserable experience here each step of the way.  First they refused to serve us food at a wedding event at which we were guests because there was not enough seating in the main room, even though we flew in from California to attend, offered to eat at the bar, and shared no responsibility for the planning issue.  Then the food was completely underwhelming, for example, pasta prepared like a teenager had cooked it.  Then they left senior citizens with walkers waiting for their cars standing at the curb for over half an hour during non-busy hours, not to mention $15 for parking.  I will never return to this location, which is sad considering it used to be one of my favorite restaurants.  I think they've been successful so long they're simply not trying anymore.  50 better Italian restaurants within 3 miles.

Maggiano's Little Italy Restaurant, Chicago -- Five Stars for quality of Italian food, service, and amazingly reasonable prices. For dinner I ordered the Linguini La Mare, which consisted of lobster, crab, clams, mussels, and shrimp. It was wonderful and it cost only $25.  Amazing. I finished the seafood, but could not eat all of the linguini. The waiter was attentive; the atmosphere was pleasant.  Maggiano's location is about 5 blocks west of the Miracle Mile (Michigan Avenue) at 516 N Clark. Seating is indoors or outdoors. They offer valet parking for $15.
Simply a garbage place. The staff is extremely rude arrogant and unhelpful. I will NEVER ever order from here.

My husband and I wanted a post-wedding celebration for family from all over the country. We selected the Maggiano's Banquet location at Clark and Grand - they could accommodate our small group (50), the pricing was reasonable and they were very easy to work with - no "nickel and diming" us like most hotels do for every little thing.  Can we bring a wedding cake?  No problem - no extra charge to cut it and serve it on platters at the Sweets Table. Can we play our own music on an iPhone?  No problem - they had a mini sound board and all the connectors. They even boxed up the leftovers in tin foil trays for us and some of our guests.  I would definitely do another event at Maggiano's in a heartbeat.

We entered this restaurant  on a whim , casually,  not expecting anything but the food here was so good .Service was bang on .Server was knowledgeable and attentive .i particularly found their 'Rigatoni d' pasta out of the world . Had a great time .

The only acceptable server to have here is Adrian. He is such a blast. Best person to serve food ever. He also brought us cookies that said welcome to welcome us to Chicago. We just moved here recently. I love this place and Adrian. Great guy. Have fun Adrian

Soooo good!  Unbelievable portions and food that tasted like real home cooking!  The ambience was the quintessential Chicago Italian-American experience, was the perfect dinner for a night in Chicago, and the breaded chicken breast was to die for!

This restaurant had very good quality food and service.  Our waiter was incredibly kind and attentive, a genuinely happy man I regret not catching the name of.  I accidentally knocked over a glass and I felt terribly bad and our waiter was so kind to deal with that situation. Sir, I wish I received your name so I could formally apologize!

I dined at Maggiano's today. It was one of the best experiences I have had dining in a long time. The customer services was exceptional. Our Server, Liz, was, without exception, one of the best Servers I have had whiling dining. She was knowledgeable, efficient, and her focus was to make my dining experience a memorable one, which she did. Lastly, the food was excellent! From appetizer to main course, to desert, everything was prepared and tasted wonderful. I will return without a doubt!

Let me start by saying that I absolutely love Magliano's and have frequented it MANY times. I tend to visit various locations, however 516 North Clark is my primary location. The food was mediocre, definitely not the Maggiano's that i have grown accustomed to! I seriously could've gotten better for from the Olive Garden!!!! Although I do realize that the cook was probably having a not so great of a day in the kitchen, the horrible service was inexcusable! Our waitress was extremely rude whenever something was asked for, be it water refills, condiments etc. She was sarcastic, and uniformed of the questions that were asked of her. Rather than say that she was unsure and that she would find out the answer, she guessed. This is unacceptable especially when food allergies are involved!

One time place. I think I won't come back again. The inner of restaurant smell wired when you just walked in. Like old building smell. They are not pet friendly even having outdoor seats.  Food is OK. Shrimp nisbyoo salty. Bread is juat OK. Appetizers are just so so.

Finally here after many years of missed opportunities because of time issues. BBr and me in for lunch. Had a flatbread which was excellent. Both us custom order a pasta with sausage and marinara and was very good. I had Pelligrino drink and BBr had tea. Excellent service. Upscale setting and all included. Will absolutely return.

Terrible.  Walked in last night at 9 for dinner with my wife.  Place was all but empty.  Still, nobody offered to seat us.  The staff ignored us.  Finally we were seated, and then nobody came to our table for about 10 minutes.  Then the waiter was surly.  So we left.  Place has all the markings of a tourist trap with a surly staff.  There are better options in the area.

Had a wedding rehearsal  dinner here. The menu we planned did not happen. That's right. The menu I tasted beforehand and selected was not served.  Food was slow coming out. Not enough. And this  was a family style package. And, our guests were not big eaters.  Boy was I unhappy. Layers of mistakes. Systemic failure.  Understaffed with no planned coat rack--- in the middle of winter. Fortunately the wedding reception elsewhere was perfect.  Days later, The management handled this well understanding from a report what happened and responded with a credit -- however I am beyond incredulous that this  could have happened. Certainly would have preferred paying double without aggravation rather than what happened.

Great food, great atmosphere! Our hotel was right around the corner from this place, and we had read some pretty good reviews about it, so we decided to give it a shot - we were not disappointed! The food was very rich in flavor, and the portions were generous. We split a mini dessert sampler, which between the four of us in my family, was very satisfying. All the desserts were homemade, and all had great flavor.  Our waiter, Victor, was wonderful as well. Very friendly, totally understood our sense of humor, and offered great suggestions for items on the menu. He was also very attentive, and made sure that each of his tables had a great experience dining in. The atmosphere of the restaurant itself was also pleasant, and though quite a few tables were filled, it still seemed very quiet during the course of our meal. If you're in the area and looking for some tasty Italian food, I would highly reccomended stopping by!
They have the best bread baskets. The bread is so soft, warm, and fluffy. I recommend the fettuccine alfredo and the lighter take option, the mom's lasagna, and the four-cheese ravioli.

Hard to beat the original Maggiano's .if you have one in your town it's just not like this.  Old school atmosphere, but a flavor of old Italy that was perfect.  Is it the best....naw...but it's very good. Wait staff was efficient and friendly.  Reasonable for what you get to me.  You will enjoy the family style fare, and you won't leave hungry.

Very mediocre. Nice looking place, but... The calamari were rubbery and seemed less than fresh. The chicken piccata became known at our table as "the chicken without flavor." The eggplant parm was soft and lifeless, buried in lackluster sauce. Pasta with sausage - bland. Pasta primavera had a few tomatoes and carrots, and maybe a bit of bland broccoli and cauliflower. The bread was good -- not great, but at least, fresh. Chocolate cake and bread pudding in vanilla sauce were good, but not great. Like eating at Applebee's but for three times the price. Compare with Macaroni Grill, but not as good.

Stumbled upon Maggianos in search of a quiet place to have dinner, that should have been a sign. The food all has the same frozen food taste and lacks any freshness. Best thing about the place is the staff which is friendly and helpful but if I were them I would be looking for another place to work. It must have had it's charm years ago, but in todays competitive food industry this place really falls short of any expectation.

I have to say that the spaghetti with meatballs was the closest thing i have smelled and tasted to my great grandma's pasta.. She died in 2009 and i have missed her pasta so much and was really happy to have a pasta that reminded me of her. The restaurant here is just so great. Our waitress was very wonderful and the ambiance is nice.

Pasta was bland , food did no taste freshly made you might as well go to chilis or Applebee's this is not what I expected. The wine tasted stale and chicken a member of party ordered was over cooked. Never again

Maggiano's is one of the best chain restaurants in the country, in my humble opinion. The food is always good (from the appetizer to the dessert), the portions are hearty, it's affordable and the employees at times can be as jolly as the elves on Christmas Eve. Whenever I come here I usually do the Marco's Meal for Two. This includes any appetizer, flatbread or two side salads, two classic pastas, a dessert to share and two classic pastas to take home...all for the low price of $40-$42. Like hello your wallet will appreciate this! My favorite dishes here are the * Taylor Street Baked Ziti (a lot of calories so get this on a cheat day) * Baked Eggplant Parmesan * Gnocchi & Italian Sausage * Chicken Saltimbocca * Chocolate Zuccotto Cake

It's started  here  20 years ago during cold and windy winters i Was 31 (1996) now 51... Nothing changed, you should try the frutti di marre pasta it's like you eat in Praiano on Amalfi coast... Thank's my waiter cassidy !

My wife and I had an amazing first experience here. Horatio the sous chef and Robin our waiter treated us absolutely wonderfully. We felt very cared for and included. Wonderful and magical experience. Thanks, guys.

Came here as we are on vacation and staying near by. After seeing good reviews decided to give it a go.  We were more than happy with our decision. The food and service was brilliant. Our server, James, was friendly and explained the menu and food perfectly. The house special deal for two looked brilliant at $42.95 including appetiser, entrees , dessert and another entree to take home!!! How awesome!!! As we are travelling and want to try other restaurants we decided to order an entree each only. The pasta was amazing.  We had spaghetti meatballs and baked eggplant Parmesan, both we tasty and fresh. The serving sizes were large and we couldn't finish them all!!  The atmosphere is charming and you can choose from either table seating in a main area or booths and high tables in another area. We loved the atmosphere and feeling if this place.  Would definitely recommend eating here.

We went here on a Wednesday night for dinner. First impression was poor, as the hostess had our party of two wait for a table in a virtually empty restaurant. We were seated at a 6-top , and received service from a soft-spoken server who hardly said a word, let alone introduce himself.  The 3 stars are for the food. 50% was excellent, and 50% was awful. Great shrimp scampi and great lemon cookies. Awful stale bread and bland stuffed mushrooms. I feel like this is one of those places where you have to know what to get in order to not go hungry.  Service and atmosphere were underwhelming. For some reason, we were placed right next to the very loud kitchen where the floor shook every time a server walked past. Our waiter came to life only when it was time for the check. I think 3 stars is fairly generous.

I've dinned at most of the Maggiano's in Illinois but recently in the past couple of months decided to try their carry-out's at this location and have to say that I am really disappointed in their consistency with their entrees.  The two entree's I always get is the Maggiano's salad and Linguine and clam sauce (white). When I dine-in these two entrees are always prepared correctly but when I order to take out, one of the dishes is  always lacking something such as missing bacon bits or too much onions  in the salad and the clam sauce which I always ask for extra, is always prepared differently (too much olive oil or too less).  Either way the service is always impeccable. Parking can be tough in this area but valet is available  Would I come back here, of course but only for dining in from now on.
Ordered take out while in a bit of a pickle but Brette was more than helpful and saved the night.  Thumbs up to her and the Alfredo at Maggianos!

Before the eyes of millions of judging Chicago foodies from their Yelp apps, I must say: Maggianos has provided the best dining experience I have had in all my 7 months living in Chicago (twice!) each weekend I try a new local restaurant trying to help family businesses thrive...but who among you can give me high quality Italian (endless) bread, a salad, a pasta, AND A TAKE HOME PASTA, for $20? Nay, only Maggianos can do this. Wherever I eat in Chicago, I always find myself repeating to my boyfriend: this is good/decent/disgusting/etc., but I can't justify eating here again when I can eat so much more at such a great price with Maggianos. It's plain foolish. I love literally everything at this place and it seems no sacrifice to me to order the classic pastas in order to get a take home additional pasta. These dishes are so damn good and so filling. It makes me very happy. As a matter of fact, I am writing this review after sadly having a very nasty Italian experience for 4x as much money at another, non chain Italian restaraunt in Chicago. I'm too poor to take those kinds of risks anymore. I'll be at Maggianos from now on!

The atmosphere was great. Lighting was a little low.. Food was incredible. The meal for two deal is great - a side, two entrees, a dessert & two full entrees to go! Absolutely unheard of. Food was hot when it came out, everyone loved what they ordered & we left full and happy!! Would definitely recommend - and make reservations before hand!

So good so good so goodddd!!!!!  The drinks were great the entrees were amazing and the dessert was to die for!  The server did a nice job recommending a glass of wine, I ended up trying the Boom Boom! It was pretty yummy. The Caesar salad side portion is great for an appetizer and the lighter fare menu options are really amazing and filling! I had the Alfredo with asparagus and I had the shrimp instead of chicken. We all shared the sampler for dessert and it just really made our night even better, the butter cake was my favorite with the cheesecake falling in a close second!!  Worth a night out for sure!  Just don't try the mints on the way out, kinda weird....

Awesome blossom! My lady and I came thru the other night looking for some hearty pasta and Maggiano's delivered. I did their famous Rigatoni D which was excellent and she did the Chicken Marsala which she enjoyed as well. I didn't get a chance to try her dish because I was too busy inhaling my Rigatoni. That marsala sauce the rigatoni comes in is delicious! To share, we did an order of their grilled asparagus, which was a tad bit over salted for my liking. But other than that it was quite an enjoyable experience. Our waiter was prompt and I can't find anything to complain about really. Price point isn't too bad as well. You're looking at about $13 - $20 per person for an entree and cocktails starting at $10 if you decide to go down that road.  PS don't for your Lettuce Entertain You Rewards card to rack up those points! 'Til next time, cheers!

The service was great! Our server was David and his service was really well. I came here to eat dinner with my boyfriend to celebrate his birthday and David was nice enough to have a dessert platter for him before getting the check. I got the steak with garlic mash potatoes and my boyfriend got the shrimp scampi pasta. Dinner was good although I wish it was hotter. I felt like although the food arrived quick, it was not hot enough. Everything was delicious though. :)

It seems as if I only end up at this location of Maggiano's for work functions.  Food is the same as other Maggiano's. Larger portions, nothing is ever bad. I like the pastas and appetizers. If you are ordering off the menu, you will more than likely have take away. Banquets are always professionaly served.  Prices are reasonable. Good central location, valet parking available or meter depending on the time of day and a bit of luck.

I ordered a lighter take fettuccine alfredo and it was delicious! It had chicken and asparagus. However, my friends ordered the regular fettuccine alfredo and it was very plain as it did not contain any vegetables or meat and they had to ask to switch to the lighter take of it. It was still a good place to eat!

Cue Neon Trees:  Animal Here we go againnnn I feel the chemicals kickin' innnn.... .....orrr here we go again with another chain review. Eeek me thinks Yelpers across the fruited plain muster up a collective, disdainful eye roll.  Ahh well.el oh el. I've said on a number of occasions, unlike the late great MLK's delivery of a much welcomed and needed message to our nation, *not* all chains (sic) are created equal. Maggiano's can bring it just fine with loads of delicious pasta in environs that feel old world Italian, comfy, cozy, even though i know f*ck all about old world Italian blah blah blah.  But I do know comfy and cozy.  That said, It's PASTA folks.  Not complicated or revolutionary. You know what you came for and get a fair result.  Deal, enjoy, etc.

Found this 'mini'  chain in Orlando and loved it so when we visited Chicago,  this was a must stop for my italian loving family.  Prices are extremly reasonable. Chef will visit the table to custom make a mask for my daughter.  Very unusually in Minnesota.  Sever was friendly although a bit forgetful. He had a big table arrive right after us which didn't help. Had to ask for butter twice.  Food is amazing IMO. Yes it is chain but the flavor is like a small Italian restaurant...i swear.  It is pretty loud so don't expect it to be a quaint romantic place.  My favorite is the gnocchi.   My wife loves the ravioli. Never found room for dessert but they look amazing.

The food.  I'll preface this by saying I don't really like pasta, so I mostly skipped over that part of the menu.  The rest of the menu though was very uninspiring.  The chicken dishes all very generic.  The salads all pretty much the same.  Nothing creative or new on this menu.  Think spaghetti and meatballs or chicken parm.  Been there, done that.  I landed on the chopped salad with salmon.  Salad was fine.  No complaints but nothing to rave about.  The salmon was dry and overcooked.  I needed some lemon squeezed on, which I guess is my fault for not asking for.  Would not recommend based on the food I had. The service.  Our server was fine.  Nice and fairly attentive.  My biggest complaint was a photographer that was walking around.  I really don't know how to describe this.  It was like the photographer at an amusement park trying to sell you a souvenir photo.  A woman came by with a camera and asked if we wanted a group photo.  She said it was free about 4 different times, which is a red flag right there.  After her very long and obnoxious monologue, we agreed.  We had a large group of about 15 so she took a group photos and then some smaller photos of the couples.  The whole thing took way to long, like 5 minutes.  It was very distracting.  Then she comes by at the end of the meal with the  group photo and individual photos.  She says the group photo is free and the individual ones are $15.  I really have no idea what this was about.  It was tacky, uninvited, rude, and distracting.  This is something I would see at a 4 year olds birthday party.  Not at a restaurant that I'm guessing is trying to be fine dining.  There was nothing fine about this.  Just so tacky.  Not necessarily because they were charging for the photos, just the whole thing in general.  We couldn't get her away from our table fast enough.  It really was one of the most bizarre things that's happened to me at a dinner.  It left an awful impression.

I finally tried this pretty iconic spot, yes it can be pricey, but the best deal I'd say is the 2 for $40 deal, for 2 people, you get an app to share, one pasta dish each, a dessert to split, and then another pasta dish to take home! That's a damn good deal, and all the food was really good, we had the calamari app, split the lasagna and sausage ziti dishes, and couldnt even get through the chocolate cake it was so big, and to take home I got the spaghetti and meatballs, which 3 days later was still really good to eat

Wow. Where do I start? We get several emails telling us to come in and eat. We finally decide to do so based on a special they were offering. If you've been to this location you know it's an extremely busy intersection. We drove around for at least 20 minutes looking for a parking spot. When we finally found one and paid. We arrived at the door. They said they closed at 11 PM. It was now 10:20 PM. So we thought this would be awesome and we can make it in on time to eat. To our surprise the door was locked. We were both confused and wondered what was going on. We ask the valet guy if they were actually closed. And he said "they close early because it was slow tonight" I don't know about anyone else but I thought that was kind of ridiculous. So we seen another couple walk in and we followed right behind them at a side door that was open. Once we got in all the employees were just walking past acting as if we were invisible until we stopped one of them and asked "are you actually closed now?" He replied " Yes our doors are locked" we replied "Really because we just walked in." He seemed a little stunned after that and said " I have to go get somebody. Let me check" He went to a bartender who looked at us then turned away to go get someone else. As if he didn't want to deal with us.  After that we looked and said "No thanks" and just walked out. Congrats. You just lost two customers and yes I will be hitting unsubscribe to your email blast. Horrible.

I love this place. The ambiance is a bit old school charm with a splash of romantic feel. The food is awesome and well flavored. I had the chicken marsala and my husband had chicken saltimbocca and we both finished it all (stuffed, I might add). I am a customer service nut, so I'm always pleased with the high level of great customer service received here. Overall,  a great dinner, and I will definitely return.

Quick update. . . Maggianos has still, two business days later, not responded to me at all. They have requested contact information but not used it. I request direct information for various folks in the corporate office from both David (who identified himself as the GM at the local) and via Brinkers International website. I have not received it from either.   It seems to me that they simply do not care at all about the fact that they have lost a prospective long term customer nor that they have now lost an opportunity to rehabilitate their name with our organization.  I have now retained the services of AG Social Media Management to ensure that the most people possible learn of my organization's experience with Maggiano's Little Italy and their parent company, Brinkers International.   As we now plan our remaining 2nd and 3rd quarter events (22 of them) neither Maggiano's, Chili's nor any other Brinkers owner organization will be considered.  I plan on doing my best to ensure that no individual nor organization faces the challenges, disappointment and disrespect that I did.

The food is savory and generously portioned. Service is polite and efficient, helpful when it comes to making a decision. If you sign up for their eclub and Lettuce Entertain You you receive tons of coupons. For $36 including tax and tip I got an appetizer (ate half), meal (ate half), a meal to go, a huge slice of cake (ate a 6th) and my drink. It'll probably take me a day and a half or two to finish the rest!

Great customer service, great food,great waiter named MICHAEL IN CHICAGO ...felt like family and felt very cared for by him! He was familiar  with the menu,service was good time and he remembered  everything I said down to why we came here from which I added a note about why online. GREAT EMPLOYEE! !!!MAGGIANOS IS LUCKY TO HAVE HIM! I will be back.

I've been to this Maggiano's as well as several of their other locations (Oak Brook and Skokie) many, many times.  Though the service was a bit slow on my last visit to their River North location, Maggiano's is predictable and great.  Their bread is delicious, food is wonderful, and service is usually pretty attentive.  I also love that they give you a pasta to take home with each order of their classic pastas!  Definitely recommend.
