Overall I'm a Maggiano's fan, though I think service at this location could be better.  We came in for dinner on New Year's Day, thought it didn't seem crazy busy enough to justify the service downfalls.  The waitress certainly wasn't busy enough to worry about writing down our order, she simply took them and walked away.  We ordered the classic pasta deal, which included a second pasta to take home.  Our food arrived as ordered, and had to ask 3 times for more bread before we finally got any.  Later the waitress completely forgot to bring out the take home pastas.  We reminded her, and told her again exactly which ones we wanted, since she hadn't written it down.  She brought out a bag with the pastas, but it turned out there were only 2 of the 3 in there.  We waved her down for the 3rd one, which she again asked what type.  We came home to find that all 3 were the wrong type, despite telling her 3 times which we had ordered.  Other times I've been here have been better, so perhaps this was just a fluke, though it was disappointing to not get what we ordered for take out, and not realize until it's too late.

This was my family's second visit to this location. We'll definitely drive a little further next time to another one. They gave our table away after being 10 minutes late for our reservation so we sat in the bar area...service wasn't the best but the food of course was great.
The worst service ever. It took me an hour to wait for the dessert. Will never come here again!

Maggiano's never disappoints! Christmas Eve dinner was amazing delicious as usual. The atmosphere is friendly relaxing and great for family style or dinner for one dining! Had a 5:45pm Christmas Eve reservation and was seated within 15 minutes of arrival. Not bad considering it was packed plus a holiday. Our server was friendly and offered suggestions on the specials being served that night. Wine of corse Cabernet Sauvignon, Appetizer decided to go with the Tomato Caprese, fresh mozzarella and tomato salad. Main course went with Shrimp Fra Diavolo, hand-cut Fettuccine, pan-seared shrimp, garlic tomatoes in diavolo sauce. Finally the best part of any meal is dessert! Decided to try the new dessert sampler and was so glad we did. Five desserts, some of their best on the menu. Chocolate Zuccotto Bites,Warm Apple Crostrada, Tiramisu, NY Style Cheesecake and finally Gigi's Butter Cake! Entire dining experience was fabulous as usual! The food is always fresh, authentic and great variety on the menu. Five plus stars Maggiano's five plus!!!

This was our first time here. It's kind of surprising to me because I thought we had hit up all of the chain restaurants already. We arrived for lunch and were immediately sat in a big comfy booth (with reservations of course). Now for the food: We started off with the caprese. It was good. The mozzarella was good and the tomatoes weren't cut too thick. It was drizzled with some sauce, I think white balsamic vinaigrette. My husband said it was too sour, but I like a little bit of tang. I always order a side of kalamata olives with caprese. I had the salmon ceasar salad. The salmon was cooked perfectly, but I always request for my salmon to be cooked at about medium rare to medium. Overcooked salmon is the worst. The ceasar dressing was good, but I'm not sure if that's what I ate that was chock full of garlic. My husband had the margherita flatbread. He said that it was just ok. Our little one had the cheese ravioli. She devoured it. I had a hard time trying to decide if I should give 3 or 4 stars. The food was good. Nothing really spectacular. I gave it a 4 because the server was really nice and attentive and she was working her butt off for the needy table next to us and we really go full on with their specialties. I will go back and maybe next time try something else.

Went in with out family, had a horrible experience. Received a call from one of the "managers" Dave/David, who claimed that we would have a gift certificate mailed to us. A month later, no gift certificate, email or call back. I would not have even wasted my time writing this review, if I didn't get a call promising me something and not delivering, after an already shitty situation.

This is one of my all time favorite Italian places in Chicago. Sure, it's a "chain" but the food is reliable and good. Service is decent as well. I almost always get the same thing---spaghetti and meatball. I also get another to go on the house! The apple crostata is excellent. It is served warm with vanilla bean ice cream. I like the Maggiano salad as well as the chopped salad. Stuffed mushrooms are good as well. There is valet parking at this location but is accessible by public transportation. My friend and I like to come here and sit in the lounge / bar area.  There are a number of high tops and booths that can accommodate up to four people. Table space could be a little tight if one orders a bunch of food. The atmosphere is very casual and relaxed--perfect for a quick catch up meal with a friend.

Britney was our server and she by far has been one of the best servers I've encountered whiling dining out in Chicago! And I am a Chicago NATIVE! We ordered calamari and bruschetta. For our main course we had lasagna and baked eggplant. DELICIOUS! Along with a glass of Cabernet sauvignon. The entire dining experience exuded my own home hospitality. Britney showed us the face of fine dining while making us feel at home. She even went as far as calling the manager out to our table just so we can voice my boyfriends feelings towards the nonas pound cake not being on the menu. But overall I'm excited to come back and visit Britney again .

We came with a group of 9.  The waiter, Emil (hope the spelling is right), was amazing!  Chef came out and met our single guest with Gluten issues and cooked her everything we had but Gluten free.  Nice!!!  We did the family style plan and it was fabulous!  An abundance of food and we took a lot home with us.  Everything was wonderful!  The staff was the best!

I went to,this disgusting restaurant for a Christmas party, and I have to say This, was the most disgusting, salty Italian food(if that's what you call it) I,have ever eaten. The service was nonexistent, bad employee attitudes, lousy cocktails and the worst dessert served without being offered any coffee  Or beverage. this was truly a waste of my precious Friday evening especially A few weeks before Christmas....The Salmon. Pork and pasta that were brought to,the table was "cold." if I,had  to pay for,this garbage I,would be QUITE UPSET....I intend on calling the Management to let them know.also! DO NOT BOOK AN EVENT HERE!  They have lost their,touch!

Made a reservation for 8:30 for a party of 6. Showed up at 7:30 on the off chance they may be able to take us earlier. As expected they could not. Asked about a destination nearby to get drinks until our 8:30 reservation. After going across the street for drinks and returning for our 8:30 reservation was told it would be more than an hour plus  before being seated. I understand back-ups happening. . . it would have been helpful had they told us at 7:30 that they were experiencing issues. Needless to say it turned into a disappointing night of trying to celebrate with friends from the suburbs. They ended up going back to the burbs for dinner and we stayed in the city and went to Harry Carey's. Most likely will never be back to Maggiano's. All the manager from Magginano's could say is we apologize ( he truley  didn't seem to care in all honesty) after they apparently overbooked.  It's kind of like flying on United . . . not an optimal experience. Hell may be better!

This was our second visit here and it was exactly like the first. Great service and great food. We like this one better than the one in Indianapolis, where we live, because it just seems more authentic. It was packed, but we were seated right at our reservation time. Michael was our server and he was very friendly and attentive. The entire staff behaves like the result of great training and experience. We shared the Caprese Salad, which was good and then shared an entree of Fettuccine with parmesan and olive oil. Tasty! It was my wife's birthday and they gave her a complimentary plate of cookies and whipped cream. I had the mini Creme Brulee. Both were good. The prices are very reasonable. With a bottle of wine, our bill, with tax, was $64. If you want Italian in an informal, old world atmosphere, then make a reservation. Walk-ins had a long wait.
The lasagna is the greatest thing on earth. I want to win the lottery, not for the money, but so I can fill a jacuzzi full of their lasagna, sit in it, turn on the jets, and just be happy. Mmmmmm.

Travelled into Chicago for the weekend and Maggiano's was a few blocks from our hotel so we stopped in. First, the staff got us seated quickly and were very friendly. Our glasses of water were being poured before we even had our coats off and HOT, fresh bread was on our table immediately. My husband got Mom's lasagna and I chose the butternut squash ravioli (seasonal). Both dishes were amazing! Also, they have an amazing deal that you get a dinner sized order of any of their house pastas to take home when you order a pasta dish for your meal! Score! Dinner and lunch for the next day taken care of with one stop? Yes, please! Finally, my husband and I opted out of dessert but our daughters' desserts came with their meals. However, our server ended up bringing out an extra plate of cookies anyway for my husband and I free of charge for dessert! We were beyond impressed with the service and quality of for d at Maggiano's!

I'm a New Yorker working in Chicago and it's my last visit. So I've decided that I should wrap up my visits with hitting some "staples". According to some Chicago transplants in NY Maggiano's must be visited. Glad I listened the Bacon Bruschetta was amazing. You must try it.
Okay so I went back here lol. What can I say I love pasta!!! Food was great, drinks we're okay however the wait time is extremely long on weekends ever with an reservation.  I'm satisfied :)

We were looking for a place with good food and quick service, because we had to be at a movie by 1010pm last night. We got here about 9pm and I had the salmon and she had the flatbread pizza. Both were out in less than 10mins and it was delicious. It was my 1st time at this location, but I've been to other locations.
FANTASTIC FOOD. Prompt and friendly service. So good I ended up eating here TWICE  during my three day stay here in Chicago.

I really thought I would give this restaurant more stars in my review. =( The prices were reasonable in my opinion but the food was very mediocre. Service by the wait staff was pleasant though I wish the ladies at the hostess station would be friendlier. Sad to say that Maggiano's isn't the same as I remember it - the food for sure has tanked.
Service was great and food was amazing! I had the Taylor Street Baked Ziti. The lighter take was delicious. I was in town by myself and I can't wait to bring my family here for dinner!

My wife and I normally dine at Maggiano's in Old Orchard but decided to try this location since we were in the area.   We had an appetizer of Spiced Shrimp Bruschetta (which was not spicy at all, a good thing for us). We then had entrees of Fettucini Alfredo with Chicken and Lite Baked Ziti, which came with chicken sausage.   The food was not great but decent.  We always enjoy the fresh bread, bottle of olive oil and unlimited grated Parmesan (which we completely doused everything with).  We had a very nice server and rate it at 3.5 stars.

Went on a Friday evening to celebrate our co-workers retirement.  Received Fine Dining quality service from our server Jake.  I always enjoy the food at Maggiano's but the service can be hit or miss at times.  Despite it being a crowded Friday night, Jake was super attentive, made spectacular recommendations and even had a Retirement Tiramasu prepared for her dessert.  We had the Family Style meal where the food kept flowing.  Everything was delicious and we left feeling like we were welcomed and cherished as customers and friends.  Jake exemplifies what a service professional should be.

If you want good take-out, don't go here.  Visited a friend and we placed a order for delivery. The food wasn't even hot and lacked a lot of flavor.  I was very disappointed being that we paid a decent amount of money for bland cold food.

I had a great visit to this location as I was in Chicago for the weekend and had not been to a Maggiano's in awhile. Service was great and the lasagne, bread and mushrooms were awesome. If you are in the area and in the mood for good Italian American food then go for it!

Amazing place all around ! We walked in and were greeted at the host stand by Destiny and Savannah beautiful classy mixed ladies dressed so professional and hair and makeup perfect. We ordered stuffed mushrooms and sangria to start and they are very generous with the size of their appetizers and the red sangria was delicious and has you feeling good after a glass. Their pitchers are reasonably priced. For dinner I ordered their filet mignon and a side of garlic spinach bc I was staying away from carbs and wanted to enjoy cheesecake instead for dessert. The filet was beyond tender and juicy and the garlic spinach was incredible. A perfect choice. Our waiter was so friendly and knew all the dishes. For desert we had their cheesecake that could be split by two ppl and was so creamy with a wonderful graham cracker crust. Everything wonderful here and great for families with kids or just a date night. The management should be proud of their staff, great service !

Wonderful food and atmosphere. We had a larger party of 16 or so and the food was served family style. There sausage and peppers were great and even though I am not much of a tiramisou fan, i had theres and it was super good! I would recommend this as a place to go for italian

Maggiano's is a classic downtown Chicago experience. Not having been here in years, I decided to stop in and give it a whirl. Used to be a value, and a great experience. I am not sure what has happened here, or if this is a temporary management debacle, or just an off night, but what a mess! -One bartender, people waiting and drumming their fingers everywhere, complaining about service.  -One server. -Food wait for salad 45 min - 1 hour.  -Messed up orders.  -No place setting first time around. Or, until chasing someone around for it.  -Orders sent back.  Real estate is too valuable and competition looms large around Grand & Clark, for Maggiano's to operate like this.  Please, get it together, Maggiano's (so sad!), or I fear your days at this corner are numbered.

Really enjoyed this place. Our party of 7 had pasta, salmon, gnocchi, chicken piccata. Extensive and fairly priced menu. I love that you can order 'lighter' versions of some of the dinners. I got the lighter version of chicken piccata - 2 thin chicken cutlets on top of pasta and fresh steamed spinach. It was delicious. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We had wine (offered in 2 'sizes'). Too full for dessert. Excellent ambiance - not fancy, just casual and comfortable. Well trained, friendly and attentive staff. Thoroughly enjoyed - highly recommend.

Had a wonderful dinner here Friday evening with my fiance. We were seated right away, no reservations. Service was excellent, if a little rushed. I had the mushroom ravioli and my fiance had the chicken Parmesan. One blip was I was brought cheese ravioli, but within minutes they recognized their mistake. No biggee. Dinner was excellent. Drinks were great, and very reasonably priced. I had an excellent Ketel One martini and it was $10. Imagine that. Not bad at all. Oh, and when you order from the classics (my dish) you get one free to take home. How awesome is that? We shared an excellent, large slice of lasagna the next day for lunch, for free! Highly recommend.

Stopped into the restaurant recently due to a Lettuce Entertain You promotion plus I just plain forget about this restaurant.  Shame on me. I was greeted by the hostess and opted to enjoy the beautiful day and sit outdoors.  I was greeted by the busser who pour the water and took away the additional table settings and brought the bread.  The bread is sooooo good.   Shortly after that, the server, Kevin, had stopped by and greeted me went over the menu and took my drink order.  When he had returned I had place my order of the Chicken Francese.   The food runner had brought the food within 10- 12 minutes which was about the correct time, The food was fantastic.  Kevin would check in with me and made sure my soda was filled.   Unfortunately, I was unable to try any of their desserts since I needed to head to work. I would highly recommend Maggiano's and Kevin.

Maggiano's used to plop a big basket of warm focaccia on the table before you ordered.  It was my favorite part of the meal, and when they stopped doing it, I stopped coming here.  Also, it had became so popular the wait for a table was obnoxiously long. Last weekend, we were looking for a place to eat before the band started at Blue Chicago.  This is one of the choices that popped up on Yelp, and since it's just across the street, we chose it.  Had no trouble getting a reservation the same day. The crowds must have moved on to trendier places. It had been years since I'd eaten here, and I was happy to discover they still serve good Italian food.  I started with my old favorite, the Maggiano's salad: crispy prosciutto, blue cheese, red onion and a slightly sweet dressing... I'd forgotten how great it is.  Followed it with the mussels Tuscan style.  The mussels were plump and perfectly cooked, but the broth would have benefited from more seasoning.  (Soaked up the broth with the non-focaccia Italian bread.) My friend, a light eater, had one of the flatbreads (a meal by itself), plus the gnocchi and Italian sausage in a tomato vodka cream sauce.  I had several bites of the gnocchi, and it was heavenly.  We split the six lemon cookies, just as light and lemony as I'd remembered them.  The coffee was pretty good, too.  What wasn't so good was our server.  He was efficient, but so detached it bordered on unfriendly... not at all like the staff you almost always find at a Lettuce restaurant.  Now that that this restaurant isn't so crowded, I'm definitely returning.  There are now lighter versions of some of the standard dishes (complete with calorie count), which look interesting. Note to Maggiano's:  please bring back the focaccia basket.
Love their eggplant Parmesan and mushroom ravioli!

When we arrived at Maggiano's on 07/30/15 around 6 pm @ the address on the invitation which was @ 516 N Clark.  We asked the hostess inside the restaurant where the seminar was to which she responded in a very snotty attitude that wasn't appreciated.  Several of the other attendees also noted her attitude.  Is this really the face the Maggiano's wants to portray at their establishment.  I hope she gets reprimanded for her behavior.  In arriving to check in one of the other attendees Barb asked me if I was nisei (2nd generation Japanese/American) to which I responded I am Sansei (3rd generation Japanese/American).  Then she asked me about Manzanar which is a one of the camps where the Japanese/Americans were incarcerated during World War II.  I told her my cousin Cory produced and directed a film called "The Fisherman of Manzanar".  As it turns out she knows my cousin, WOW what a small world.  We went to Maggiano's in River North to attend a dinner seminar on financial planning which proved to be very informative and raised enough concerns about our current plans to raise questions.  The presenter Mary was very informative and gave information that made us want set up a future meeting with her to discuss our current plans. After the presentation they served us a family style dinner which consisted of a house salad, meat lasagna, breaded parmesan encrusted tilapia w/spinach, mushroom ravioli al forno, chicken piccata.  For dessert they had tiramisu & profiteroles.  All in all it was a great presentation with a very good meal with some very enjoyable dinner companions

Went to this place last night with a group of 9 including 4 kids 11 and under. The staff was fabulous with us and the setting was perfect. The food is really good especially for a chain. And in Chicago, the price is right. If you're looking for a "nice" dinner with a large group and children, I highly recommend it! Having a "lighter fare" portion of the dinner dishes is a great idea too!! For an appetizer you can't go wrong with the calamari. The wine list isn't bad either.

I gotta say, I'm a big fan of Lettuce Entertain You restaurants.  They are consistent with their quality and their food is always "above average". They're not setting the world on fire, but they offer a good experience, and as an old English monk (I used to be a Benedictine monk) would describe things as "sturdy" that word applies here.  Their food is "sturdy".  It's not daring, it's meant to please the masses, it fills you up, and is predictable (in a good way).   It's kinda like someone said, "hey! here's an idea.  Let's take Olive Garden, tart it up a bit, and make it an acceptable evening out!" Cuz no one says, we all met at Olive Garden and had a great time!  Don't get me wrong, I love, LOVE Olive Garden...I really do because it's really great chain restaurant food.   Maggiano's is such a place.  It has nice atmosphere and decent food.  I usually describe everything I've had there, but if you look at the menu, it's typical of every "American-Italian" dish you've had with no surprises, not over seasoned.   Definitely pay $25 for the Lettuce Entertain You frequent diner's club.  You get the money back almost instantly, and within a year and a half I have over $200 to spend in food, and I don't go there all the time.  It's a good deal.

Review based mostly on service, food was decent, service was crap. Went in yesterday for dinner by myself, sat at the bar. Bar staff not terribly concerned I was there - was a few minutes before even asked if I wanted a menu or a drink. There was couple sitting a few seats down from me - pretty sure a hooker and her pimp. Bar and restaurant not very busy. The slender female bartender with the tan quite possibly the most unpleasant bartender ever. Her co-worker, a guy with black curly hair was at least pleasant. But things like 10 minutes after asking (do you have to ask?) for bread, leaned over and asked "didja' get yer' bread"? I didn't. Then it was still 5 minutes later.  Also when you order appetizers and soup, why would a server at a supposed fine-ish restaurant ask you "do you care what order your food comes"? Why ask? Appetizers and soup come first. Why do you have to ask a customer if they want sugar with espresso? Just bring it.
Came here for a birthday dinner. The food was amazing and the service was even better. We actually have one in Houston so I'd totally check it out.

Loved it!! I can't believe I've never been to Maggianos until now, but it was totally worth the wait! Our server was excellent, our food was great, we will return. Love that we got to take home dinner for tomorrow too!!

There is no better wedding venue in the Chicago city limits! Not only was Maggiano's a great deal, but the food was incredible and our guests raved about it all night. The dessert table was a particular hit! The space was also so classic, with chandeliers and dark panelling. More than anything, though, the service was amazing. We had lots of kids, and everyone felt completely comfortable. Samantha was a HUGE help, from setting up our decorations to making sure we had a signature wintery drink and a stress-free night. She even got us a room for the kids upstairs. We also had our own waitress and she boxed our food at the end of the night, so thoughtful since we were too busy to eat much during the reception. Also, the location was spectacular. Guests could walk right back to the hotel across the street. The perfect spot for a fun, classic Chicago wedding!

I am very confused by people's reviews on here. I've had really good Italian food at places like Coco Pazzo and this place doesn't even come close. The food is very generic and it doesn't seem worth the money. The service was good and the restaurant looks nice, but I don't want to go back.

Quick and simple..... Place is awesome. We got in and no reservations on a Saturday evening around 6:30pm. They told us we had to wait an hour or sit in the bar section which had a dinning area. We chose that and and got seated right away. Our server David was great as well as the food. We didn't wait long at all for our appetizers or food.

Last night was my first time at this location and I was not disappointed!  I had the seasonal shrimp salad, chicken and sausage flatbread & the chicken parmesan. All the food was so, SO good and it all came out in a timely fashion.  The ENTIRE staff was extremely pleasant, especially my servers John and Ben.  They answered all my questions about the menu, cleared away dirty plates and were just extremely personable.  They made my experience so wonderful! I will definitely be back!!!  Also the bellini sangria is a must! So delicious!  Thanks John and Ben for being so awesome, I can't wait to come back!

needs rehab, start with the check in staff.. Use to be such a wonderful place to go.. now it old and stuffy.. shame it lost its luster... Lately the svc has been a 10 + @ some Lettuce restaurants......or in this case zero

I have to say that Maggiano's Little Italy gets not only 5 stars but also in 2015 the Richlatino Top Spots in Downtown Chicago Award as well. They are very professional at giving what the customer wants which is excellent customer service. There famous Patricia's Cheese Ravioli which by far is the best Cheese Ravioli I've ever tasted makes me want to sing a certain Ravioli song. Besides the Ravioli they have amazing Italian food and drinks I will tell you yummers! I can guarantee if your in town come down and stop by because they get the Richlatino's Top Spots to eat at downtown. This coming from The Richlatino Chicagorican Fedora Hat wearer that speaks Spanglish, not Spanish definitely want to stop there! If you are Gluten Free they cater to you as well and are well trained in handling the food so you don't have a Food sensitivity issue.

Elegant and welcoming - that's how I'd describe this place. It's almost like going to my wealthy aunt & uncle's house... It's really well-appointed and above my standards, but they make it very clear that they're happy to have me there. Some restaurants are upscale too, but they're trying to be exclusive... I'm not a big fan of that.  If you're looking for a way to hipster-brag to your Instagram friends about how obscure both you and your meal are, you're in the wrong place.  I prefer being greeted warmly whether I'm in a 3-piece suit from work or in jeans and a Cubs hat because I've been running around the city all day. Maggiano's does that. And they play Sinatra-style music all day, which is another bonus. The food is amazing comfort-style all-day kind of cooking, their pasta is phenomenal, and the veal is excellent - their portions are enough for at least two meals, so expect leftovers. It's not a diet place by default (though it can be if you try, and they are very helpful with any dietary modifications), so expect to leave happy & full. They have career-waitstaff, so everyone seems like they've been there for years and can offer suggestions on what appetizers go best with the entrees, what wines go well with whatever... They know their stuff. And they're still really friendly.  Sure, they're a chain that has a few locations in the suburbia. They're a Lettuce Entertain You chain, so you're getting an excellent meal with no pretense. We like this place so much that we chose their banquet center as our wedding venue, and couldn't have been happier with the way everything went.  We keep going, and will definitely keep coming back.

I have to give this place a 5 star rating because they made my proposal a wild success. Every Christmas, my fiancee and I spend a few days with her family in Pittsburgh before driving across the country to Wisconsin to spend a week with my family. I knew this Christmas was the perfect time to ask her, but I also wanted it to be just us alone when I did so. So, while we were at her grandparents' in Pittsburgh, I made a reservation for this Maggiano's location via OpenTable on my phone. (That way no one could overhear me making the reservation.) And, I wrote on the comments that I wanted "Will You Marry Me?" written on the cake. With that, we left for Wisconsin and drove all day, me trying to conceal my excitement and my nervousness the whole time. As we neared Chicago for the final leg of the trip, we hit some rush hour traffic, so I used this as the perfect excuse: "Let's stop and grab dinner and then traffic will have cleared up." "OK, sounds good." We pulled off, and I revealed I was surprising her with Maggiano's. She was excited, and we parked and were promptly seated. After enjoying our usual Marco's for Two meal, it was time for dessert. The waiter made eye contact with me as if he knew what to do, brought the chocolate cake out, and lo and behold, it was exactly as I had planned. My fiancee was surprised and loved the creativity, and our waiter even offered to photograph the event for us. Definitely will return if we are in Chicago again!

What happened to this place??? An old standby for dine in and carry out. Tonight's experience was so disappointing. Ordered carry out for 5. One entrée was not in the bag, chopped salad was literally just a  box of shredded lettuce. Bleu cheese requested on the side was not included. Guy in the carry out could not have been more aloof or cared less. So sad that we are going to have to go elsewhere for Italian food.  : (

Pretty decent place if you're looking for Italian. Nothing too special but I do like how they include calorie counts for their menu. Extremely helpful if you're staying healthy and watching your diet. I ordered the chicken piccata with fettuccine which was a pretty decently sized meal. My friends and I pretty much had the same consensus that everything was just average. Service was fine; they filled our water pretty regularly and gave us more bread when we asked. Pretty much an average Italian place in my opinion.
While it's a chain restaurant, it's pretty awesome! I mean, you really can't beat the value and quality of their bogo pasta deal. Their appetizers are great and their desserts are a must have!

I've been here before several times but had a great experience recently this last Tuesday evening thanks to our waitress Jasmine.  We set a reservation for 8:45PM and were promptly seated.  The hostess stand we checked in at was occupied by two young girls who were not only unfriendly, but ignored us upon entering and continued their conversation until they were finished.  Then we were shown to our table.  No big deal but I admit it irritated me a bit walking into that.   Then Jasmine comes over, asks if we've been there before, and we tell her we're already ready to order and are in a little bit of a rush.  She takes our order, makes two recommendations to us which we tried and loved, and had everything out to us almost immediately.  We had the spinach dip per Jasmine's suggestion over the flatbread pizza and we were very glad she told us to try the spinach dip.  It was super creamy and the spinach was fresh, not terribly wilted.  We had the lasagna and mushroom ravioli (also her suggestion over the alfredo, we loved it!) and the chocolate cake for dessert.   Because we wanted to get out quickly, we were only there 35 minutes or so.  The restaurant was busy at 8:45PM but not crowded and we found a great spot a block away to park on the street.  I hope management takes notice of Jasmine because she'll be a reason we come back sooner rather than later to Maggiano's.  And, for what it's worth, this place isn't just a little better than the Olive Garden.  I've been to Italy, I've had great 5-Star Italian here in the states.  Is Maggiano's up there with the best?  Nope.  But are they a great value for a casual celebration?  Yes!

Solid place for Italian food - especially good if you're with a large group. I found this spot on a whim on a Friday night and asked whether they took a reservation for 10 people - on surprisingly for us, they did (and at prime dinner time too). I ordered the Gnocchi with Italian Sausage under their pasta specialty dishes and it was very delicious. The portions are HUGE and I could not finish mine (packed it away as leftovers). My other friends ordered Chicken Marsala, Chicken Parmesan, and various other dishes (I can't recall) but all of them said it was delicious. This particular location is surprisingly large and well-suited for large parties. Unlike some other reviews, I thought our service was pretty good and overall, I'd recommend trying this place out if you're in Chicago!

Worst service and worst spaghetti w/ meat sauce I've ever experienced at a restaurant. Even the chopped salad was gross, swimming in oil. One would not expect a lone diner seated in an uncrowded bar at 8:30 PM on a Monday to have to wait 12 minutes to get a menu and 45 minutes for a simple plate of pasta   You could not pay me to go back here.

We have visited Maggiano's a few times now and have always had luck getting reservations within a few hours.  The food is always amazing, great wine choices for the price and the menu has a great variety.

Decent overall experience at the location on Clark. Ended up here bc the wait at Beatrix was too long. Not many people there so got seating immediately.  Lots of food for money. I got the lasagna which was very meaty cheesy and a big portion.  Took home the rigatoni.  Carb fest!!  Attentive staff. I'd come back. A few steps above the olive garden.

I've dined at Maggiano's a few times but this was my first at the original location in the loop. We had a great pinot noir, the tomato caprese, lobster carbonara and the salmon oscar. All the food was phenomenal and our server Jon was great as well. Also the manager Josh was more than willing to credit my check with a gift card that I had forgotten at home after calling back in. All around a great dining experience!

I was somewhat disappointed in the service here... Our waiter kept not attending to our table, didn't remove dirty dishes (and the table was really small for how big the plates are), forgot drinks we had ordered, and didn't replenish water. I will admit the group I was with can be back and forth with an order but we are polite for the most part.  The food however was amazing. I had the moms lasagna and I was impressed because it brought you back to family Italian nights at home. We also had the chopped salad which was very filling and had a wonderful dressing on it. We also had the fried zucchini which was so tasty and didn't taste too oily which tends to happen with fried food, this dish however was perfect.  Also for a large party and for long good dinner conversations this is probably the best place to go, hopefully your server won't be as  non-attending as ours.  Also, the bar tenders seem to be very knowledgable, if I wasn't completely hungover from the night before I would have tried the old fashion that was suggested by our server.   P.S. Their espresso is from Lazavva which is one of the best in the city!
Great food, great ambiance and excellent service!! Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll come back!!

Was looking forward to a nice Italian dinner, but left feeling underwhelmed. Our server was good, but other areas left room for improvement. We arrived early (from out of town and dependent on taxi to get us there) and were told that we would likely have to wait for our scheduled reservation. We replied that we understood and found some stools to wait the 45 min on. A few minutes later we noticed some empty tables in the bar area. When we asked if they were first come first serve we were told that those were reserved for the walk-in customers. The problem I have is that we waited for an hour to get a table while "walk-ins" were seated much more quickly. We even heard the hostess say that the wait for lounge area was about 20 min. It all just seemed as though it could've been handled better. We also were never approached by any of the bar staff to see if we wanted something to drink while we waited despite others around us being offered this service and our attempts to get the bartenders attention.  The food was ok. Not great, but we've had worse. It just didn't have that special quality that would make us feel want to go back.

Love this place. "Marco's Meal for Two" is the best invention of all time. You get two salads, two pastas, two BONUS pastas to go, and one huge dessert (we always get the chocolate cake when we go). The servers are friendly and attentive, and the restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful. Also, my fiance proposed to me here, which was amazing. The staff was great with his suggestion, which was to have "Will You Marry Me" written in chocolate on the plate. They even put candles in it and then took our photo. Couldn't have asked for better waitstaff!

This was the worst experience ever.  A business dinner in the banquet area that was scheduled from 6 pm to 9 pm. There were 70+ people for a business dinner last evening and we were packed into a room that held no more than 50.  The tables were so tight, no one could move.  Bear in mind, we were tables of 10 adults (my table 2 women and 8 men).   Course One - salad and rolls, one roll per per person and no more were brought out (even at our request).   Course Two - Salmon, Fettuccine Alfredo, Chicken Parmesan and Lasagna.  The Fettuccine was no more than a single serving (no lie, you would get more at Olive Garden).   The chicken was pounded to a thin 1/8 inch and one breast was cut into 4 pieces,  there were 6 pieces (2x2 inch size) on the platter, same with the salmon, 6 pieces no larger than 2X2 inches.  There were 2 pieces of Lasagna that needed to be cut into smaller pieces at the table, even if they were cut into quarters there would only be 8 pieces.  The plates were so hot they could not be passed and were obviously held on a steam table.  Totally awkward. Not one of the entree's was there enough food to serve all ten people at the table.  Two women got up and went into the kitchen to ask for more.  It was horrible.   When we asked for additional entrees (as did every table), second portions arrived 30 minutes later.  The second portions were much smaller than the first and it is now nearing 8:30 pm.  Apparently Maggiano's  was not prepared to serve this business dinner.  A business dinner that we paid $125 per person. Course Three -  There were 6 cream puffs on a platter for 10 strangers.  It is one thing to share with family but we were strangers at a business dinner.  Very uncomfortable. People were leaving as it approached 9 pm as people had trains to catch.  Dessert was served at 9:15 pm.  The event was to conclude fifteen minutes earlier.   For a restaurant that is known for large portions, this was pathetic.  Poor timing and lack of adequate portions warrants this poor rating.

Been here a couple of times with my girlfriend. Quite expensive, but the food was great. Have had great experience here both times, but I had gift cards, so my wallet didn't feel too much pain. Wouldn't go here without a gift card, honestly. Great food, though! Hard being a poor college student.

I've never been to the actual restaurant- just to their catering rooms. Ehhh? Their salads all have too much onion. Their eggplant is more mushy than flavorful. Their desserts are either too sweet or not sweet enough. But how do I give them 2 stars (and maybe even 2.5?)? Their fried zucchini is fantastic. If I could eat just that, I would. It's the one thing I recommend to EVERYONE who goes there.

This review is for the banquet location. Last week I attended a City Club of Chicago luncheon here, with Chicago Public Library library commissioner Brian Bannon as the featured speaker. From the looks of the fliers distributed on the round tables, it seems like many of the City Club's lunchtime speakers are hosted at Maggiano's. Having not been here before, I was uncertain what to expect. What struck me the most is all of the dark wood reminiscent of a bordello or pre-Prohibition drinking establishment. I appreciated that there was a place to put my coat right away, and that the check-in process was seamless. It was easy to find my assigned seat, although it would have been nice to have been able to order a beverage (iced tea or diet coke) so that I could stay alert. The dishes were served family-style. Standouts were the stuffed mushrooms and salad. In fact, I probably could've gotten by on just this and bread. The veal entree was over salted (and I am a fan of salt) and the ravioli dish somehow managed to be simultaneously gummy and undercooked. I did appreciate the dessert setup, coffee and a plate of cookies, as it was good not to have to face down a dessert plate while trying to take notes, especially with the speaker coming on after lunch. I was able to see the slide presentation, even though I was near the back of the room. The acoustics were decent, and I even noticed some television cameras filming. I was decidedly less focused on the dining experience than I would have been during a typical restaurant outing, but found the offerings overall sufficient and the service unobtrusive. My only quibble is that I wish the plates had been cleared a bit more swiftly - certainly in between courses and after food service was done- but that is a small nit to pick considering the size of the event.

Consistent, classic Italian. Good value with generous portions. Share a large salad. Get a classic pasta and they send you home with one to go. Eggplant parmesan is the best choice - with a meatball on the side. We always sit in the roomy bar area rather than the dining room. Service is slower, but the atmosphere is laid-back. Love the big windows, especially when it's snowing.

Maggiano's is one of our favorite go to restaurants where we know we will get good service along with large portions of tasty Italian cuisine. Maggiano's has their regular menu filled with Italian dishes. They also offer additional options: family style (for groups), a flat $ meal for 2 and our fav (cause I have the 2 college kids) buy one entree, get one free! We usually begin our meal with a salad, you can opt for an individual salad or get the larger salad and share with your dinner companions. We also enjoy the Margherita flat bread as an appetizer. Warm bread is delivered to your table and you can dunk it in olive oil, Parmesan cheese or butter. Seconds & 3rds for bread is perfectly acceptable. The portions are generous and we usually end up taking some leftovers home with us along with the 2nd complimentary entree. When we splurge on dessert or have room in our tummies, the strawberry cheesecake is yummy. I encourage reservations at all locations for lunch and dinner, cause they do get very busy.

I still love the food at Magggianos. It's another one of those "I've been coming since I was a child" type of ordeal- but the food tonight was not so great and the service was really bad. Our server never came back on numerous occasions, & the eggplant Parmesan was extremely salted, we ended up just leaving. I will be sticking to the Maggianos I love located in Skokie (Old Orchard).

YOU NEVER GET A SECOND CHANCE TO MAKE A FIRST IMPRESSION.  Evelyn the seating hostess is rude and unprofessional.  Let's get that out of the way first.  Called 25 minutes prior to our reservation to let them know we might be late due to an unexpected transit delay.  Evelyn rudely stated "we hold reservations for 15 mins then they cancel; OK?   When we arrived at the restraunt we were lucky enough to be greeted by Evelyns sour face.  Glad to see consistency is practiced here she was just as rude in person!   Luckily the Manager stepped in and took care of us.  The food and table service was good.  We went here with a friend who suggested going.  By far there are more authentic and quality Italian places in the city.  Great for large groups that want to eat family style.  The low rateing is due to the bad inpression left by Evelyn

I had went here for my birthday it was my first time soon as you walk in it looks dead not that many people maybe because me and my mom want on a monday the door lady greet us and also let us pick are seats that was a plus not all restaurant do that sit down at the table get water and menu the bread which was hard at the bottom table was pretty can`t be loud THE BEST! customer service nice/friendly waiters soon we order are food it come out within about 10 minutes I was shock we had the lasagna don`t want to waste money on food we don`t like free refills on drinks and bread after getting ready to go they give you a extra free plate of food (oh yea cool) to take home which was good hot and everything The ONLY~~ downside to this place is that they give me cookies on my birthday which was nasty and dry not sure thy care that much about giving you the best dessert on your birthday also you can`t tip the waiter lower then 9 Dollars that was it but I would differently say go HERE! me and my mom enjoy it and will be back soon it very nice good food this is my honest review people :)

We always enjoy Magg. We go to the one in Downtown Denver alot. I used to work at the Orlando Pointe Magg. We wanted to go to the 'Original' Magg for our 6 month anniversary. We weren't disappointed.  Only concern was Mom's lasagna was pretty bad. We've always liked this dish, but this time something was off. However, we enjoyed ALL out other dishes doing the "meal for two' and take homes. We live the Alfredo, now the lighter version is great too.
One of my favorite stops in Chicago. The bruschetta is amazing and family style is fun with friends and family alike. Enjoy! Oh, and don't forget the tiramisu.
We always get the best meal and great service. Our waitress was very helpful. We will be back soon.

Maggiano's....Maggiano's....what can I say about you?  Hmmmmm.... I'm just not a fan.  I've dined here many times....ordering off the regular menu as well as off the family style menu and have always been disappointed.  I've just never found the food to be awesome.  I want to, but it just doesn't happen.  I mean they drench their pasta dishes in sauce.  Don't get me wrong, I like a good amount of sauce but when it resembles a lake....that's going a bit overboard....pun intended.  Even the desserts disappoint me. Oh well.

Michael Suter was my waiter, he made it very warm welcoming. I enjoyed my experience. I ate the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and shrimp which was very filling, and my wife ate the Peppered Sirloin Steak which was delicious as well. In conclusion, vibe was awesome, waiter was awesome 5/5, food was awesome, we will definitely come back!

I came here for dinner with friends last Saturday night and good thing we had a reservation! This place was packed with tourists from the light festival thing. I've always considered this a tourist trap/upscale Olive Garden-type place and avoided it, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was pretty nice inside, our waitress was great and the food was good. Friend and I opted for the $39 meal for two where you get  an appetizer, two entrees and dessert. We had the stuffed mushrooms (delicious!) and lighter baked ziti which was really good, but could have used a little more sausage! We destroyed the giant piece of decadent chocolate cake as well! The best part was getting a free second entree to take home. I had the eggplant parm and let's say I'm not hating it.  Maggiano's is really easy to get to via public transit and is great for groups, especially if you don't want a pretentious setting.  Never judge a restaurant by it's chain status!

Came here for a conference-hosted dinner. Everything I had was delicious. Eggplant parmesan, caesar salad, cheese cannoli, tiramisu, and NY cheesecake. They have really good portion sizes, including their desserts.

I went here many years ago to celebrate my dad's birthday and the food is alright. This place is not as good as it used to be. The service and waitstaff was mediocre. I would have to say you get better italian food elsewhere which they make pasta from scratch which is truly authentic. I wouldn't go back to this place even if I had a coupon deal.

I have been wondering about Maggiano's ever since I moved to the area, and finally I tried it out. I came here for a seminar, so luckily I didn't have to pay for the food. The good: Service was great. Our plates were always cleared, drinks filled, food was brought out promptly, and the hostess was very nice. The tiramisu was freaking awesome. I like the atmosphere (upstairs), and the classic Frank Sinatra music in the background. The bad: The food was pretty mediocre. Again, I've had a hard time finding a good Italian restaurant. Maggiano's is overpriced in my opinion. Besides the dessert, I wasn't wowed by the taste. We tried a few different dishes, one being the chicken piccatta. I thought the chicken was way too dry, and the pieces were pounded down to the point that it was like cardboard.  Our room had a ton of pillars, so it was hard to see. Also, it smelled like a pet store in the halls...not sure why. It seemed a little outdated and slightly run down. Maggiano's met my expectations, which were not that high.

This is the flagship of Maggiano's and it is huge.   Maggiano's, while kind of a chain (a local one), gets Italian food right.   Portions are huge and you can have your meals family-style if you wish.    I'm a bit of a lasagna aficionado and I can tell you that it is not very easy to find a good lasagna.   However, Maggiano's has one of the best I've ever had.   Pasta is cooked perfectly (a little stiff before building the lasagna so it finishes cooking in the oven) and not mushy.   Just the right amount of ricotta (I hate it when chefs layer too much cheese) and a milder red sauce (so as not too overpower the flavor of the meat and cheese). Service was excellent.   As soon as we were seated, we had menus in hand and glasses of water.   Our orders were taken just a couple minutes later and bread was at our table a minute after that. All in all, a solid experience.

Ok... Apparently if your pager doesn't work, it's my fault? Waited for over half an hour for a seat in the bar area. Told the host, she took my pager and hasn't come back. Soooo.. I guess I'll just sit myself at one of the 10 empty tables. Need me to fry my own calamari while I'm at it? -very disappointed customer, service is awful.  All we got was "there's nothing we can do about it."  Really?  You just lost us as customers.
Came with my family last week for my first time. Quality food for reasonable prices within the area. Definitely will be coming back soon.

If you want a lot of food for your money, then this is the place.  This restaurant has been around to stand the test of time and each time we go it never disappoints.  This restaurant is good for large or small groups or just 2 for dinner.  It is somewhat loud but that's ok by us, it makes up for the quality of food.  They even serve Lavazza coffee.  Save room for desert.

Still waiting to have a bad dish here yet. Chopped salads are awesome....actually, don't go there and not get one. Order a full, and whatever dish you please, and share it with your company. You won't be disappointed. The 5 Cheese Ravioli and the Spaghetti and Meatballs are good staples that you can always count on. But don't be afraid to try something different, if I were rich, I'd bet you that you'll be pleased with anything you order. No guarantees on the service. Tends to be shotty, ranging from hungover frat boys, to bartenders that look like their other foot is on the banana peel hovering the grave they're about to be in. Don't let that throw you off, choose quality of food over quality of service at this place and you're golden.  The bartenders are tools....don't expect service above par from any that you'd get on North Clark after a Cubs game.

We passed this in the afternoon one day and the restaurant was busy.  We decided to make reservations for our final night in Chicago.  We arrived 20 minutes early to a very busy Saturday night.  We got to our table and the waiter asked us if we had been here before.  We said, "no", and he described Maggiano's as a classic Italian family style restaurant.  He also said we would have to leave room for the fresh strawberry pie.  We ordered our meal.  Veal Picatta and a side of grilled asparagus for me, and chicken Parmesan with a side of sauteed spinach for my wife.  We ordered 2 glasses of wine on the wine menu for $5 per glass.  The waiter said that price was only during the week.  We continued to order the wine, neglecting to ask the price difference.  My veal was average and a little tough.  The asparagus was burned and after returning it, the waiter returned with more burned asparagus.  Is that the classic style?  I didn't return the second order.  My wife enjoyed her chicken but the spinach was tasteless.  Our waiter finally returned to see if we were ready for dessert.  We said we'd share a piece of the recommended strawberry pie.  He told us they were out.  I thought he was joking and when he said he wasn't, we decided to end the meal.  I had high expectations for this meal and I wished we would have went to Lou Malnati's, where we had an excellent meal, and superior service.   By the way; our $5, during-the-week, glass of wine was now $12 at dinner.

Not a huge pasta fan but enjoyed a team dinner here. I'm just gonna go ahead and get straight to the main point - if you order a classic pasta, they give you another order (doesn't have to be the same classic pasta) to take home. It's like a fancy Olive Garden!! We came in around 5 because it was a work dinner and it was pretty empty. However by the time we left, it was already crowded! Impressive, considering it was a Wednesday.  We started with the calamari and bruschetta. Calamari was very well seasoned and crispy. It was very tasty but could have used a higher squid-to-breading ratio. Not bad though.  I ordered the Chef Mann's country style pasta and boy was the size seriously for a Mann! (Capital M). I'm a sucker for hand twisted noodles and these were very chewy and perfect for the lighter (than alfredo or marinara) white wine sauce. The shape had little pockets to collect the milder sauce. I obviously doused it in red pepper flakes but the little bits of sun dried tomatoes were a lovely kick of flavor every time I bit into them! They really shined with a milder sauce. I grew up on Korean BBQ so I'm totally comfortable eating large chunks of cooked garlic (okay, I love it) but not everyone is alright with that. I will warn you- I found large pieces of garlic in this dish. Do NOT order this on a first date! Unless your man loves garlic. Or if it's a bad first date with a vampire! I did not like how the sausage in this dish was torn up into tiny oddly shaped pieces. Especially when the baked ziti next to me got sausage pieces that were like 4x the size! Still the pasta was very good.  Great family-style Italian joint! Essá me maggianos!

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night (make a reservation so you don't have to wait forever and a day) and it was above what I expected! This is the original Maggiano's, which makes it a bit more special. I've been to other locations in the past,  but never remember it being this tasty. My boyfriend and I had the mussels in white sauce (which had garlic, beans and sun dried tomatoes) and the stuffed mushrooms ----both were DIVINE. The mushrooms were bursting with flavor (tasted like clams oreganata, but mushroom version) along with the mussels. Then we had our entrees: I had the chicken cap. salad and he had the lasagna (which he said was amazing). There is a special where you buy one classic pasta for dinner and they let you take one home! $12.95 for the large lasagna serving and he has baked ziti for dinner tonight! Talk about a deal. The dressing on the salad was awesome I wanted it to last forever. If we had room we would've tried the tiramisu because it looked amazing, maybe next time. Overall Maggiano's on Clark is awesome and won't disappoint.

It had been a long time since we had been in a Maggiano's ,but two things still remain; Great Food and even Better service. After waiting an HOUR at a mediocre pizza joint around the corner from Maggiano's,we walked over to Maggiano's.  It was Worth the walk. Josh, our server-was friendly,professional,and on top of things from the time that we walked in.  The food was so good that I'd slap someone's Mama. Not all restaurants are the same; go to Maggiano's and find out for yourselves.

The service was spectacular. I live I'm Chicago and have never been there.  I had friends visiting that wanted Italian and we were not let down. The good was great and they even give you a plate of food to take home for later.  I will for sure go back.

Great Italian as you'd expect. Red checkered tablecloths, family style menus and tables available.  Calamari and bruschetta started were perfect.  House special Orchiette with scallops and Lobster cream sauce, yum!  Dessert sampler topped it with caffeine latte.  To Top it off, I left my Amex at the bar, yikes!  They held it until I could pick it up and I really appreciated the help.

Our favorite.  Glad we finally got one closer to home.   Be warned, the portions are very large.  For 2 people, go with 1 appetizer, 1 salad, and if you each get an entrée, you'll have leftovers - good thing our hotel had a fridge.  Save room for the Tiramisu.....the best I've had yet!

Though had a carryout from there. But anyway, The Tomato Basil Soup was delicious. The Bruschetta was fantastic. The Linguine with White Clam Sauce with an oil, As opposed to a cream base. Was great too.

Sadly, this place has gone down hill of late. The dining room isn't very clean, with carpeting well past it's lifespan. The food isn't nearly as good as it was 4-5 years ago. I ate here a month or so ago with my wife and neither of us was very impressed with the quality of the food. They do give you a lot of it, but that doesn't make up for lower quality dishes.  I've always ordered their chop salad in the past and did this time as well. The lettuce came out wilted and not very crisp. My seafood pasta had very little seafood in it, and the sauce was a bit gunky and stuck to the noodles in an unappetizing way. My wife's portabella ravioli was good, but nothing special.  In a city with plenty of great Italian food, do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to eat.

I wish there were more stars! Last night I took 8 family members, from Texas, Utah and Chicago, ages 8 through 70 (me) to dinner here and it was the best! Every thing - service, food, our large table and more. I couldn't asked for the evening to go any better. We order the Family Style dinner and it was not only delicious but a great conversation-starter for family members who hadn't seen each other in several years. I highly recommend Magiano's at 516 N Clark in Chicago!

Our waiter Bob was great, he was nice and helpful. The food was great and not too long of a wait. Big portions, so sharing is a good way to go. The prices aren't bad for the amount of food you get. Our waiter played trivia at the end of the meal and we won free lemon cookies which were delicious! I highly recommend going to maggianos if you are in Chicago. Also, the chopped salad is delicious!

Such a wonderful experience overall! The food was wonderful and we got so much for the price, I had a whole bowl of baked ziti and a lasagna to take home for a very reasonable price considering that I will get 2 full meals out of it. Our waiter was very enjoyable and made dinner exciting. I absolutely loved it and would recommend it to anyone in Chicago!
Always a great meal at maggianos!  I try something different each time and am never disappointed.  The service is good and a friendly staff.  It's in a fun happening part of the city!

Same great food, decor and service since the beginning. This is the original Maggiano's, not one of the new iterations.  Seating in the dining room goes quickly. Having a seat in the bar/lounge is equally as enjoyable. Will be back, for sure.  Portions are large, so plan on sharing.

this place is actually super gross. waitress spilled water on me and didn't even apologize? when the food came out it looked and tasted like it had been cooked it earlier and had been sitting out for a while. very mediocre. would have rather gone to olive garden and that's saying something. best part about this place was the bread, but how can you mess up that? won't be coming back. came with my family and if someone suggests going here I'll make sure to warn them not to.

Probably 15 years was my first time to Chicago and Maggiano's was one of the first restaurants that I went to there. It immediately made me fall in love with Chicago dining.  Maggiano's is one of those rare restaurants that overfeeds you meaning they serve huge hearty servings that are often difficult to finish. We immediately found that out when we ordered Spaghetti and Meatballs, Cannelloni which is no longer on the menu, and Four Cheese Ravlioi. It was so good that 15 years later I can remember exactly what I got. My mom ended up moving to Chicago and we ended up going to Maggiano's almost every summer when my family would come visit. It became one of our go to restaurants in the city and we were never disappointed. Well except for the fact that they took the Cannelloni off the menu.

Loved it!! Overheard nearby tables saying how amazing their food was. I totally agree. Nice atmosphere. Family style food. This place definitely knows their Italian. Will absolutely be back when in Chicago again.

Very meh....for chain Italian food, OG is my fav. This is more expensive and less delish.  I have never actually ate here until we received a GC awhile ago.  I was actually excited to eat "bad" Italian food...until we ate there. Get the lasagna...everything else is not good.

Absolutely love Maggianos! The Rigatoni D is spectacular. The calamari was delicious as well. Plan to have enough leftovers for at least one more meal, if not two. With the provided reheating instructions, they taste almost as good as the original meal.

Perfect for the traditional old school red sauce meals. You get all the classics like the veal, eggplant, chicken parmesans, An assortment of traditional pasta dishes and entrees. They're all decent but be careful as the food is very salty - and I love salt. Service was great - friendly and professional. When my friend told our waiter that she is gluten-free, he had the chef come out to discuss some options. The space is dark and cramped. The floors and furniture show some real wear 'n' tear.

Had a great birthday dinner tonight. I have been here before so I have to say the stuffed mushrooms are a must. I will always make it a point to order them. Flavorful and juicy, if they made the app into an entrée somehow it would be everything.  The drinks were very well made, (Dark & Stormy, and the house cocktail) and our entree pastas came out quickly, and very delicious. Huge portions! I am happy to say I definitely got what I paid for. Thanks maggianos, hope to see you soon. Side note: The waiter asked of we were there on any special occasion, and since we were seated next to a large birthday party, I hesitantly told him it was also my birthday but didn't want to make a big deal out of it. Dude brought these tasty lemon cookies with lit candles and everything. It was awesome. These people take care of you.

I had lunch here with my friend. Since it was our first time, our server suggested a couple of things on the menu which was very helpful. We got short bread and clam linguine. The toppings on bread were fresh and delicious, the linguine ran a little bit heavier flavor of butter than I had in other places before, but delicious as well. Their to go box with detailed information about how to reheat leftover, which was really impressed me. I'll be back for sure.

Had an awesome time with my family here! Made a reservation and was seated promptly. Our server was the best! He was super friendly and very accommodating. Fantastic service! Got the classic family style meal: Crispy zucchini was fantastic!! Spinach artichoke dip and chopped salad were good. Grilled lemon salmon and baked ziti were awesome! Chicken and spinach manicotti was good, too. Didn't try the eggplant Parmesan (not an eggplant fan), but my family liked it well enough. Mixed berry tiramisu (off menu) was super good! Also got the chocolate cake, which was yummy as well. Had plenty of leftovers to take home, and everyone left very satisfied. Would definitely come here again!

Back to reliable maggianos. Saw a few new menu item this time and if you haven't tried the lighter fare select the chicken fettuccini it's so delicious and not as heavy as some of the other dishes Tonight we had a waiter named Jason and he is phenomenal! Always attentive zooming back and forth and has a great attitude. You can tell his job is stressful but he maintains an upbeat demeanor. Really enjoyed my return visit back this time!
So much food and really nice staff ! Lasagna was delicious and chicken fet  Was the best my mother ever had !! It had asparagus In it !

Crab cakes here are good-- the executive chef Jim used to work in DC, and everybody knows that Maryland blue crabs are the best and that crab cakes on the East coast. It took me forever to start eating seafood here in the Midwest after working in DC for a year, but the crab cakes here are definitely not the gross breaded kind I thought I would find here. They were delicious huge chunks of crab, with a delicious sauce and arugula salad.  The stuffed mushroom were delicious too. They're stuffed with bread crumbs and cheese, and the bread crumbs are just the right amount of crispy. The Italian meatballs were covered in a flavorful red tomato sauce. Definitely a good place to go for some good ole Italian food.

Overall, the food was great as usual, service was perfect...however, there was not a lot of ventilation on the evening I went; we're in that weird time of year where its cold enough to wear a jacket, but not warm enough to turn on the A/C. From what it looked like - you cant open the windows either -- but quite a big crowd so it was warm.  Only comment, and I have no say of this...   had a large group some sit next my table when I was hoping to a "quiet" dinner with a friend.  One of the guests sounded like a muppet with the way he laughed...and they were a bit loud, but those are the breaks.

Legit best Italian food I've ever consumed in my entire life, no exaggeration. The server chic was super nice and helpful. I had the gnocchi with Italian sausage in vodka sauce. It was soft and every single bite was better than the next. I don't know how to describe it to do it justice. It was just really freakin good. You get a TON of food for your money, and it's not even expensive. Oh and the tiramisu was un.freakin.believable. It was only like 8 bucks, and the piece was the size of my face. Def recommend this joint. COME to this place.

This is your quintessential Italian-American restaurant.  Loud and boisterous atmosphere, red-and-white checked tablecloths, Sinatra blaring away on the house stereo loud enough so that you can hear him over the noise. And the food?  Lots of old-fashioned hearty baked Italian-American dishes.  Bends to modernity enough that the baked fish is tilapia, a good choice for standing up to being thoroughly baked while topped with cheese and lobster chunks.
Love Maggiano's best italian food in town. Tried the spinach ravioli, they are huge so you get only a few but you'll probably won't finish it all. Wine was great an service was great as well.

Quality & consistent! 13 dollars for a pasta dish for in dining and one free packed dinner to go (what a deal.)  I love boutique restaurants but you can't hate on a lettuce entertain you restaurant. Chain restaurants are popular for a reason. Great pastas & chicken Parmesan is always a good choice. Chopped salad is one of my favorites.  Reasonably priced wine bottle selections (25-60) jlohr seven oaks Cabernet is a deal. I will always come here for a quick Italian American food fix.

had a really bad experience at Tanta and decided to come here for dessert and was pleasantly surprised by the awesome service Shah was warm and welcoming! guess he can teach the Tanta servers across the street some hospitality 101 lessons .. loved him

I came here for a work luncheon this afternoon. I have a lot of food allergies but I consider it my problem and I don't like to ask for special preparations. The lunch was served family style and there was nothing within my diet restrictions so I didn't have anything. No big deal, I figured I would just grab something to eat afterwards.  Our banquet server noticed that I wasn't eating, asked why and I told him that I had some allergies. He then had the kitchen prepare a gluten and dairy free meal special for me! And it was delicious. It was very kind, and just above and beyond given the large crowded room and the tight lunchtime timeframe.

I had good service here.  I ordered the fillet minion with mashed potatoes.  The steak and potatoes were outstanding.  Their sauce they used for the steak is the best I had ever had and I couldn't get enough of it.  The only reason this isn't a five star review is the fillet cut was rather small and for 30 dollars it seemed like they could have included a bit more.

On a recommendation, came here for an early dinner, on a week night and was impressed with the food. What is most noticeable are the reasonable prices. Especially for this area. From a limited menu section, you can get a large portioned meal and take another large portion to go for as little as $12.50. The other prices are also extremely reasonable.  My aunt and I started with the bruschetta. Very very good bruschetta, I don't know what they do to it but I have made a lot of bruschetta but it is not as good as theirs.  From their featured menu I got the stuffed cannelloni. Again, very good. It is currently a menu item that you get the to go meal too. I took home the Taylor street ziti. Both are very simple but delicious. Finally I wrapped my meal with impeccable tiramisu. The different layers were proportioned perfectly and the mascarpone was fluffy and not too rich. Well done overall. I will be back.

There's nothing like the delicious smells you get when walking into this place.   Everything is fantastic here.   I've never been disappointed.   I absolutely love the fried calamari and fried zucchini.   The chicken piccata is amazing.  The salmon is to die for.  Desserts are not a let down either.   Service is outstanding.   Very clean and welcoming atmosphere.

My friend and I had lunch here today. Since it was lunch during the work day, the waiter asked if we were on a time crunch, and we said that we were. It was still a very long lunch. It was my first time, and it will absolutely be my last time. It took a while for our food to come out, and once it did, both orders had issues. My friend is observing lent so she couldn't have meat today. Her pasta had chicken instead of shrimp, so we had to send it back. That wasn't the worst of it though. My salmon on my salad was SEVERELY undercooked. I am so happy that I went to cut the entire piece up before eating it, or I definitely would have taken a few bites before noticing and gotten sick. The waiter was apologetic, but when I tried to change my order because I didn't want to risk it happening again, he sort of brushed it off and still had it remade. It was fine the second time, but I was still a little put off from it. I was also frustrated that he didn't listen to my request to change my order. Everything that we asked or needed seemed to take longer than it should have. The waiter would make jokes to try to ease it, but it was still frustrating. Also, they didn't do anything in terms of compensation for the salmon issue. It obviously wasn't something that they had to do, but it would have shown good faith of an apology for serving me raw fish. It goes beyond a wrong order or timing issue - that is someone's health. The overall experience was really bad, and to be honest, the food was not good, regardless of the annoyances that came with the meal.  For how many wonderful Italian restaurants there are in Chicago, I can say that I'll never be back to this one.
Food was really good, especially when you microwave them to go.  Server had a lot of recommendations.  We came around 2PM so it wasn't crowed.

Went on a Friday night...around Christmas time... Had reservations, and arrived 5 min late.  They sat my party of 8 (including two small children) in the bar! Really? That wasn't the worst...Valet LOST MY CAR!!  It took over an hour, and finally I insisted that they drive me to the lost where the cars were parked to find the car...there it was....like magic.  Thanks to the valet we waited for an hour in a crowded restaurant with two small children...  I'll go to Oak Brook next time I want to try Maggiano's again (but don't count on it being soon)

Great food for the price. Their pasta selection is very good as well as their wine menu. My wife ordered a classic pasta dish and we got an extra plate of our choice to go. We had 2 pasta dishes, a dish to go and 2 glasses of wine for under 50 bucks. Can't beat that. Our server was awesome.

Love Maggianos! Always great service and the food is great! I had the chicken and spinach manicotti this time and it was very tasty and piping hot! This was my first visit to one not in StL but still same experience! Defiantly not as packed as my hometown one either.

I had diner with my aunt and uncle and daughter, there were seven of us. We had wine and full meals.  We ordered dessert and shared this.  The food was good, but before we had finished dessert  a buss boy came by and took the plate away without asking. I tried to stop him and he just kept on going.  I paid over 300.00 dollars for this meal and was really upset that we could not even finish our dessert.   A few minutes latter the manager came by and said to my daughter how was every thing and she said "oh do you want us to leave?"  He said yes.  I have never been kicked out of a restaurant in my life and will never return to any Maggiano's, I guess they forgot what made them great family dinners and great service.  It is no longer there.

Started dinner well with great ambiance, bread and olive oil and had a delicious dessert to finish and the service was good.  But what about the main dish; hence the two star rating.  Our main dishes were mediocre at best and very disappointing given all the positive reviews we read prior to coming in for dinner.  We both ordered their classic pasta dishes.  I had the baked eggplant parmesan and my hubby ordered the spaghetti with meatballs.  Simple enough for an Italian restaurant to prepare per order, but our food tasted like it was reheated from the deep freeze and then topped with their marinara sauce and garlic to hide the freezer burn.  The salad was iceberg lettuce and not very fresh even for iceberg lettuce.  Would recommend for drinks and dessert, but Maggiano's has to make their main dishes as good as their desserts.

Traveling on Thanksgiving day.  Ended up at this family style restaurant and it was great.  The food was outstanding and plenty of it.  Our server was fantastic and definitely made the experience better.

Crazy GOOD!!! This place is always busy. When we arrived there was an hour wait for a party of eight. They invited us into the Lounge area.  We were immediately greeted and served drinks. All of us agreed to do the Chef's Choice.  The food was perfect. I absolutely can not say enough good about this visit. Huge thanks to the staff for a great experience.

I visited a couple weeks back. We had a party of 8 and they had a table for us in a short time. Service was great and so was the food. Portions are HUGE and with certain entrees, you get an additional one to take home. I was eating Italian for several days.   Bread and olive oil for starters and we added some bruschetta for good measure. It was delicious. Most dishes are moderately priced- the wine is on the high side.

I came here with a large party for a birthday. On the day we went, there was a special for stuffed pasta. You get 2 pastas - one stuffed and one classic - for under $20! The food itself was mediocre, nothing spectacular nor super authentic, but it was a good (over-seasoned) portion. Even though the decor looks fancy, it's really just an Italian TGI Fridays.  One slight hiccup: the waitress forgot my friend's order, and he didn't get his food until after everyone finished their meals. The waitress was very apologetic and tried hard to make up for her mistake. She offered to take my friend's dinner off the bill. She also gave the birthday boy a large dessert platter (tiramisu, creme brulee...etc.), on the house. All is forgiven I guess.  I might give it a try again if I'm in the area and looking for some Italian comfort food.

Stopped in Maggiano's last week with my daughter for a father/daughter dinner date. I was expecting the food to be a little better prepared. We both ordered the Chicken Parm and it seems like it was left in the deep fryer a little too long. The chicken was dry and the breading was actually crunchy, not like pan frying at all. The marinara also left a lot to be desired. I would consider coming back again just to see if we showed up on an off night.

Came here for take out since I was staying at the Aloft hotel across the street. It's a pretty big location, so there are multiple entrances for eating in and takeout. The service was good, the staff member was very patient in answering my questions, and my order came out quickly. I ordered a soap and some pasta. The price was decent, and the soup pretty satisfying. The ravioli that I got was a little bland, and the sauce did not change the taste that much. The portion size was quite good though. So overall, nothing to think that the food would be bad or that this restaurant is not worth going to; just that it didn't deliver an awe-inspiring punch. Perhaps the dine in experience is better.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. They also give you extra food to go. :) Maggiano's Little Italy® specializes in Italian-American cuisine served in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Each restaurant is open daily for lunch and dinner and offers a convenient carryout service as well as delivery, in addition to beautiful and accommodating banquet spaces for special occasions.... Restaurant/Cafe: 213,524 like this

Maggianos is a wonderful chain. Always good food, great atmosphere, and fantastic bread! However, I have only been here 2ce and both times the service was Sub-par...The only thing that keeps me coming back is the food & the buy one take one home deal. Both times out waiter didn't introduce himself, didn't check on us at all, and never have us any insight when we asked about the house wine... Which was also wonderful.
