So if your looking for a good, reasonable priced meal this is the place but don't expect much from your server.

Darlingly fabulous bartender managed to make my signature dirty martini somehow fit the guidelines of the happy special and poured them generously! Food was about what you can expect from this moderately overpriced/overhyped, generally consistent chain.  For a weary travel in need of a hearty meal and a stiff drink, it served its purpose.

The food is ok and priced right. The take-out service sucks. We use to go almost weekly for take-out.   It was fine at first, but small service issues would pop up here and there with our orders.  Missing items, wrongs items....we slowly stopped going as much. Last straw was when we went and had our Levy point's charges incorrectly and was charged fully for the meal. My wife went back and forth with the manager and it was never rectified.  She finally gave up trying to correct their mistake.  That error was a while ago. We just stopped going after that.  We gave their take-out another shot tonight.  Just as brutal as it has always been. Wrong pasta/sauce and no cheese with the order.  The food tasted ok for what it was, just not what we ordered.   We like the other Levy restaurants, but this locations take-out service is unacceptable.

We went here for lunch yesterday and it was so delicious!  I was a little worried coming with a one year old and during lunch hour during the work week, but it was fine.  I had the ziti (and lasagna for home) and my husband did too.  You can't beat that deal!!  Two pastas for $12.95.  We started with the calamari which was great and yummy.  Our waiter was nice and attentive even though he seemed to be swamped.  We were in and out in an hour!  I would come back here again for lunch!  I wish they had outdoor seating - oh well!

Food was good but didn't appreciate the wait staff lying to my face. I say "Magiano salad" she confirms I want the "side" portion. It never comes, the explanation? "Oh sorry. I never heard you." Really? So WTF did you reply "side" to????

I've been to Maggiano's before and always had a great experience, but this one was the original M's and it was the great experience, plus extra flair.  The ambiance is a little older that the newer ones I've been to, and that made it feel like we were really eating at an original Chicago, one-of-a-kind place.  Our server Bob was great and of course, all of us took food home!  The tiramisu was literally to die for, and I'm not even a tiramisu lover.  I will always love Maggiano's, but wanted to specifically review this one because of it's history in Chicago.  Yum!

Just about everything on the menu will leave you satiated (and full to say the least). I'd advise that you avoid ordering a salad and get some damned pasta for once (you know who you are!). The location is great, if you can sit outside, do so, the street is a little busy but it's great in the spring/summer and fall.

I have eaten here 3 times now. Every time the same.... Just wonderful.  Friendly staff, food is above expectation. I go in knowing it is going to be good and it still impresses me. Calamari is perfect every time and I am picky about this.  Healthy (or unhealthy depending on your definition) :) portion sizes with food that is better than homemade. Thick sauces with chunks of tomato. The Chicken Parma is out of this world.  I would not hesitate to recommend this to the pickiest of my friends.   *********TIP******** Given the location.... take a cab.

Overall my boyfriend and I had a great first time experience at Maggiano's! Although, we weren't greeted at the door right away, we both agreed it was a little bit uncomfortable when someone finally did come around. He kind of gave of the impression that he didn't know why we were dining with them such a late hour. However, it was only 10:15 on a Saturday night. But after we got past that everything was perfect. Our waitress, Andie, was phenomenal! She made our experience really memorable. Just the right amount of attentiveness without being overbearing. We both agree that she is one of the better servers we've had in the city. Would highly recommend the 2 for 40 deal! Plus you can't beat that second serving of pasta. If you don't like the carbs, this place isn't for you. Yes, this is not your typical authentic Italian restaurant, but if your looking for fantastic wait staff and some pretty huge portions check out Maggiano's! :)

Not as good as it was before.  Was disappointed to see that they have downgraded their bread (tastes like something bought from the frozen section at Dominick's) and removed Italian sodas from the menu.  What Italian restaurant serves mediocre bread and no Italian sodas?  Getting too corporate....

I know I know... I'm in Chicago and we ate at Maggiano's.  The wife was running a 1/2 marathon and this is our pre-race tradition from Cincinnati.  Food snobs can say what they want about chains (and I usually agree), I've never had a meal at Maggiano's that hasn't delivered.  Period.  There is truly an absurd and embarrassing amount of food though.  I ordered something and was informed I automatically got a second portion to take home... I didn't finish the first.  I suppose the thrifty man inside was happy, but it just seemed so unnecessary.

Met her for the first time as I sat down for lunch today, but my Chinaport neighbor and bartender Julie helped me to remember... WHY i love this place!  Maggiano's is what Leona's used to taste like in the early 1990's.  The dark tomato chunks and sauce in their baked rigatoni pomodori pasta seductively beckoned me closer... and the first nibble of the finely-herbed chicken sausage on top forced me to MOAN OUT the most x-rated utterance. Not a blink from Julie or the new trainee behind the bar, as they must be used to it.  I took another bite and slapped the beautiful dark wood bar top.  After tasting a few different reds, I settled on the 2011 J. Lohr Cabernet, which pairs perfectly with this dish. Julie carefully explained that this 6 oz. pour was more expensive than the others, but i PFFFFTTT'D when i saw that it was only $10 on the tab.  That's downright cheap for River North, baby.  The puffy clouds that sat near by is bread but could've floated on away as they were light, buttery and indeed ambrosia. You see... after strutting up Clark Street a few blocks, I sauntered right inside, past the slightly-bewildered valet guys and plopped right down to the bar. Julie asked if I was lunchin' and I said abSOTIVELY posiLUTELY. She reminded me that I also get a 2nd entree for free. So about $7.5 a piece and each comes out plentiful enough to feed about 3 people (OK 1.5 Mid-Westerners haha). I'm not anti-chain, but do it RIGHT! They dish up Flintstone-sized portions and the flavors are there.  Someone here in the office'd hotted up a cheesy Hamburger Helper type dish around 11am on this festive Friday and I made the mistake of walking through the pantry.  That pleasurably took me back to my poor Mississippi childhood, in which such moments would have been a treat. After spending a good 40 minutes scanning and rescanning nearby Yelp'd restaurants, I settled on Maggiano's because though I don't have it often, i *knew* they knew what classic pasta should taste like. Gotta get back!
Love going here they have great deals for an Italian Restaurant and the food is delicious ! Must try their Chicken and Spinach Manicotti that's def my favorite on the menu lol !.
very good...did the couple meal....appitizer meal desert and take home pasta....sold

Wow! So impressed with this Maggiano's!!! The restaurants are all typically excellent, but the service at this location was over and above what I'd expect. We needed Friday night, last-minute dinner reservations for a friend's birthday. Our party was large and the size changed twice, but the staff were more than accommodating. The manager even greeted us, wishing the birthday lady well.  If you didn't know the $12-15 traditional pastas come with a take-home pasta (full portion) that you can heat up for lunch (or a late night snack like me); talk about incredible value!!! The birthday girl also got a free $15 cocktail! Complimentary birthday cookies were also a nice touch, but the birthday girl had to leave for a while, so the candles burnt out and our gentile waiter brought new cookies and candles. We tipped very well for the great service!

Let me preface my review with the fact that I don't really like chain restaurants.  We were here for a banquet, and the staff was great. The salad was over-dressed and I don't know if fried ravioli have ever appeared anywhere in Italy, but the food was pretty good and the service was spot-on.  Overheard at the table, "I feel like Maggiano's presents a challenge and they always win"....needless to say, there was no shortage of food.

Greta food, big portions, nice atmosphere, great service. This is not a high end place but you get your money's worth and it is tasty. Love the Rigatoni D and sea food pastas :) Also Tiramisu is amazing!

I'd heard a lot about Maggiano's and probably expected more than what I experienced that one evening my friend and I decided to dine there. We walked in without reservations, which was alright. We were seated in a corner, beside the grand piano (which also served as a table for a large group!!). It seemed that we were forgotten after that. We signaled to the waitress some three or four times before one of them realized that we were actually seated to have dinner and weren't just whiling away time! The waitress was courteous and apologetic; they had a crowd, she said. She seemed to be the only nice person at the restaurant! The stuffed mushrooms were fantastic, chicken piccata and spaghetti meatballs were delicious. The food was good enough, but not that great to make up for the rest of it. We had to ask for cutlery and refills of water all through the meal. I'd probably go back for take out but most definitely not to dine in.
I love this place, and their 2 for $40 deal is phenomenal.

Great food, not great service. My friend and I went on a Saturday afternoon around 5pm. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the food and the specials, but when it comes to filling up your free glass of water, he seemed to not care so much. I guess because it's free. I had to wave my hand to get my glass of water refilled, not once, but twice.  So the 4 stars are mainly for the food. We had: - Calamari Fritte (Fried Calamari). It's pretty good, tender and not rubbery. - Linguine di Mare (Seafood with Linguini). I LOVE IT. Very generous with the seafood for the price of $21. The shells from the clams and mussels alone filled up an empty bowl, huge amount of food, 3 meals for me. - Beef Tenderloin Medallions. The beef was lacking flavor, and the asparagus were dry, but the mashed potato was delicious. - Tiramisu. I like it a lot, I would say it's comparable to Buca di Beppo's tiramisu. I would go back and try other pasta dishes and appetizers.

I'm a fan of Maggianos. Every now and then I get a craving for their basic spaghetti with meatballs. I don't know why, but I do. I guess it's just cuz I enjoy it.  My Mom likes coming here, and since there was a group of folks in from out of town (we had a table of 10) it seemed like a good place to come. They have room to seat us (unlike a lot of restaurants downtown where the quarters are tight and cramped) and they do the "family style" option of serving food.  Overall, I enjoy Maggianos food because i think their food actually has flavor, even the basic spaghetti/meatballs. A lot of restaurants, in my opinion, go too easy on the seasoning and so the food can be boring. Not here. Overall we've been to this location a few times, and the food is always consistent. They're always willing to work with you on tweaking your order to your liking, or maybe making something a little different. Last night we did the family stye and everyone loved everything ordered. The service last night was pathetic, unfortunately. But this is not the standard. It's usually better than it was. In addition, they charged us incorrectly (causing about a $50 difference on the bill) but once I pointed it out they were more than happy to fix it. They were HORRIBLE about refilling drinks last night. I was just drinking soda, and at one point sat for about 10-12 minutes with an empty glass and they were nowhere to be found to refill it. Tisk-tisk. Overall - i do usually really enjoy the food here. I'd probably suggest Maggianos out in Schaumburg more than I would downtown. To me, there are SO many restaurants to choose from when downtown that it doesn't make sense to hit a "chain"restaurant like this. HOWEVER, with that being said - it WAS a good selection based on our need to seat a larger than average group. Personally, I wouldn't have chosen maggianos, but I was more than happy to come here and eat their delicious food. Oh and the bread. mmmm-mmmmm good.
Service is good but the food is forgettable. Had their special 'rigatoni 'd'' and it was bland with little flavor. Don't bother, find a better Italian Restaurant.

We had reservations for a group of 11 and were seated as soon as we arrived. The service was excellent and the food more than enough for a troupe of hungry 19 year olds. I definitely recommend sharing appetizers and main courses. They are very generous. A number of us had various fish dishes and were very happy. And the dessert sampler was a hit!

Terrible service. Sat down, waited 15 minutes for a waiter to comeby- never did. I had to go over to the bar on the other side of the restaurant to order a glass of wine. We ordered dessert. I pulled a big piece of plastic string out of my tiramisu- and when I notified our waiter, he replied back with, "oh, thats just from what they are wrapped in." So...that makes it okay for me to find a foreign object in my food? Disturbing...this restaurant belongs on Kitchen Nightmares.

This place is your typical crowd pleaser.  When you have a big group of people and are unsure of where to take them because of their dietary or food preferences, you take them to Maggiano's.  This is basically what happened with the group of co-workers that I went to lunch with a few weeks ago.  Service was good - they understood the dynamics and the speed that the food needed to be served.  All the food was typical of Chicago - portions too big, too much sauce.  Another day, same shit.

I'm giving 3 stars because the food is always very good, but sometimes the service can be lacking.  Most times we have been there, everyone is very friendly, but the quality of service is not consistent.  Most times we make the reservation, and are seated fairly soon after our time.  However, the most recent time we went, we had a party of 4 that was told the reservations were running 45 minutes behind (in my opinion that should never happen if you take reservations), but we could wait 20 minutes for a bar table.  After taking the bar table, it took on average 20 minutes to get any drink or food orders or to flag down our server.  In addition, one of the wine glasses brought to us had lipstick on it and then the wrong wine was brought after that, along with incorrect food orders.  Overall, I would say most trips are good to decent, but the last one was not what they're capable of.

We have been here, several times, without reservations, and have always been able to get a table for two.  I had a squash ravioli with a light sauce that was their nightly special that was so wonderful, it could have been dessert.  My husband had a very thick and delicious lasagna.   As an appetizer we had zucchini strips that were really fantastic in a crispy breading with ranch on the side.  Our waitress, Heather, was really nice, and recommended a pitcher of red sangria which we really enjoyed.   It was fruity, and had a little bit of carbonation.    Even though we were STUFFED we decided we had to order the dessert, a toasted pound cake with carmelized banana, vanilla bean ice cream, chocolate shavings and chocolate sauce.  It may honestly be one of my favorite desserts ever!  Two thumbs up and a big toe! If I had to have a complaint......it is that there is nothing special about Maggiano's.   There are no gimic's or any live music that I've noticed,iIt is just a fantastic Italian restaurant, in a great location, with great food, great service, easy seating, and nice staff.

We went here for my boyfriend's birthday. The food was absolutely delicious, the drinks were strong, and the dessert was plenty- everything you could ask for! Unfortunately, Maggiano's did not get the full 5 stars because we had a horrible waitress named Heather. She was rude to us for no reason (I am always very nice waiters/waitresses because I know how tough of a job it is!). She basically ignored us the entire time we were there. Ironically enough, the people seated at the table next to us had an amazing waitress who was kind, attentive, and accommodating. We actually ended up asking her for a few things when our waitress was nowhere to be found. Then when our waitress found out, she left in quite a huff to find "that girl", as she put it. Also, I ordered a latte after my meal which I never received. I was quite disappointed. By the time we left, she had neither remembered nor mentioned it.  The food was delicious- definitely the best Italian I've had in a while. The prices were moderate for an Italian place- pretty typical fare for great food. We had the 2 for 40 deal, which allows you to pick an appetizer, two simple pastas for entree, dessert, and 2 simple pastas for take-out. That's a lot of food for $40!! We had the chicken and green pepper flatbread (absolutely delicious), pesto ravioli, garlic aglio, and chocolate zuccatto cake. We also got the ravioli and spaghetti and meatballs to go. Everything was so good that it makes us to want to go back for more!! Our compliments to the chef, who did an amazing job with the food. Our waitress could try to be a bit more accommodating and attentive- maybe take a tip from the waitress serving the table that was next to our table! Pros: Food Dessert Drinks Moderate price Decor Ambience Location Cons: Rude waitress

Maggiano's is one of my favorite places to go for Italian and one of my LEYE favorites.   For this particular location, it's best to make a reservation if you're coming for dinner.    The entrees are filling and great for groups.  The Apple Crostada tastes like heaven...The wine selection is extensive and service is attentive and friendly.  I especially love working with them when planning private work functions.   The entire process is smooth and stress-free.  They helped me plan a graduation dinner for 85 people last summer and everyone loved the food and overall had a great time   (family-style is the way to go).  They even included lovely flower centerpieces and a printed menu.   They truly take care of everything for you! The perfect choice for both personal and business dinners.

I've been here twice and overall, I'm disappointed.  I went here a year ago for a work function, and the chef called me ahead of time as I have lots of food allergies, and we planned a menu. I arrived at the function and ate a delicious meal.  I went here last night, and the chef called me a couple of days ago, and he told me to let the staff know when I arrived so we could talk. I had to ask three different members of the waitstaff before someone actually came and got him. The first two people just totally blew me off. By the time I actually got to talk to him, he was clearly stressed as dinner was about to start and he had next to no time to make me a meal, and while what he made was tasty, I easily could have eaten four plates of it and still had room for the (non-existent) dessert I ordered. Seriously, how hard can it be to make a fruit cup?  I understand that this is the fault of the staff and not the chef, but I really expected more. While I've had good experiences here, it only takes one bad experience to really change your opinion on the place.  Overall: the chef is good at what he does, but the waitstaff is unprofessional and my experience was disappointing at best. Edit: I went back here for another work function and was much more vocal about my needs, to the point where I felt like I was being rude, and I had a much better experience. I don't think I should have to be this vocal to have my needs met.
I recommend the Mushroom Ravioli with Braised Veal delicious!  Good atmosphere and beautiful decoration as well.

The scene: The rehearsal dinner the night before my wedding. The attendees: My future in-laws and extended family. The New York, Italian in-laws. And my family. A mix of country bumpkin from Daddy's side and southern chic from my Mother's. Three vastly different groups, all of whom are skeptical of parking attendants, let alone new family members, nestled into one dining room.  What could go wrong?  Absolutely nothing, under the care of events coordinator, Dana! Laid-back until it's time to get down to business, Dana walked us through the menu at our initial tasting, smoothed over payments (sometimes the guy's family forgets these little details), and laughed off exact deadlines for selections and payments. The night of the event, she was there with her game face, ready to make sure my Godfather had his scotch, the centerpieces were all on the table, the groom's cake was displayed just so, and the bar was quite stocked.  Though our dining room was a little cramped (note to us and now you dear brides, booking the rehearsal dinner further than two months out would have been a smarter choice and left us with more room options), it made for getting up and talking to family and friends much easier.  The food was spectacular (brides, this isn't for you. You aren't eating the night before the wedding) with a salad, three appetizers, three courses and dessert. And wine. Lots and lots and lots and lots of wine. The southern belle in me insisted on keeping traditions with a groom's cake as the main dessert. Those not in the know- a groom's cake is a rich, decadent chocolate cake given to the groom and his family by the bride, and is usually a kitschy shape or design. Ours was our college mascot. The moral of this story- Italian food and a lot of liquor will make all guests comfortable enough to play nice for a wedding weekend. Oh, and get the eggplant with cream cheese. Good God.
Great place for dinner with out of town friends, came in without a reservation and were able to sit at the piano and watch the snow fall out the window.

We had a family style lunch since there were about twenty of us.  Everything we had was great!  Great salad, good stuffed mushrooms, amazing tilapia,  great chicken panna cotta, amazing chicken and spinach manicotti and delicious tiramisu.  Service was good.  Will definitely be back!
Food was great, along with the service.  Just make reservations, cause this place is packed!
The service here was very good 4 stars on its own. We ordered dinner for two. Started with mozzarella and marinara for appetizer then we had lasagna and Alfredo for entries all was great
We love Maggiano's for quality food and service, comfortable ambiance and value. We avoid weekends, however, and recommend booths only for a quieter dining experience.

I went to Maggiano's with a friend this weekend.  The food was great and the service was good as well - even though they were very crowded.  The one thing that bothered me is that we had made reservations for 8pm through Open Table and when we arrived on time, they handed us a buzzer and we had to wait for almost 30 minutes! So, they don't REALLY take reservations.  If I had wanted to go to a restaurant that didn't take reservations and made me sit around with a buzzer - I would have gone to the Cheesecake Factory.

I went there with my family on Christmas Eve we had a 7:00 or 7:30 reservation they were on time, but the hostess had a little attitude(maybe she didn't want to be there)but what ever no big deal. Nice atmosphere and was not over booked so no rush and not a lot of noise which was nice. We hadd a party of 12 and we did family style. Food was very good but the service was the WORST. Our servrver had a very bad and cold attitude from the start. Bottom line I will NEVER go to a Maggianos again as much as I love the food I emailed the main office to let them know what happened and to this day no one bothered to call back. I know they won't go out of business but I will never go there and neither will my family or friends if I have any say in it....The sad thing is I hate to write bad reviews but it they never responded so they obviously could care less.....

We love this place.  We had an event here, in the downstairs private area.  The staff was great to work with right from the start.  The space was perfect.  The food was delicious.  If you're looking to have a rehearsal dinner or a big event, this is a great place.  The bar area worked well for guests to hang out before dinner and the dinner space was beyond our expectations.

I was visiting family in Chicago and the family made a reservation in advance at Maggiano's. We arrived on time and we still waited fifteen minutes to be seated. The servers were friendly, but the service was average.  From what I've gathered the popular feature is the extra entree they send home with you after your meal.After finding that out I had high expectiations.Our server didn't even mention the entrees to go at the end of the meal. We were already full from the food, so we weren't worried about anything else.  Desert was pretty good, they also gave us lemon cookies after the meal.

Great service, good food, large portions. We had reservations, arrived a little late and were seated right even though they were on a wait. The staff was very courteous and professional. The prices were very good, especially the special where you take home two entrees when you order two. Although the pasta was a little dry all in all the food was good. The salads were excellent, the calamari appetizer was great and the tiramisu was awesome. I would definitely go back!

Maybe the original is always the best.  I ate here a few years ago and everything was good to great.  I have eaten at other Maggiano's little Italy across the country and none came close to the quality of the Chicago location.

The best time to go is during the Christmas season! It gets busy and there's a piano man by the bar who also takes requests. The environment is rather loud. Definitely make a reservation because it gets packed regularly. The servers and waiters are always great and very helpful. There's a great (and affordable) deal with classic pastas that lets you take an extra pasta home with you. All of these classic pastas are the least expensive meals on the menu, but just as good as the rest. The Italian soda is worth the price.

I am not only writing this review because of how delicious and affordable Maggiano's is. I am writing this review because of the professionalism Maggiano's showed to resolve an issue. I bought a gift card from them fro a client. You can imagine my chagrin when the client called me from the restaurant stating that the gift card was invalid. I called Maggiano's and they immediately started digging to get to the bottom of it. They even called me on Thanksgiving to let let m eknow that they were still working on a resolution. Although they never got to the bottom of why the card was not activated, they sent me two gifts cards for (basically doubling the value) my trouble. this is how business should be done.

The service was excellent, the place was clean and the food tasted good all while it was consistently busy. As someone raised in an Italian home, I found it hard to feel Italian in there. It's more like an Italian place ran by Anglos for Anglos which I guess is cool for entertaining large groups of people looking for "EYETALIAN" food. The portions were embarrassingly huge. I felt like I was in the movie Defending Your Life with Meryl Streep. I did have fun there, though. It was a nice time albeit not really the trattoria experience.

i love this place, i think mostly for the quality and the portions. I am very picky in my food. The food here is consistently good. not once i was disappointed, great place for groups and family dinner.  portion are generous! free pasta to go when you buy a classic pasta! WHAT! awesome! this place feeds me for days. i love the salads (chopped yummy!) and dessert (tiramisu and chocolate to die for) also. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

We are frequenters of Maggiano's downtown.  I have to say that the food is almost always consistently good.  My main issue is the service!  The past three or four times that I have dined here the service has declined signficantly.  I had also contacted the company in regards to my concerns and never got a response.  I may try once or twice more at this location to see if my experience is any better.  Very disappointing because I do enjoy the food.

It's inexpensive and delicious.  Sure it may not be the newest and most inventive italian restaurant, but it's been a favorite of mine since childhood, when they had the full and half orders.  There is nothing to complain about for me.  And while I have eaten at a lot of the other Maggiano's across the country, none of them are deserving of 5 stars except the original one on Clark St. in Chicago!

I took my parents and their friends here on a Tuesday night and it was great! I was not happy with the hostess though.. she took awhile to seat us and just wasn't friendly. other than her... everything else was great. Ambiance -  The restaurant was pretty busy and the tables are a bit close together, but that was ok. It wasn't loud, so we could talk comfortably across our round table.  Food - The portions are gigantic!! So if you want a lot of food, then this is the place for you. It tasted pretty good too... not as flavorful as the Italian restaurants that I prefer... but it was still good. We got the stuffed mushrooms and the calamari as appetizers and we enjoyed both. My parents got the lobster crusted tilapia (which they didn't really like) and the shrimp scampi over pasta (which they really liked). I had the mushroom ravioli's with veal and marsala sauce and it was quite delicious... different too. I don't see that on many restaurants' menus. Service - Our waiter, Nick, was awesome! He was very attentive, but gave us our space to talk as well. It's very difficult to find a great waiter who can manage that balance between being attentive and annoying... but he was great!! He also provided suggestions and was super nice.  We had a great experience and we would definitely go there again!

My review is totally based on a private dining event. I will be as specific as I possibly can be.  First let me start out that the booking process was great and they were able to accommodate a party of 25 with a weeks notice.  When we arrived for our 6 pm seating at 550, the tables were not set up, and they were in an odd formation. Basically you couldn't see all the tables in a row because one was off to a side.  Not normally a big deal but it was three tables over two small rooms it was just odd.  We requested the move the one table in line with the other two and told they couldn't as they would not be able to reach the folks against the window. Not really sure why that would matter we were eating family style.  Nonetheless one table was moved to sit between the two rooms and the third was accommodated. So now everyone can see each other. This was critical as we were in town for a team building event and not everyone ha been together during the day.  Onto the next issue. We had 2 servers and one waitress who did double duty as bartender. I gotta say this lady makes the best Cosmo I've ever had.  However everyone complained about her lack of something. J'nai sais quois.  When moving tables she told people they had to get up. Not please could I have you stand from the table - move  Seemed put out that we arrived early also.  So needless to say we all get situated and our last three MIA team members show up  And we start serving dinner at 620 ish. Some team members were starving. Nothing I can do about that, but we were expected at 6. The food -plentiful and very good. We started with bread and chopped salad and maggianos salad. House salad was truly delicious.  Apps were fried mozzarella and bruschetta. Wish their had been more mozzarella per table and that it had been warmer. It was room temp. Big party I didn't complain.  Next up was bow tie pasta, and penne with eggplant. The bow tie amazing. Perfectly al dente and tasty. The penne - whole grain ain't my thing but the eggplant was not my thing.  Followed by salmon with lemon and herb and chicken piccata.  Both delicious perfectly cooked consider the large team for dinner.  Desert was Nonna's chocolate cake which was one big ol' piece for the whole table  After one bite you can tell why !  Holy sambuca!  Yep sambuca in te cake. Not everyone cares for sambuca an it was a strong licorice flavor.  For the 2 nd desert we had profiteroles with vanilla ice cream and chocolate drizzle.  The profiteroles were a little stale but great desert option  So overall a really nice experience. The service could have been just a tad more but food wise cannot complain.

We came to Maggiano's after a day of family fun for a contest. We made reservations online and was able to sit in the bar area for a drink and appetizer till our table was ready. Very quick service and the food was good, Love the fact that you receive a complimentary bowl of pasta ,refrigerated ready to take home. We had the spagetti with meat sauce, It was good, but no wow factor also a shrimp pasta, Good eats! yes I would eat there again.

We were very disappointed with my party last night.  When we had a similar party event two years ago with the former service oriented catering staff, everything was perfectly orchestrated.(hear this, loud and clear, current management team!)  Unlike the party two years ago, last nights party was, very, very unorganized with few of the current staff invested in our party including the catering manager on duty (not the captain, who was very attentive).   The above out weighs the  tasty food and drink offered.  I would think more than twice to come back here for a party or reception.

Time: ~14:30 Made online reservation through Yelp/Open Table Location - quiet, 20-25 people max Wow, went here with a friend and I am impressed. My friend is allergic to Gluten, and this place provides Gluten free pasta sauce/pasta. The waitress wasn't sure about their Gluten free options, so she actually requested the chef to come out to talk to her. The chef was really nice, explained  everything from which dish is Gluten free, to how they cook things separately so it doesn't cross contaminate. The waitress made her regular checks on us, and the food was amazing. even when I had to head it back up on an airplane oven.

If you like HUGE portions the size of what the Jolly Green Giant would want, then this is the place to go. If you want really good Italian food, I would go to a more authentic place.  There are just TOO many other options for Italian in Chicago to visit rather than here. But we came here because some people in our group really like this place.   We had several different dishes, including salmon, chicken Florentine, chicken marsala, eggplant parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs. All dishes were good; not great, but not bad.  However, the service we received from Lucas was exceptional.  If you do come here, ask for him.  He is attentive and knows how to give superior service to everyone at the table.

If anybody wants to tell you that this is excellent italian food then they simply havent had good italian food. This place is very comparable to Olive Garden more than anything else. In other words, the ingredients are really high in sodium and you just tell that the cheese doesnt have the fullness of quality cheese.  I can really tell that the food just doesnt have that dynamic flavor that quality italian food has. Good tomatoes, good spices, fresh herb, and quality cheese etc... play such a huge role into the goal of good italian food. I mean the list goes on and on too....the olive oil, the cream. You can just tell that these ingredients are just low cost full of perservative and blahblah. I feel sorry for the people that cant notice this to btw. That being said, I live right by it and the way that they have carry out set up is really convenient and on a rare binge I will shamefully resort to maggianos. Hence 2 stars.

Huge portions, good food. Service can be a little shaky, waited quite some time for a soda refill. Be prepared to have tons of leftovers, especially if you choose the family style meal. I'd probably go back, but only if I was with a large group.

Pro: Let me inform you that I love, love, loooooove this place ! My mother-in-law and I came here for some much needed time away from our day to day living. Everything we had here was delicious.  We had the spinach stuffed raviolis, sausage dish, the chopped salad, and the grilled veggies( we were eating like queens:)). All of it was totally delish and the "green" looking house dressing that they served with the chopped salad was a "WOWZER" !  Con: It's a little tight here, but I did go to the washroom and saw their party rooms. They were nice and roomy.The valet can be a little irritating because they seem to be busy during dinner hours, but get this it's only $12 bucks!! Yes, close your mouth and make your reservations:)

Wow, so much food! We were a party of four and ate family style. There was so much food that we had to box up leftovers. The food was great, unfortunately, the service was incredibly slow. It took nearly 4 hours for all of our courses to arrive.

This was my second time going here with my wife and both times were amazing. Not only is the food good, but the portion sizes are large, and the ambiance is cool. I had the lobster tilapia, along with their house wine, and desert samplers. Due to the excellent attention of our waiter, the timing of the serving was perfect. All in all, you really can't go wrong choosing Maggiano's.

This poor rating relates to the service at this location. I love Maggiano's... its huge, affordable portions and great food.  However, I recently dined in at this restaurant with 3 others and it took at least 2 hours to get out of here.  Servers were hardly in sight in the dining room; food took forever and we waited maybe another 20 minutes just to get our check! I'll stick to carryout from now on..

Brought two out of town guests on a Sunday evening.  We arrived approximately 8pm The food was incredible...our service however,  less than stellar ...as a server myself it was apparent that our server was in hurry to get out....which is a shame. I would've loved for my first time here to have been a good time.

What a great Italian restaurant.  Not sure what to expect here since I've never heard of this place before.  I just noticed it as my wife and I were walking around Chicago.  One night we decided to stop in for dinner with my daughter.  We were seated very quickly and our drink order was taken immediately.  It was around 5:30pm and was just beginning to get crowded but everyone was talking very quietly and just added to the ambiance of Maggiano's.  Our server was training someone at the time and seemed a little overwhelmed with taking food orders and training at the same time but she managed it.   The food was very good.  I got the chicken and spinach tortellini, my wife got the spaghetti in meat sauce and my daughter got the spaghetti with a huge meatball but it wasn't as huge as stated on the menu but was good.  I just had to try it.   My wife and daughter were happy with their dinner and mine was pretty good as well.  The chicken was just extremely hot and I mean extremely hotter then the everything else on my plate so I had to wait for it to cool down before I could eat.  So by the time it cooled down so did everything else.   I would visit Maggiano's again so I can try something else on the menu, everything sounded great and would have loved to stopped in a second time but trying to entertain a 2 year old at dinner on certain days is impossible.
I especially love Italian cuisine and every times we went there food was amazing. I love the spaghetti and meat ball. They always give me one to take home.

Had a group dinner here. Appetizers were OK; entrees miserable. Most of the pastas were too salty and lacking in flavor. Steak was cooked to shoe-leather consistency. Desserts were bland. Everything seemed like it could have come out of a microwaved factory tray. There are so many non-chain Italian restaurants within the River North neighborhood that it's really hard for me to imagine why you would go here instead.

Went here at an off hour and it was fairly empty.  As such the waiter service was decent and not hurried.  The order was messed up a bit which is worrisome when there are not many people there but I didn't listen when the order was repeated to me.  I just assumed the waiter got it right.  Live and learn. The food was really good, well I thought it was.  I got the Chicken Romano (special) and it had so many flavors running through it.  It was two breasts on a bed of noodles with lots of other items mixed in.  Yummy. Yes, and way too much food.  Sent the food home with my daughter.  No one finished their meal.  Oh the sangria was really good.  Homemade just make sure you mix it up a bit as the bartender much have poured the liquors into the pitcher but didn't mix it up.  Still it was very very good.

I have been to the Maggiano's in Denver and had a much better experience. I was with 3 of my sisters and they were excited to try it for the first time. Two of us had the daily fish special which was dry and charred on both sides which was the overwhelming taste of the dish, yuck. Two others ordered from the classical dishes and asked for the whole wheat pasta--oh what a mistake. Both dishes were dry and the noodles were chewy. Deep disappointment.

I have come here so many times, mostly because my dear sister loves it's one of our go-to places for a dinner out if we don't feel like trying something new. Maggianos (this particular location is the only one I've been to) is the best I've had at a chain Italian restaurant by far. There are some dishes that I've had that are really good, some decent, and some just okay. But on the whole, it's much better than other italian chains. My favorite dish BY FAR is the gnocchi. YUM. Highly recommended. I also enjoy getting a mini-tiramisu dessert - a fairly regular portion for a dessert actually. The regular tiramisu could feed 3. In general, portions are large so I always expect that I will take some home to eat the next day. Don't fill yourself up too much on the bread that they give at the beginning! On some nights (usually weekends?) they have a piano man in the lounge area who takes song requests.

Maggiano's is always a safe bet as are most of the Lettuce Entertain You restaurants. I was here for a board meeting of an organization that I am on the board of and we gorged on the calamari which is excellent, fried cheese gizmo's, cheesy artichoke dip and something elase all of which is great. This place is famous and consistent across all locations for "Big Food" so unless you are a monster eater expect to leave with a doggie bag. The service is always great too as I don't think I have ever had a bad wait person. One other thing to note is their banquet area in which several parties can be going at the same time.We have our Illumedia Annual Christmas party there and it is always a stellar time with about 125 people.

Love love love this place. I have been going for years, just over 15, and nothing ever changes.  The food is amazing - large menu, a lot of options and something to please everyone. I always get the chicken marsala, which is fantastic. I promise you will love it. The sauce is made to perfection, best mushrooms and well-cooked chicken. The spaghetti and fettucine alfredo are delish, caesar salad is perfect. The only thing I would encourage them to work on are the dessert choices, although their lemon cookies are amazing.  I love the feel and ambience - old world Italy playing Sinatra and similar tunes. Vintage photos of family and special guests everywhere. I just can't ever pass up on this restaurant. If you love Italian food, you'll love Maggiano's.

I would never have guessed this was a chain!  We had a group of 8 so the fact that meals are served family style was perfect.  Sharing is the way to go so that you can taste as many items as possible. Appetizers included the fried zucchini which looked like a work of art.  Crisp and tasty.  We also the crab cakes.  Whatever you do, be sure to include the sauce...it was a little spicy but very tasty. We had both the chopped salad and the Maggiano's salad.  I preferred the chopped salad as it had all the tidbits I like including avocado.  Others preferred the Maggiano's salad because of the dressing.  Both were good. The lasagna was excellent.  Tasty and filled with meat.  The beef with mushroom sauce was so tender that I could cut it with my fork.  The mashed potatoes were creamy and tasty with the beef.  The veal parmigiana was cooked perfectly with lots of cheese. For dessert, I recommend the Profiteroles were simply divine!  Light cream puffs filled with vanilla ice cream, hot fudge and whipped cream!   It is a crowded and noisy place.  The staff was efficient, but not overly friendly.  They kept the food coming and our glasses filled.  The place is so hectic, don't be surprised if you hear a tray dropped. All in all, it was a good experience...just not 5 stars worth!

Went to Maggianos on a whim in Chicago.  I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants, especially for Italian cuisine and should have gone with my instinct.   Arrived about 10 minutes early for our Open Table reservations and was seated immediately.   The service was rushed and nothing to write home about.  Giving me two glasses of water at the same time does not make the service better, it makes my ice melt, water warm and you look like a lazy waiter :( The food portions were HUGE.  If you like leftovers or to share (which I would encourage) this is the place for you. The food itself was bland and salty.  Nothing really flavorful.  My date ordered the Chicken Parmesan which came with two cutlets, lots of sauce and a side of spaghetti.   I ordered the Chicken Tortelloni and it had about 10 huge pieces with lots of cream sauce and chunks of ham.  Not exactly what I was looking for, tasted like I was eating salt.   The prices are moderate, the service fair at best as is the food.  My suggestion in Chicago, go to a local Italian non chain restaurant.  You will get a better experience, better food and more memorable occasion.

Recently joined a gym and one of the perks was a VIP card for Maggianos in Chicago.  We visited the web site put together by Maggianos for VIPs ahead of time to see what the daily special was.  Got to the restaurant and were told The VIP card had been discontinued 3 months earlier and that they would not honor the deal.  We got up and left.  It's not about the money, but it shows how poorly managed the place is when they still have a running web site For their VIP club that doesn't even exist anymore.  I also gave tho a 1 star because the restaurant was dirty. Crumbs all over the tables and booths.  I've previously dined with Maggianos in Orlando, FL and it was excellent.  I'd go back there but will stay away from the one here in Chicago.

came here with some friends for an informational dinner about MS. the menu consisted of the house salad, bread, lasagna with meat sauce, fettucine alfredo, cheesecake and apple crostadas for dessert. I really liked the salads dressing, kind of a sweet vinagrette. The fettucine alfredo was tasty as well but i always like a bit of brocolli with it. the apple crostada with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream was outstanding! i couldve eaten that as my meal! yummmmmmy!
We have eaten here twice and the food, service and atmosphere was just great.  I know this is a chain but the food was great and they do several things in house.  We will be back.

I have not been to Maggiano's in 15 years.  I used to love it, but wrote it off after waiting once or twice for 2+ hours in the bar for a table.  Little did I know that, sometime since the Clinton administration, they started taking reservations. I had a Lettuce Entertain You GC that I wanted to use, and when my GF suggested Maggiano's. I thought why not.  The first thing I noticed was that the Corner Bakery was gone, which is why now you now get a basket of basic "Italian" bread instead of an assortment of interesting fresh breads and crackers that you got in the 90s.  The bar server, who was very pro, explained: "they got rid of the bakery and expanded the bar because the bar is more profitable".  So a bit more bar profit is more important than really good bread?  This diner disagrees: booze is everywhere in this country, good bread is very hard to find.  The piano bar is...a...um, interesting addition to an Italian restaurant.  The chopped salad was large and tasty. The shrimp and rice thing was good, but I was a bit surprised to get like 16 shrimp and yet a 1/2 cup of rice...some more rice  would have been better.  Maybe the chef thought that less rice would make the shrimp look more abundant, not really, I mean there were over a dozen good-sized shrimp, which is fine.  Just add more rice already.  The service was good, but a bit green.  There is actually a deal here now where you get all this pasta to eat, and a second meal of pasta to take home.  I don't get that: is it cold, frozen, yesterday's???  They should remove that, because it makes their food look too cheap, like Olive Garden or something.  There were also some empty tables on the Friday night we were there; interpret that any way you want.  I think I'[ll leave Maggiano's for the tourists, and stick to Taylor St. and Melrose Pk.

normally i wouldn't be caught dead here, but my friend had an intense craving for Maggiano's and no other Italian would suffice. and hey, it wasn't as bad as i thought, which definitely supports the case for having low expectations because then you'll get pleasantly surprised more often than not! i ordered the gnocchi in tomato cream vodka sauce. post-workout, it tasted good, although the gnocchi's texture/taste was just slightly off. but the sauce was delicious and made up for that. i tried my friend's leftover take-home spaghetti, and i've gotta say it was good. so yay, magginano's doesn't eff up spaghetti! joy! don't get the fondue pepperoni/pepperochini appetizer. imo it's pretty gross and you feel guilty after every mouthful. the taste-to-calorie ratio just isn't that high enough to be worth it.

We just had our wedding at Maggiano's in their banquet space. The entire process was so easy and felt  flawless with the help of Jeffrey Godecker and his staff. From the time we first went to look at the venue to the communication  along the way, everything was great! Our guests had a wonderful time, the space was beautiful, the staff overly kind and attentive, and of course, the food was great! We really felt like they were so accommodating and knowledgeable throughout the process and made us feel as special as any couple should on their wedding day. It was so nice to show up to the reception without any concerns and simply feel calm in knowing everything had and would be taken care of. I can't recommend it enough for a wedding reception. We just had to be sure not to overindulge in the food in order to still be able to dance!

I have gone here many times, always getting something new, and I have yet to have a bad dish. It's not the best Italian food I've ever had, but for a chain restaurant, the food is great. The atmosphere is nice and I really enjoy the live music. and the staff is great. It's a great place for groups!

I've been coming to Maggiano's every Wednesday night since November. The atmosphere is great and I really enjoy the live music. The staff is great, especially Jason and Allie, they work super hard and make you feel so welcome. I'd definitely recommend coming into Maggiano's, not only for the delectable food menu but for the bar area where you get the best experience and service possible. Thanks guys!!! Wednesday Nights with Bob Solone and Bill Demis, great crowd and great music!!

Yummo!  Whether or not this is 'authentic' Italian food, it is delish!  I sometimes get the baked ziti, fettuccini alfredo or spaghetti and meatballs.  The fettuccini was a little chalky/powdery tasting, but everything else is good - the meatballs especially!  No matter what, I always get at least two orders of the parmesan garlic bread.  It is one of the best things I've ever eaten.

I'm torn by Maggiano's.  On one hand, the food was pretty good.  On the other hand, it's a chain restaurant and I'm pretty sure it's one of the reasons Americans are fat. We made a reservation around 7:30 on Friday via OpenTable for 8 the same night.  We got there about 10 minutes early and immediately started to get twitchy.  My stress level was just too high for a place like this that particular Friday night.  Waiting in the bar with women squealing at each other over their drinks, a man on my right acting like he's selling the after dinner mints, and a 5 year old on my left making some loud noise repeatedly, almost made me ask if we could leave.  And it was only 7:55 at this point.  At 8:10 we were told our table was ready.   The server seemed harried.  Also, his hair was a mess.  This made me giggle.  After almost dropping about 3 glasses he finally spilled my iced tea.  Not a big deal.  The fact that he yelped "Oh God!" when it happened was very amusing.  Poor guy.  I'd be a mess too if I was running around this place all night. The food was actually pretty good.  We started with sausage and peppers, they were very good.  The sauce they were served with had basil in it, a pleasant surprise.  I ordered the spaghetti with a really big meatball and meat sauce for my entree.  He had the lobster carbonara.  It was good.  I ate about 1/4 of my dish before finally giving up.  The server asked if we wanted dessert, we both said no we were way too full.  I asked to have my dish wrapped up to go.  He said "No problem.  And what would you like for your second pasta?"  Faced with this question I could only return a quizzical look and "second pasta?".  He said "yes, you get a second pasta to take home with you.  I suggest the baked something or other (I don't remember what it was), it's really good".  I said "sure" (still sporting my quizzical look).   Now, the American in me thinks "Lots of food for a low price! Score!!".  While the healthy person in me thinks "WTF (that stands for What The Fuck)!!!  No wonder so many people in this room are overweight!".  Why are you giving away 4 servings of food to one person for $12.95?!  That's kind of ridiculous.  Why not just lower the price of the Classic Pasta's by half?  I'll gladly pay you $6.95 and only get 1 huge serving of pasta (which is enough for 2 people).  I realize this is a little crazy of me, but I really can't patronize an establishment that is contributing to the delinquency of the masses like this.  Before the whole "second pasta incident" we had been talking about how many overweight people there were in the restaurant (I'm talking obese here, not just a little chubby).  I guess now I know why: they can eat their weight in pasta for the low low price of $12.95.   The food was good, nothing you can't get from half the Italian restaurants in the city.  The service was just eh.  The ambiance is non existent.  And they are making it easy to be unhealthy.  No thanks, I'll pass on Maggiano's next time.

This is a great place for Italian food.   The pasta dishes are quite large,  which can be shared.  i shared the Rigatoni pasta, w/roasted chicken, mushrooms, along with  Linguine di Mare dish w/lobster, shrimp, mussels, clams. Atmosphere pretty lively, and service was A+. Definitely will be coming back.

Went over here for my birthday party last month. After we came in there was a 45 minute wait. We went and order some drinks at the bar. After 20 minutes we were seated in the lunge area which was fine. We ordered dinner and drinks again, and dinner came before drinks. When I asked what is going on with our drinks they said they are mixing them (we ordered cocktails). Portions were huge which I respect but not as nearly tasteful as I expected. In the restaurant with 45 minute wait you are just expecting to have one of the best meals you can have. So at the end I got really upset because I really wanted this to be a good night.  I have to mention that just before I was gonna ask for my check waitress came and brought cake with a candle for me which make the night look better. I don't know if they had one of the bad nights or what happened but my experience over there really wasn't the best one.

Have noticed a gradual but steady decline in the quality of food here over the last five years.  It used to be very good and large family style portions made it an excellent value.  However, on my last two visits over the past two years to this downtown location has me disappointed.  The signature Maggiano's salad, the baked mostaccioli, the veal marsala are now "ordinary".  Take a pass on the tilapia.  However, be sure to get the tiramisu  -- probably the best anywhere!  Even people who claim to not like tiramisu rave about it!

This is a nice Maggiano's. I was here for a work training and the servers and catering were great. They also have nice facilities for meetings downstairs. I typically don't review chains,but this is better than most. Next time i'm in Chicago though,i'll definately be going to an independant restaurant:)

Haven't been to a Maggiano's establishment in years and it used to be very good. For all I know it still is, but not yesterday. Had to work downtown Saturday so a friend of mine and I ate at the Clark St location. The Cesare salad was ok The Bartender/Server was very nice The Marinara was excellent The water had too much chlorine in it - tasted like the smell of a public pool, however, the bartender was nice and gave us a bottle of Aqua Panna on the house - he said it was probably a 'new filter.' The Meatball sandwich on Chiabatta bread was not good. Way too much parmesan and garlic in the meatballs and the parmesan french fries do nothing for me. And yes, you can add too much cheese and too much garlic. Too much of anything usually is a cover up for something bad - not saying the meat was bad, but when all you taste is cheese, garlic and no meatball, it's just a mushy cheesy, garlicy blob. I would go back but not for the meatball sandwich.....

Went last week for dinner with 3 friends: terriffic, as ever.  The waiter was the best and the food incomparable. Try the veal scallopine and the salmon oscar for sure, the broccolini was luscious as was the bottle of wine we slelected. The best Negroni in town, though I asked for gin rather than vodka, and they happily compliedwithout question. superb service includeding a gracious parking valet. Run, don''t wlak there for dinner!!!!!! 5 stars all around!! Delish!!!!

Food here was amazing along with the service!  Told us when we went in, which was pretty busy at the time, that it would be 20-30 min to wait.  We only waited 10!  Great environment, atmosphere, and food!

It was my first time going to Maggianos and I would have to say it was pretty good. I loved their grilled salmon and Tiramisu. I would gladly go again but I would not consider them my ultimate favorite restaurant.

A great place for a chain! I have wanted to go here for a while and I got my chance when my department scheduled the holiday party this year. I loved their food and the ambiance was awesome. There was a live band playing and the music was great. We ate all night and danced all night. It was awesome. Oh the cheesecake and tiramisu for desert were simply awesome. A great place for groups :D

For a new year's day dinner, it seemed natural to go to Maggiano's. They have been reliable, but somehow the recent meal just exceeded my expectations. It was the food -- with the large menu, I consciously wanted to order something I did not have before, and found the baked rigatoni with chicken sausage to be a delight. The sausage was lean and somewhat spicy, and the pasta nicely cooked. Yet beyond the food, the service was outstanding. That really made the meal work well -- Chris, the server was particularly helpful with regard to timing, questions, and initiative. It really made me glad we came, even on what was a busy night at Maggiano's. Update (December 2012): The food is fine, but sometimes the service needs attention. Without listing problems, I advise customers to ask clearly for the service they want, since it can vary between the members of the staff. Perhaps management will improve the situation, but until then, it's important to take charge yourself. When the wrong item arrives, ask for the correct one. Unfortunately, one waiter responds to such things with a smart remark, and if that occurs, ask the manager for a different waiter.  Kudos to the reliable servers, whose efforts are solid

I recently visited this establishment lastnight for my bff's birthday and I had a blast.......until I woke up this morning and to my surprise, the waiter wrapped up the wrong food and left out my boyfriend's and I actual food. We ordered the $39.99 meal for 2 which comes with 1 appetizer, 2 pasta dishes and 1 dessert, plus you get two complimentary dishes to take home. Well.......we got the free dishes, but not what we had wrapped to go and we got someone else's pasta alfredo. The good thing about the whole evening was the service was excelent, the food was great. Sad the bff took a spill on a wet spot on the floor, hillarious by the way, she was ok only her pride was hurt, the manager rushed over and asked if everything was okay and if he could do anything. Overall, I would go back, but I am wrapping my own food. Creme brule' is to DIE for.
The wait here was long but worth it. Service was quick and pasta was great. $39 for four pasta dishes, an app, and desert.

If you are a tourist, have 20 kids, want to go out with grandma for her 78th birthday to a crowed place, or have to take some suburban coworkers: this is your place! For anything else, go somewhere else.  This place has a very Disney-y feel to it; super loud, lots of people, lots of jeans and white gym shoes, sport jerseys here and there too! Basic food, big portions, not for a date... Really, it kind of sucked...

Desperately trying to break by boyfriend of his love for Olive Garden. We went for his birthday dinner and we got the three course special. He got calamari for the appetizer, I had mom's lasagna and cheese ravioli for my take home. He had fettucini alfredo and mom's lasagna for take home. We made a reservation and we waited about 5 minutes to be seated when we arrived. The restaurant was decorated nicely for christmas. We finished off dinner with some tiramisu. I thought the food tasted great and we got a lot of food for our money. Official Olive Garden ban now in place!

Ahhhhh the memories of this place... I love the food here! For the price the quality and the servings are just right! I've been coming here since undergrad and now I bring my family here on special occasions. Family style meals are a fabulous bargain for a party of 7 or more.

Like another poster wrote, this was our second year in a row going to Maggiano's on Thanksgiving. They were slammed. Overbooked, perhaps. They weren't able to seat us until an hour after our reserved time. We had brought friends from out of town and had talked up how good everything was, and the long delay really just frustrated everyone out of the gate. The food was good, but I'm not sure that we'll bother trying to dine here on a holiday again. They just weren't prepared for the crowds and it was very stressful.

I'm not usually a fan of chain restaurants like these, but it's no wonder this is the original location - it was fantastic!  The staff is always super friendly, and the food is always delicious.  The Italian Sausage Flatbread is insane, and the bread is bomb.  They have this ridiculous deal where you get an appetizer, two classic pastas, dessert, and two pastas to take home - that's right, you get two additional meals to take home with you.  Absolutely brilliant.  You can't get a better deal than this, and with such good food at this location, my boy and I have considered making it a weekly outing.  Definitely check it out!

This is my first time back to Maggiano's after few yrs or so. I would say the food quality is not as good as how it was then. There were13 of us and we were here for my best friend's birthday party. Maggiano's told us that we have to go with their family style option since we have a party over 10, and we were fine with that. We selected the Classic option (~$27.95/person). I would have to say that the food we ate were not worthed $27.95/person. I probably would've enjoyed a better meal at a less-fancier Italian restaurant and only have to pay $13. Did not get money's worth. We started with 2 appetizers: Calamari and the spinach and artichoke al forno. The calamari was okay - we got a LOT of tentacles. 80% of the plate was filled with tentacles, not as appetizing if we were given other parts of the squid. The spinach and artichoke al forno was okay - LOTS of cheese, very little spinach and artichoke. I guess that's how you can fill up a plate as dip. Very cheap, I would say. We had 4 entree - the chicken saltimbocca (which was dry and VERY salty. We had a lot of this chicken leftover), linguine & clams with wine sauce (LOTS of pasta, very little clams. The clams were all chopped into tiny pieces so we pretty much ate a lot of pasta to fill), grilled salmon & lemon and herb (this was the best dish. Yum!), and chinati braised beef (not bad..it tastes average and no complaints). We finished dinner with 2 desserts. We had tiramisu (which was very good!.. moist and coffee-ish) and the noona's pound cake (the cake was very hard.kinda like cornbread but it was tasty). Since it was my best friend's birthday couple of us told our waitress and the host that it was her birthday hoping they would do something for her, but unfortunately we had to make mention of it several times til someone came out with candles and cookies to celebrate. A little more work to get their memory to recall her birthday but eventually we got her a birthday celebration.

Went here on a spur of the moment the other night . Sat in the bar and enjoyed the atmosphere & people watching. Server was wonderful - recommended various items, even told us what to stay away from. The chef prepared my food exactly as requested (light on the marinara sauce) and everything tasted great. for a chain restaurant, we enjoyed this place and will return. Not my favorite Italian restaurant and sort of lacks that authentic feel but we will come back again for sure.
Went here for the first time for a valentines day. LOVED IT! Great food and great staff. I will definitely eat here again.

I've been to several of the Maggianos locations, but for this one specifically I have been disappointed time after time. I understand there is a dinner rush but EVERY time I go there, I get hurried in and out. The only thing that keeps me coming back is the Chicken Francese. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!! On my birthday, they did give me the Lemon Cookies which were also very tasty...but as I previously stated they rush us through our meal every time we're there.

The food here was good, but seemed overpriced to me.  Nothing really stood out to me, except for the fact that it was a family-style Italian restaurant.  And, that the family-style environment is what we were looking for, because we had a large party of over 15 people.  But still had a ton of left-overs afterwards.  Probably could have fed another 5 people with all that was left.

I had carryout from here the other day, and loved the quick carry out service.  The pastas here are fabulous, and I love their chopped salad.  This time around I tried something different - the pork scaloppine.  It was so aromatic and flavorful.  I loved it, and even got my boyfriend to think about switching on over to the other white meat.  They were able to substitute the potatoes for the green beans with bacon and I went sans onions, which were cooked just right. The prices are pretty average, and I am tempted to bring my family here for a family style meal the next time they are in town.

I know this is a chain, but guess what...  I really like this place!  Looking back at all the times I've been here, I haven't had a bad meal. Most recently, I was here for a professional organization meeting.  The menu choices made by the organizers were stellar (with the except of mushrooms - which I don't eat). Calamari Bruschetta Salads - spinach, caesar Chicken Marsala Rigatoni w/Italian Sausage Cheese Ravioli Chocolate Cake (omg - this is awesome) Tirimisu I'm full just reading over this list!  I had a little bit of everything and then a lot of the chocolate cake (my fave).  Needless to say, I had to be ROLLED out of there. If you're looking to plan a meeting or a large group dinner, this is a good place to do it.  Cozy banquet rooms, great service, and great food - you can't go wrong.

I simply love this place as one of my "main Stays" in Chicago.  I love eating in the bar area Jason is the total best.  The drinks are the best and you never have to wait for anything period.   There is another bartender thats works with jason thats from new jersey thats amazing as well.   To my knowledge there is a points program..... Check it out!

Had a nice Saturday afternoon lunch with my boyfriend over the weekend.  We have always been big fans of Maggiano's and with the Lettuce Entertain coupons coming out it is yet another great reason to go.   The food was great, service was a bit slow for having only a few customers in the bar area but not terrible.  This last visit I learned about the buy one classic pasta get one to take home for free.  Love this deal!!   Favorites: Maggiano's Salad Gnocchi with vodka sauce - delicious!   We will def be back!

So big and bland I wanted to cry. For a lot of folks they love the giant sizes and hey I admit most people find blandish food much preferable to spicy or 'jazzed up.' good for them this is their place. Bad for me and the semi-foodie population. Nonetheless for what it is at price it's at Lettuce Entertain you aims for that middle spot of revenue and gets it so kudos to them and their biz model. I would just rather something a little more adventurous. This exact post applies to Scoozi's as well btw. these places might pass for huge banquet needs for the price I guess.

It's great that this Maggiano's is so close to my office that I can call ahead to order for pickup.  I ordered their Fazio's Chopped Antipasti Salad and it's HUGE! So much food...I definitely won't be able to finish the entire thing for lunch.  I also love their Rigatoni D...I want to give their Eggplant Parmesan a try at some point too. Also great that they're one of the Lettuce Entertain You restaurants!
Go with the family style!!  Good dishes were  4 cheese ravioli (way better than all of that ravioli you ate as a kid), maggiano salad, and spinach artichoke dip. The service was bad and very slow.

Their gnocchi always hits the spot. Their chopped salad is done well. The Rigatoni D is delicious. Their desserts shouldn't be skipped. Maggiano's is a place you can go and expect consistency. They accommodate large and small parties just the same, are courteous with their carryout. My take is, if you can't get a table at Volare, head over a few blocks on Grand to Maggiano's and enjoy your night.

Insanely good service. My girlfriend and I were having a late lunch and the food took about 20-30 min to be served. We weren't really bothered by it but the manager came out and apologised personally for the long wait and gave us a 30% discount. I would have given a 3 star rating for food but the service just made our dining experience a wonderful one.
ok the food is mediocre and salty.  Definitely a favorite of the suburbanites, I can see why.  Cheap and each dish is for 4 servings/person.   too much food!  If you want a food coma, come here.

When you want decent Italian food fast, what do you do? You count on Maggiano's. And that's what I did last night.  I find it hard to get decent gnocchi in most Italian restaurants but this is one place I can rely on. Other vegetarian items? Not so good. I wouldn't recommend the eggplant parmesan here at all.  Their dessert platter was quite large and hard for even two of us to complete. The apple something was the best one, IMHO.

Who doesn't like Maggiano's. Great food, huge portions, friendly waitstaff. My co-workers and I went for lunch a week ago and they had never been. Well lets say they loved it. The Chef came out and introduced himself and answered a few questions. One of my favorite places.

very unfriendly group from the outset.  It was surprising to be received so rudely.  But S. liked it there so we stayed hair in food. no apologies for visibly dirty glass (twice!!)  disgusting.  absolutely disgusting.  It's just the Olive Garden in different packaging.

Can't go wrong with Maggiano's. Since it's an Italian restaurant, there's always lots of options for vegetarians and they will even make a vegan dish if you would like. I absolutely love the gnocchi and the margherita flatbread and the tiramisu is always a winner. The portions are gigantic and if you are getting pasta, they will happily sub wheat pasta. I always feel like there's not enough sauce (what can I say, I love sauce!) but I never have an issue when I request additional sauce. The service is always phenomenal, whether it's in the actual restaurant or at the carryout counter. You can also eat outside when it's nice outside which is always a plus. Worthwhile to check out!

Ehhhh went here for a work function two days ago. Not a fan, i'd never heard of this place and didn't know it was a chain. Which by the way doesnt impact my thoughts. There are TONS of chains I absolutey love. The only thing good I tried was the chicken manacotti and the spinach and bruchetta dips.  The pasta was horrible, where was the sauce? The salmon was waaaaay over cooked.  Wont be going back.

That was the best eggplant parmesan and tiramisu I've ever had.  Perfect for a large italian family get-together.  We ordered the "classic" sized menu and left with a lot of doggie bags.  Come hungry or order the "light" menu.
Good food but a little overpriced. I would have given it 3 stars if the service wasn't bad.

I give the place 4 stars because we had great service and really good food. Sausage and peppers were so much like my own I though I wa at home. We had a family style party and among the selections: Lasagna = just about as good as I have eaten and only lacking in some earthiness. Sneak in some mushrooms and herbs and you would have an ultimate dish. Linguini White Clam = Bland. Was dying for sea salt and some pepper. My colleague were dumping cheese on it and every Italian on the planet was crying and moaning... I am sure of it.  lol Spaghetti Meat Ball = see my comment on lasanga. Chicken Marsala = delicious and I ate way too much of it.   : ) I even stole some shrooms and use them to pump of the other dishes. Profiteroles = too big and not tender enough and too much ice cream and hot fudge. Not my idea of a profiterole. Cheesecake = simple and perfect... no "factory" necessary.

Great Ravioli!  When I go back I order the same thing.  With Ravioli this good, I don't really care what else is on the menu, and that is not normally like me:  I usually order something different but I'm sticking with the Ravioli (again).

I struggled between 3 and 4 stars here, so this is really a 3.5 star review. I hosted a cocktail reception here for 30 people, so it was apps and drinks.  Plus - the service was really great. Super friendly and helpful, drinks were served quickly. The food was good...when it arrived. Minus - I paid for a 2 hour f&b service but none of the food came out until 30 minutes into the event. I had some veg trays that didn't arrive until 45 minutes into the event. If I'm paying for 2 hours, then I should get two hours, right? So I wasn't thrilled with that since I was shorted 25% percent in effect. But my crowd was happy and a good time was had by all. The end.

Retirement party for former coworker This was a luncheon with a set menu We had very good food, very good service Our group was about 35-40 strong at lunch hour in the Loop They did a wonderful job for us However, the highlight of the party was when a heavy screen fell upon my head and shoulders, as well as the friend sitting next to me.  No warning at all, and no way to avoid it since we were both seated.  Management had us fill out a form, and said someone would get back to us.  No one has, and it's been over a month.  This is NOT impressive, especially considering the prices. Otherwise, a good time was had by all. It isnow July (I was at the luncheon in April), and NO ONE has contacted me about the accident during the luncheon! I'm marking down to 3 stars.

This past saturday I went to this restaurant with my wife, and we were ignored by the staff like never before.  We dined in the afternoon around 4 at the bar area, I guess the evening staff was coming in getting ready for the dinner service, there were only one waitress/hostess at the bar area along with the bar tender, our order was taken quickly, and food was served fast but the waitress would disappear for a long time that there were no one to check on us.  It was my first time eating at a italian restaurant without served any bread.  The waitress sais she forgot, but when I asked a server to get some bread, the man ignored me as well.  food was good, dessert, the fruit tiramisu was superb.  if it weren't for the dessert, I would have given one star to this review, because the service was that sub-par.
Great, solid Italian.  We arrived with a group of ladies and was treated very nicely!  Stuffed mushrooms were delicious, ceasar salad Was tasty
Charming, old world atmo. Good wait staff.  Friendly piano player, Bob. Food is good and fairly priced.

I received a $25 gift card that featured either Maggiano's, Chile's, or South of the Border. Needless to say, I was a bit apprehensive that Maggiano's would be lumped into these other sub-par chain restaurants but hey, it was a free meal, right? I was actually pleasantly surprised! The decor was warm and welcoming- there was a man playing the piano in the bar and the rest of the restaurant was filled with lit candles. Our server brought us yummy warm bread and oil to dip with. We ordered our meals (me= Spaghetti with Meat Sauce, fiance= Lasagna) and our server informed us that every noodle plate came with another noodle plate to bring home with us...for free! Deal! My salad was ehh. Mostly soggy and way too much dressing. But our meals were delicious!! There was so much food, I brought home a good 3/4 of my meal.
