My fiance brought home his leftover lasagna and brought home an additional dish of pesto noodles. Also yummy. Definitely would go here again! For $30 bucks, you pretty much get four meals. For an extra $20, you can also get two glasses of wine and call it a night.

Had Maggiano's cater a party this weekend for under $20 per person including tax and delivery/setup (the  Grande Pkg).   We provided our own beverages.    It was really good!  The favs were chicken marsala and a rigatoni dish w/chicken and mushrooms in a cream sauce.  The dessert assortment was AWESOME (chocolate cake, creme brule, cheesecake). They delivered and did setup in 15 minutes.  We got rave comments on how everyone enjoyed the food.   My only quibble was that they only provided 1 sterno burner per warming rack (and they had space and could have used 2).

Yes, yes, yes!  Every time I go to Maggiano's is truly a treat.  The 4-cheese ravioli: check.  The gnocchi? Oh yeah. I could go on and on.  The service is on par with what I'd expect from a restaurant like this, but it's really the food that keeps me coming back. And if you sign up for their e-club, you'll get dollars off your next visit.

Worst food for the money :( We waited over an hour for our table and were simply underwhelmed by almost  everything. Food, service, decor. I can make better Italian food at home.  And I'm Chinese.  The only good thing about this place is the atmosphere.  We sat in the bar because it was so crowded.  People are here to have a good experience and you can feel it.   The piano bar adds a fun and lively feel to the place.  The pianist is super cool.  He talked more with us than the waitress/waiter did (can't remember if it was a man or woman). So, food sucks but the atmosphere is nice and lively.  Also it is conveniently located on Clark St. but unfortunately I won't be returning.

There's nothing that hasn't already been said about this place. We came here for New Year's Eve, and it was so freakin romantic in there with the lights all dimmed and whatnot. We were seated pretty quickly too, so that was a plus. There was a great gang of oldies hanging out by the piano drinking and singing themselves into 2011....it was a good time. And we had enough leftovers for a few days.  Looking forward to eating here again!
Excellent chicken parmesan, and bread to die for. Great service and nice atmosphere.

My husband and I had our wedding reception here in October.  Everything turned out amazing!  Rebecca was our contact that we worked with.  She was so easy to work with and really made the planning process easy.  We were so happy with everything.  The food, service, setup of the room, it was all great!!  All of our guests had a wonderful time, enjoyed the dinner and dessert table, and we got to take home the leftovers :)  Thank you for everything!

It's a chain with decent food, huge portions, and generally good service. However, the last time I went the service was awful. It seemed like the waiter was in the weeds. ah well As far as food goes, this is generic, lowest common denominator Italian food. Good for a family of picky eaters and those who like the old stand-byes. If you can't get in to one of the many fantastic more authentic Italian places in the area, don't be ashamed to go here. It's good...just not anything special.

I can't deny it - I will forever love Maggiano's.  I have a super sweet spot for big chain-y joints like this, especially ones owned by Lettuce Entertain You.  I love good food, I love fancy restaurants, I love trying new stuff, but nothing will ever stop me from loving Maggiano's the way that I do.  Even that one time they were out of fried zucchini and my boyfriend and I almost cried (it's the best I have ever had - I am dead serious). I have honestly never had a bad experience here - save from the one week I was employed by them and had to choose whether I wanted to fail my college classes or fail the Maggiano's menu quizzes.  Maybe I should've chosen Maggiano's, since that was several years ago and I'm 80k in debt and don't even have a degree to show for it.  I am glad I tried to work there for one week, because I gained a deep love for the food there and also learned that the places I should work at have Sharpie all over the tables and are still living in the glory of having Barack Obama as a former regular... but enough about the Medici. I had only been for dinner before a couple weeks ago, and have never been dissatisfied.  Last year, we came on my birthday and ordered family style for the first time, which I loved because I got to pick everything AND take home all of the leftovers.  This year, my boyfriend and I came for lunch on my birthday (and dinner at Nacional 27 with mom that night AND family dinner that weekend at Wildfire - I told you I loved LEYE places!) and were shocked to learn that if you order a signature pasta dish, you get to pick an ENTIRELY DIFFERENT ADDITIONAL order of pasta TO GO!!!  We left not only with our leftovers, but two full additional orders of pasta!  We couldn't believe it!  I could maybe understand offering customers a free to go order of the SAME pasta, since they would just make it all together in the same pot... but no!  We had ziti and lasagna while we were there and then took home another order of lasagna (for me - I had the ziti, but their lasagna is AMAZING) and gnocchi!  How can you beat that!?!?  Lunch for days!

Being Italian and having a few trips to Italy under my belt, I like to think I know what real, authentic pasta is. With that being said, I tend to avoid places like this since its a bit more mass-produced and unauthentic. However, I was invited to a birthday dinner here so I went with a gift and an open mind. I had a fabulous time. The servings are massive and the prices are reasonable. We went home with so many leftovers, we ate like kings and queens for a couple of days. It wasn't authentic by far, but I was there for fun, friends, and drinks, so who cares? This place knows how to handle groups.

My boyfriend and I came here on a recent trip downtown on the recomendation of one of his coworkers.  We both got the pasta for lunch and took a different one home to eat later on.  It was very good and very inexpensive for the amount of food we got too!  I loved the ravioli and the angel hair pasta with sausage.  Definitely want to come back here someday!!

I was quite surprised to learn that I had never reviewed Maggiano's before, considering I've eaten here umpteen times.  The food is consistently and reliably good. The menu is extensive enough that everyone can find something they like. It's never going to elicit "oohs" and "ahs" (at least from me), but it's solid, hearty, Italian fare, served in generous portions, by friendly staff.  I like that you can go to any Maggiano's and it's exactly the same as any other Maggiano's in the LEYE empire (although I think some of them are not owned by LEYE); that is, no surprises; you always know what to expect.  Highlights include:  *Mozzarella marinara  *Chicken francese, served with an arugula salad and crispy garlic potatoes  *Rigatoni 'D'  *Chicken pesto linguine  *Toasted pound cake with caramelized bananas  *Profiteroles  Their family-style dinner is also a good value. Every time I've gone with my family, we leave with bags and bags of food.  They used to have the option of ordering pastas in half-portion sizes, which they've discontinued. Instead, the menu states that you can take home a complimentary pasta. I think you have to ask for this specifically because the few times I've been since they started this deal, the server didn't offer it and I had to ask. Hey, I have no shame in getting a free entrée.  Maggiano's is like watching the same episode of your favorite show over and over; you always know how it will turn out.

Wow...I've eaten at other Maggiano's before, and I would normally give every other Maggiano's maybe 3 stars just for having adequate fettuccine alfredo, my usual craving. Other than that, it's not the greatest Italian food ever. But yesterday this location just made my blacklist as truly awful.  We showed up for lunch around one, with reservations. The dining room we were in was maybe a quarter full. There were plenty of staff around. Just none that came to our table. We sat there for about 15 minutes, by which time I had worked up a serious craving for some raspberry lemonade after re-reading the menu about 20 times. We stood up and took our time getting our coats on and stuff together. No one came over to our table. We stopped by the hostess stand on the way out to tell them we were leaving and no one had come by to greet us or even take our drink order. They weren't really very apologetic and we were out the door.  We ended up going to Volare and getting great service and good Italian food (from real Italians, loved the accents!)  If you weren't really planning on eating or drinking and just wanted to go out and sit at a restaurant and be ignored, I highly recommend this Maggiano's for crappy service and no food.

Restaurant review Carbohydrate galore! Recently I haven't been to Maggiano in a while since I wanted to cut down my carb intake, but the 12.95 for two meal deal was too good to pass up. The current promotion gives you a classic pasta dish for today and a take home for tomorrow. Previously I would fall head over heels for the meat lasagna covered in melted cheese and sauce with a heavy helping of italian bread to soak up the excess. This meal unfortunately was not the same. The lasagna came on the cold side and given the size of the meal, half way through everything just tasted cold... Nevertheless the first few bites were okay. I completed the meal with tiramasu which was amazing, but expensive (7 dollars for a small slice, luckily I had a coupon for free dessert). My take home meal was a baked ziti which was good the next day, but it didn't have the wow factor. Fyi the meal also is cold and comes from the fridge when you check out. Other than the food, the ambiance is nice for  a quiet date with a live piano music in the bar. Service was quick. Pro: very large filling dishes, friendly staff Cons: food could have been warmer, also on the saltier side. pricey desserts Hidden gem: Sign up for the eclub to get 10 dollars off your next visit. Previously offered free dessert. Also the 12.95 deal is unbeatable for average food that spans over 2 meals

Mangia!! Maggiano's might be a chain, it still delivers tasty fare in a old-fashioned atmosphere that is just PER-FECT for all these gloomy winter nights when you venture outside in order to be pampered and eat like a hog. We arrived early on a Saturday evening after a movie and there was still a 30-minute wait for a table in the dining room. Take notes kids. Make a reservation if you want the grand chic of the white tablecloth 'cause it's not going to happen otherwise. We didn't care, just wanted to eat, so we got a seat in the bar section and were happy campers. Diners. Whatever. We munched on bread, ordered our drinks and in a matter of minutes arrived the true reason of this review writing: Mussels. Some of the best I have had in Chicago. Tuscan style, please: white wine sauce (and I suppose quite a bit of butter from what I could tell from the velvety wonder of the sauce),  cannellini beans,  sun-dried tomatoes, finished with lemon and roasted garlic. The wild boar canneloni with balsamic sauce, the gnocchi and the baked zitti with sausage were all hits and the 'chou' part of the profirerole (the puff pastry if you prefer) was spot on. Never had anything remotely as good in the US. Good to know: - piano/singing many nights of the week - wine is pretty cheap, with a few bottles under $35 - when you order a classic pasta dish, you get one free to go. Seriously. That's quite a great deal in my book. - if you come with a party of 4 or more, consider the Family style dinner. 3 options: light ($19.50/person), classic ($26.95), chef's choice ($36.50). A lot of food to be had. - they sell the profiteroles by the piece. $2.95 each. Such a great idea for a light sweet ending. But beware: these are BIG. And delicious.
Bread anyone? What I'm suppposed to do with all this left over sauce? Otherwise excellent all around! Capische?

As much as it pains me to do this, I have to give one star.  This is strictly for the service.  I had the worst lunch service yesterday of any lunch I have ever had.  As a frequent dinner here, I do not even need to look at the menu.  I can walk in, sit down, order, eat and usually be out in 35 min.  Today, I sat down, ordered, received my food, and spent the next 40 min wondering what happened to my waiter.  When I finally tracked him down for the bill, and gave him our cards, he then disappeared for another 10 min.  When I next saw him, I flagged him down and told him we were kind of in a hurry, and asked for my credit card back.  He told me he had passed it off to someone else, but it will be out shortly.  Another 10 min went buy, I flagged him down again.  This time he had the nerve to snap at me that it was coming and to just wait.  At this point, I was ready to leave, card be damned.  I then saw the manager who said he would go get the card, but was only slightly apologetic for his incompetent employee.  Instead of offering to do something for us then and there, he said next time you are in, ask for me.  Really?  You think after all this there is going to be a next time?  All in all, it took me 15 min to get food, 60 to pay my bill.  I will NEVER go back to this location again. And might I just add that I doubt that our waiter Chistopher has ever satisfied a woman, with dining service or otherwise.

I find myself going to Maggiano's more than I care to. A client always seems to want to try it out when they are in town. The food I have always found spotty. sometimes everything is perfect. Other times it is just off. The staff are always fine. When there are large tables near you it can get a little noisy at times. Yet I have never tried to hold that against a restaurant. I know they can not control how loud peoples conversations are when they are talking at the table.  I guess that is the price of success
"hated it" The whole experience was such a waste of time, so glad I wasn't paying!

Nice, fairly affordable Italian food.  Typical of other Maggianos around the country.  Especially like the family style dinners (for parties of 10 or more) where the selection is more limited but the portions are endless.

Came here tonight for the first time w/my boss and I have to say ...  I was pleasantly surprised!  How cute were the red & white table cloths? & the host in the tuxedo? It was like being at an authentic Italian restaurant. It's a little expensive but the portions are so big that it makes it okay. My boss & I split a salad & an entre and it was more than enough food....& it was delish. This place is definitely romantical & perfect for a date night :) 2 thumbs way up!
wonderful Lunch here !  very attentive / knowledgeable service  !  excellent food  great value  BIG  portions !

My parents and I order the bowl of salad and roasted chicken entree.  The service is cool and sharp.  The uniforms are nicely presentable and the hostess order is orderly and presentable.  Bartenders are organized and prompt.  Very personal and friendly service.   The singers and piano players sooth the mood always when its waiting time.   If you like a large round tabled dining room that looks closely to a banquet room feast here.

This place is awful. So far the food is good but the service is the dregs of Chicago. I don't know why kids with an attitude would be hired to support the faux-bourgeois atmosphere of this felled-short attempt at creating an Italian restaurant. If your party isn't guaranteed the gratuity entrance fee at this poor excuse of a middle class dining establishment, then you will probably go unnoticed. But if that's your style, dive in!

I've been here twice. Once with a group of 20 and again in feb 2010 for my birthday. Each time the service was awesome, always clean and prices are pretty decent. Also, each time I've had the Four Cheese Ravioli, mixed drink and the Apple Crostada w/ Caramel Sauce. Normally when I find something good I stick with it until my husband nags me to the point where I step out of my "food comfort zone" and try something new. Which may be the next time we go because I'm really craving that appel crostada!

This place is huge, loud, and very crowded.  Although I can appreciate the piano lounge, classic and old Italian decor at this LEY establishment, I wasn't a huge fan of the tiramisu or tartufo desserts we ordered.  Also, we were seated at an odd table right next to the waiter station, which meant for an awkward seating arrangement and location next to the exit door and constant flurry of wait staff.  The entrees looked good at the adjacent tables, I'd be curious to try but hope to have a better experience next time.

Does anyone else out there get a headache from eating the lasagna. We recently had lasagna provided for a company lunch. It tasted fantastic but I got a headache immediately after. At first I thought it was for other reasons, but the next day, I had some leftovers and the headache came back within 15 minutes to a half hour.

I've been coming here for at least 10 years. For Italian comfort food, there is no better place. You won't find authentic trattoria-style Italian fare here, but you will find heapin' helpins of Italian-American classics in a comfortable, Sinatra-saturated family-oriented dining room. Get there early and enjoy the bar first . . . good selection of martinis, and the warm dark woods are very inviting. For dinner, stick with the classics, especially the lasagna, which is epic in size and taste.

What a great place in the heart of downtown.  If it's Saturday night and you don't have a reservation, plan on a two hour wait for a table.  This place is jumpin now and there's a reason Chicagoans flock to this Italian favorite in droves.  The food is very good!    We started off at the bar, a beautifully decorated and spacious area with VERY busy and capable bartenders going 100 mph trying to keep up with all the customers (what a great problem to have!).  There were three working last night but I'm not sure 10 would have been enough to keep up with the demand but despite the crowded conditions, service was still very good.  Drinks are potent and not watered down but are a bit on the pricey side.   $25 gets you two mixed drinks, including a tip.  I wouldn't recommend this bar be your spot to camp out and drink the evening away unless you have a serious bankroll. Onto the food. In a word, excellent!   My dinner partner had the Lasagna.  I got a little taste of it and it was oh, so good!  She chose the meat sauce version, which was also loaded with ooey - gooey cheese. Her clean plate was all the proof I needed that she too had enjoyed her entree.   I ordered the filet mignon, the menu item I call the "measuring stick" for a restaurant.  Maggiano's filet is a 9 ounce portion and very good.  It came to me cooked a little more than the medium rare I prefer but was still very tender and tasty.  I still gets high marks from me. We both had a modest sized dinner salad with our meal, she selected the Ceasar salad and I the tossed Italian salad.  Both were excellent.  My filet was accompanied by roasted potatoes, which were ok but not necessary as far as I was concerned.  I was plenty stuffed without them. Service at Maggiano's is excellent.  Everyone from the greeter to the server was very friendly and capable.  Due to horrific traffic downtown, we were 45 minutes late for our reservation.  I called to let them know and our table was still there waiting for us when we finally arrived.  They handled an overflow crowd seemingly with ease and total professionalism. The dinner portion of our evening came to $60 plus tip.  A relative bargain as far as I am concerned.  Maggiano's is a great choice.  Their menu boasts quite the variety.  There will be something for everyone and I guarantee, you won't go home hungry!

For some odd reason, I'd been to the Maggiano's locations in the burbs a handful of times but never to the location closest to me.  Finally, I made it to the River North location for some old school Italian.  There's nothing wrong with a bit of Frank, Dean and checkboard tablecloths every now and again.   You know the drill with Maggiano's.  It's all old school, all the time and across the board.  It's not really fancy, but it's also not Sbarro.   I don't know if it's a permanent deal or not, but Maggiano's currently has a deal whereby you order a pasta dish and then are given another pasta dish on the house to go when you're ready to leave.  I don't know of a better two-fer deal anywhere at the moment.  So you'll have that whole pasta dish as well as your leftovers from your meal to eat for the next 48 hours.  Good deal! Maggiano's does seem like more of a suburban joint than a city joint, but that's quite alright, as I'm suburban at heart anyway.   It's four stars for the main meal and five stars for the take home two-fer deal.   It's 4 1/2 stars overall.
Very good service. Our server was super friendly and nice. Very Good food. Gives you a fine dining feeling. The reason for 4 stars.... it had fewer options for vegetarians but good enough!

I brought a friend here as my guest last night at a school mixer. Aside from the clean and roomy restrooms, beautiful interior, decent tiramisu and apple pie, I'd pass. I tried a sliver of the chicken parmigiana, one fork full of Caesar salad  and one meatball that had me reconsidering being a born again vegan. The bread was warm and the banquet hall was pretty roomy. But alas, the food was not for me.

We used Maggiano's Banquets for our recent wedding.  Best choice we made.  We worked with Jeff and he was wonderful. Everything was smooth and effortless during the planning process and Jeff was with us the entire time to ensure we covered everything. On the day of our wedding, the space looked amazing.  We had our own waiter that catered to our every need.  I never had an empty glass and they packed food for us to take with us! The food was excellent, as always.  Our guests were pleasantly surprised to get some quality Italian food at a wedding instead of dried up chicken. I can't speak highly enough of everyone who helped us a Maggiano's.  The staff is outstanding!

I had no idea this restaurant was a chain. The food was superb -- and the portions so huge that next time, I will split something with someone. Everything was just great - from the wait staff to the salad, entre and dessert! YUM!

You can NEVER go wrong with Maggianos. I've been going here for over 5 years and I go to any location. Astonshing food and surprisingly affordable for everyone. I took my boyfriend for Sweetest Day last night and I only spent 65 bucks and I have a refrigerator full of food left over. This restaurant is great for any occasion and always has a full house but very comfortable and cozy. A must GO!!

Can I be honest and say I'm embarrassed to write a review on a chain. I try to go to family owned and off the beaten path. But what can I say maggianos. You know what your doing. Your one of the only places my entire family can go and all leave full and happy. You are doing something right. Nice job.

I was just at this resturant today and will probably never visit again.... to make the story short...THERE WAS A LIVE ROACH ON OUR TABLE!! although they comped our food and drinks it was still disgusting to see.  This is 2010; resturants should be able to keep ROACHES out of resturants let alone on the TABLE. A clear sign should have been the hair we saw on the table before ordering; but the ROACH was the last straw!!

My family and I have been to Maggiano's quite a few times, and to say the least we love it.  We've done multiple dinners here, and I don't think we've ever had a bad dish.  Normally I wouldn't bother rating with so many reviews here, but I'm actually writing the review for the Banquet side of Maggianos. About 3 weeks ago we held the rehearsal dinner and a cocktail party in the Banquet Hall area the night before my wedding.  We were able to do a menu tasting up front completely free of charge during off hours, and the food was delicious.  We had about 20 people at the rehearsal dinner and the dishes all came out in a timely fashion as we ate them.  Everything was totally awesome!  The staff was also great about keeping drinks filled and ensuring that we had sufficient time to eat before they brought the next course out. After the rehearsal dinner we had about 80 people come up for a cocktail hour into the upstairs area of banquet hall. There was more than enough room for all of them, and easy access to bathrooms for everyone.  The bars we had open ensured everyone was able to get drinks as they wanted. All in all it was a great time and we really enjoyed everything.  The only thing that would make it 5 stars for me is decreasing prices, but given the location I can understand why we paid what we did.   If we have another event we'd definitely consider holding it here.  We'll also definitely be back for food on regular occasion as always :).

Disclaimer: I love my commercial Italian food.  This isn't La Gondola but it's downtown's closest thing to it. Lettuce Entertain You for the win! Best fettucine alfredo around.  One of the few chains that knows how to make aioli sauce. Family style is perfect for groups.  Great group rates for private parties.

Over the years Maggiano's has, in my opinion, gone down a tad in quality, on the other hand it could be my evolving tastes, regardless the Veal and  Mushroom Ravioli I had here was definitely not to my liking. First off the menu doesn't clarify that like the regular Mushroom Ravioli, this too is in an alfredo sauce.  I was thinking it would be in something more tomato based as they mention sun-dried tomatoes in the description.  Secondly, where's the veal?!  If it's veal and mushroom ravioli there should be VEAL and mushroom not 90% mushroom with 10% tiny, nearly microscopic, pieces of veal.  The only reason I am giving this Maggiano's  the benefit of the doubt is the Caprese Salad appetizer was pretty good and I've enjoyed this restaurant the times I've eaten here in the past, I also really enjoy their dessert.

I have visited Maggianos in many cities but a favorite location is on Clark Street in downtown Chicago.  I am a big fan of Italian food (trying not to get any bigger) and having traveled throughout the US and Europe I have not found a rival for Maggianos, well there are some really big challengers in Rome, love the pizza place near Fontana di Trevi. Anyway, put on your loose fitting clothes, load up your crew, and head to Maggianos for the family style feast. You will not walk away, more like a waddle if you try to do this in less than 2 hours.  Love Maggianos, make the trip in today and check them out!

Three stars because food was great, service was awful. We sat in the bar area since seating time was immediate vs 20 minute wait in the dining room. Menus were presented to us by the hostess as soon as we sat. A busser(?) came over and poured us a mini plate of olive oil with parmesan cheese available to be mixed in for the bread. BUT we never received any bread for over five minutes when we finally asked for it with another server that walked by. Our server could not have showed LESS enthusiasm being there or servicing us. The food runner literally dropped our entrees onto our table when they came out - a THUD for each plate dropped. He didn't bother asking which plate belonged to whom; just shoved it through and left the plates there for us to rearrange entrees. We were checked on once throughout the meal, one water refill. The "second" time we were checked on was to see if we wanted our bill. Thanks lady! Luckily their food will keep us coming back - especially their Classic Pasta deal - essentially buy one now and take one home free. Awesome deal and awesome food.

The Clark location is the Original of what is now a national chain.  The staff is great and even though the restaurant is crowded and the restrooms are not up to ADA compliance, I still like coming to this location.  It makes me fee like Al Capone is going to come around the corner at any minute.  This place you need to try at least once and it has to be the original.  Large portions; family style is a great way to eat a meal.  If you are ordering individual plates, get half orders.  The full portions are HUGE.

Went to Maggiano's last week, my second visit, and this place ranks up there as one of my favorite restaurants (and one of my mom's, too, if you're keeping track).  The place is nice, classy, and although it's a chain (Lettuce Entertain You), it doesn't feel like a chain, no birthday songs or chicken fingers to be found. We got the family-style serving, which meant we all got to try a lot of different things, and since we'd been before, we delved a bit deeper into the menu, e.g., getting the brazed beef cannelinni instead of, say, lasagna. It was a good choice, something different. And, as with our first visit, I thought everything was very good to excellent. Some things they do very well (the ravioli are always superb) and some things are just good (the pork medallions weren't anything to write home about). Everyone is very nice. The place also has a classy feel, even if it's faked, but still, unless you're trying to notice that.... Overall, if you want to get a lot of food, try something a bit different, and try a lot of different things, this is the place. A bit pricey, but that's River North, and overall, it's more than worth it--we took home as much food as we ate.

Yeeeech. The date was awesome. The meal was not. Nothing happening that night gave me a positive impression of the place, and the negatives kept piling up. The service was inconsistent and rushed, while the best dishes were merely pedestrian.  Meanwhile, my entree of fettucine with lobster in vodka sauce was almost inedible. Burned and sticky pasta and small flecks of lobster -- all in all a pink, oily mess. Truly one of the worst meals I've ever received in a restaurant. And Maggiano's isn't cheap eats either, though it's no Spiaggia. At least dessert had chocolate and ice cream in it. But one star registers my overall impression, which was, to repeat: yeeeech!

As an Italian, I tend to be very critical of any Italian food.  The food at Maggiano's is pretty good.  Always big portions.  The servers, however, are a little over the top.  I HATE HATE HATE sitting down and getting a dissertation on the menu.  Or personal stories.

We used Maggiano's for our wedding reception and we could not have had a better time. If we needed anything, the host was there to accommodate us immediately. When we were just trying to enjoy ourselves, we didn't even notice any of the staff. The food felt like it appeared out of nowhere and everything went very smoothly. I certainly recommend using Maggiano's for your wedding reception, rehearsal, event, or just for delicious food with the family.

I had my wedding recently at Maggianos Banquet room on Clark street. I couldn't be happier. They have done so many weddings at their venue that everyone is completely on point the entire night. I worked with Jeffrey and he is fantastic. He makes great suggestions on food and packages. They don't try to up sell you either. There are a few different packages to pick varying prices. If you are on a budget they will work with you to figure out creative ways to play around w/the packages. For example, instead of a dessert table I had more appetizers. Instead of picking the package w/the cake I had an outside cheaper bakery bring in a cake. They didn't charge a cutting fee or anything. Although we didn't have the bar open during dinner, they kept it open for the head table just to be nice. The minute I walked into the reception the entire place looked fabulous. The lighting was ideal and it looked really nice. I went to fix my hair and one of the servers immediately came up to me to see if I needed a drink or anything. This was how they were the entire night. Some of my guests had particular health issues and they made accommodations for him so he could eat the food.  Honestly, it was fabulous. My guests had a great time and its in the heart of the city. We had a lot of out of town guests and Maggianos helps you get  better rates at the local hotels. So it was nice for my guests to walk back to the hotel from the reception easily. For me, I really wanted a city wedding. Although its not cheap, you aren't going to break the bank either. For me, it was ideal. Deft. inquire at Maggianos and Jeffrey can give you a tour and show you packages. I wouldn't change a thing from my experience on my wedding day.

We recently ordered from Maggiano's for our bridal shower.  The catering was outstanding. The delivery person was on time and set up everything for us.  The food was hot and delicious.  They even gave us bread, plates, silverware, etc.!  Our guests loved the Rigatoni D.  We also ordered the Baked Ziti with Sausage which was good too, but the Rigatoni D stole the show!  We highly recommend Maggiano's for your next catering event!

Excellent dining experience.  Mary,our waitress was super sweet and kind.  She even brought everyone at our table a biscotti because we all commented on how my son's dessert had one.  The pianist playing music in the background added the extra touch.  The food portions are very large even when you order the half portions!  We will go again!

I've been here before, but never for a wedding with access to an amazing all-you-can eat spread. I became addicted to the 4 cheese ravioli being passed and the sausage and peppers came in a close second. But then it was time for the entrees. For a long time I only ordered the lasagna, but now I had a chance to branch out! Everything from the Manicotti to the Braised Beef Cannelloni made my heart flutter with excitement. I literally could not get enough of everything, and it's possible I am now going to have to enter Maggiano's rehab. Please send help or at least ravioli.

I put on a banquet there for my student org. The banquet went Fine! The staff is helpful and nice. BUT OH MY IS IT OVERPRICED! 50$ a person, for horrible food! U know the stuffed mushrooms I make at home are 10000000 times better, deep fried calamari---- NO NO NO!!!! So bad! The salad was a mess, 99% chopped lettuce, the tomatoes with feta were pathetic, the eggplant parmesan was bad too, u could taste the sugar and chemcials they put in for taste. Drink overpriced! All in the end the DESSERT WAS GREAT! Try their TIRAMISSU--- might be the best one you can get in USA, profiteroles and chocolate cake too. I won't be back---- Sorry

It was time to say goodbye to some friends from grad school and we decided to do things before finals and graduation. After looking all over the place for a decent menu without having to cough up a grand. Since we all know Maggiano's goes overboard on portion sizes, we hit it up and did it up without busting our wallets. We called ahead and easily set up a prix fixe menu for vegetarians and meat eaters all alike for $30 a head. Dinner consisted of Parmesan Garlic Bread, Tomato Caprese, Fettuccine Alfredo, Four Cheese Ravioli, Chopped Salad, Maggiano's House Salad, Herb Roasted Chicken, Veal Marsala, New York Style Cheesecake, and Tiramisu. For $30 we got a gargantuan meal and everything had bathed in olive oil, butter, cheese, or both! Service was impeccable and my water glass did not go empty. It was nice to be able to sit down for a good late night meal and most of the restaurant was already booked but it worked out. For all over our troubles we spent under $300 and the dim lights added to the atmosphere. Check out Maggiano's if you're looking for reasonably priced food and a big party to feed!

I brought my mom here on a whim. We were downtown together and had planned to try a "hot and new" takeout place, but the wait was 45 min. Not my thing when I'm hungry. We decided to give Maggiano's a try since it was right down the street and did not appear to be too crowded. We are glad we did. The only bummer was they were "out" of eggplant parmigiana. That always irritates me when something is on the menu and is unavailable (unless, of course, there is some nationwide shortage of eggplants -I'm thinking that wasn't the case.) We decided on a delicious mushroom pasta and bread with olive oil and cheese were not being rationed (ha!). I really liked their coffee too! The experience was great. We got a hearty meal and were on our way. I find the food to be really reasonable -we actually split the entree and each ordered a side salad since the portions are so generous. Our bill was only $21! Not bad. We sure know how to eat on a budget! Maggiano's has great food, good service and a fair price. I'm not downtown often, but this is a great option when I do visit!

I give this 4 stars for the family style option, otherwise the chances of me choosing to go here would be super super slim. SO as a personal assistant at my boss's house, I go through his stuff to organize it, etc.  Recently i found this gift card for $50 for a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant.  $50 dollars to an doctor= petty cash, $50 dollars to a poor college student = baller status.  Needless to say I had to convince him to give it to me.  After i achieved this task, I chose to go to Maggiano's because of their family style option.  If you don't know what this is, you pay a flat rate for 2 of a large selection of pasta, salad, appetizer, entree, and dessert.  The best part is that if you finish a dish and want more, they will refill it for you and if your SMART, you will force feed yourself to finish the first dish and take the refill home. (obviously my plan). I walked out with bags absolutely stuffed. Unfortunately, my waiter looked at my boyfriend and i like we were nuts when we wanted all that food for ourselves so I was resentful that he was making me feel so gluttonous for doing so.  He also kind of sucked.  However, the food was above the under 10$ budget I normally have and tasted pretty exciting.  Making myself clear though, it was not REALLL italian food, but tasted great non the less. One thing i WILL rave about is the desserts.  YES YES YES YES. Will I come back? not if my waiter makes me feel like a pig again but if i'm looking for food that will feed a large group well then yes.

Maggiano's is definately not a bad place to settle down and rustle up some grub, but if you're looking for the feel of an authentic Italian eatery, you'll notice quickly that this is a restaurant owned but the company that owns Chili's (Brinker INC.), rather than by some guy named Guido.  I started off with their chopped salad, and all in all, it's wasn't bad, although the crispy proscuitto tasted and seemed more like immitation bacon bits than anything of real substance, and the dressing lacked any intensity.  My main, was Chicken Francese, and it was rather nice.  The chicken was seasoned nicely and the arugula salad that acompanied it was rather tasty as well, however, the potatoes were a little undercooked.  I also ordered a side of brocolli with the meal and it was pretty good as well.  I had a glass of red wine with the meal, and was a little astonished to see an Italian restaurant serving this robust red in a petit white wine glass, but that's part of the turn and burn.  It's more about getting you in and getting your money, and making you think you just ate at an Italian place, than actually providing an authentic experience.  But then again, this is probably for the person who prefers The Olive Garden to Volare.  I'd come again, why not?  For a corporate restaurant, it could be much worse; and the service was pleasant.

My husband and I went to Maggiano's to celebrate our one yr anniversary and my birthday.  Our server David was nice, very attentive.  I had a half order of herb roasted chicken.  (No, I didn't eat all that by myself!)  I always share with my husband but I love it so much that we usually have the left overs for dinner the next day.  The chicken comes with and potatoes and a veggie.  I also had a side of their garlic mashed potatoes which I love.  My husband was really looking forward to some lasagna but to our surprise they were out.  How is it that an Italian restaurant is out of lasagna by 7:30 p.m?  Instead he had the baked ziti and sausage which was okay.  We also ordered their lemon cookies for dessert to go.  The cookies were ok not anything to rave about.  All in all our experience was good, 4 stars since they didn't have the lasagna.  Will most definitely go again!

2 stars for service, 4 stars for food. This review is going to be short and simple, because that's the experience i had here. 1. Service was not good. It was not slow, however our server was overly attentive to the point of being annoying. I'm talking....stop interrupting me. I had a party of 8 and we enjoyed family style and were starving. Our server came to visit twice before any food was on the table to ask how everything was...well, it's obviously not fine because our food is taking forever and you coming here to remind us of that is not helpful. 2. The manager came over to apologize for the long wait for the food and offered us a third dessert....nice touch. 3. The food was deeeelicious. We had a little bit of everything and I would go back for the food, but with a different server. Overall experience, A-OK.

Even though the food isn't the BEST italian I've ever had, it's definitely really good!  I mean, for the price of 2 or 3 meals, you get a weeks worth of food!  It's almost too much!  So even though it's not the best italian food in Chicago, you get a ton for what you pay.  The pasta is really good  fresh.  Just make sue you're HUNGRY when you go.

I've been here three times now, and every single visit has been a delight. Maggiano's has two great things going for it: the food is fantastic, and their ability to work with any diner. I've noted many times that I have celiac disease...finding a restaurant that will offer me a variety of foods is tough at best. The rule at Maggiano's seems to be: let them know about an allergy, and time permitting they'll create anything your heart desires.  After arriving at our table, we barely had time to sit and collect ourselves before our server approached us to say hello. As though orchestrated, the chef materialized behind me, knelt down on one knee, and asked a very simple question: "What are you in the mood for?" We came up with an offbeat menu that included a spinach and artichoke dip, followed by a Parmesan-crusted veal, portabello mushroom, and sun-dried tomato dish. Everything was divine...these guys know how to cook.  Maggiano's may be a chain, but you'd never be able to tell. It's a wonderful experience.
Grilled Chicken Flatbread delicious /Piano bar fun! - Reivew TB Completed soon ;-)

so one of my friends planned her 30th birthday dinner here at Maggiano's and I have to say that it was pretty good. we were a pretty big group so we actually were put in the small room downstairs making it a semi-private event. we started out with bruschetta and spinach dip which were both pretty tasty. the tomatoes on the bruschetta were really fresh and it was pretty good. for entrees we had chicken marsala, cheese ravioli, and salmon. normally, when i go out to restaurants i don't order fish but Maggiano's seriously brought their A-game to cook the salmon, it was perfect! Dessert we had cheesecake and the apple crostata and I loved the latter, the former was your usual standard chain cheesecake...good but not great...the service was really good and overall it was a really good meal...i was pleasantly surprised

This is such a great restaurant!!!  I came here last night for valentine's day and had a great time. I was greeted with a white rose before being seated. (how cute!)  The food was delicious, HUGE portions! i love it! and the server Aaron was great too.  He made it a really fun time.  Can't wait to come back!

food was great as usual. the service however was definitely questionable. our server was copping a bit of an attitude when it came to separating the checks...yeah i understand that it is a bit of an inconvenience but regardless she would have been running 12 different transactions anyway. she might have gotten a better tip if she was a bit nicer.

I have never been to the one in Santana Row in San Jose, CA because it is crowded and they do not accept reservation. We were in Chicago for business trip and decided to give a try. The fried calamari was great, service was excellent and love my Ravioli. I was told that this is the first Maggiano's Little Italy.

Mmmmm gooood!!! Large portions, reasonably prices, great atmosphere. I notice the expansion of the restaurant and the addition of the bar area. I always parking on clark and kinzie, its only $8 after 3pm and all day weekends, so we are able to make other stops around the area. I have yet to taste a meal that I didn't like from there.

Went here yesterday and it was great.  Spent a full 6 hours Christmas shopping and needed a break so my sister, niece, and I went to Maggianos for dinner.  It was packed but service was so quick and attentive.  We got the Bruschetta and as always it was wonderful, and I had the four cheese ravioli and my niece had the lasagna.  So so good and filling.  Have no complaints here!

This is another one of those reviews that is aimed at the entire chain... never had a bad experience with Maggiano's, whether here or as far south as Tampa.   Classy place with great service, love the atmosphere, love the menu as well.  If I could only eat Chicken Parm from one place for the rest of my life, it'd be here.   Pricey, yes.  But worth it.  Always a treat.

Yes, Maggianos portions are HUGE.  Massive.  It's good.  Not the best, but not bad either.  Our server was excellent, the food was good too.  In case you didn't see it the first time, the portions are huge.   My wife ordered the cheese ravioli, I ordered the lasagna.  We got the baked zucchini as an appetizer.  We were out $40 after tip and were stuffed.   They do get large groups, so if you're looking for a group place to meet downtown, consider Maggianos.

One of my classmates organized a group of us to go to Maggiano's for their family style meals last night. I'll admit I was skeptical. When I think Maggiano's, I think of the awkward bat mitzvah parties I attended when I was in 7th grade. What can I say? It was the spot to be. Anyways, since I like to think that I've made it past my 7th grade years I wasn't really sure about going here for dinner. After i got over myself, I was pleasantly surprised!  We got the classic family size meal (about 30 a person), which means we got to pick two appetizers, two salads, two pastas, two entrees, and two desserts for the table. The food is supposed to be never ending, but we didnt get to test that out because all of us were so stuffed we barely finished what was on the table. I'd have to agree with Nik B that there is nothing extraordinary about the food. It's all good and deliciously rich, but it isn't special. (side note: Not to beat down on classic american italian dishes, but I'm not really sure lasagna or baked ziti can ever really be special unless its coming out of your grandma's oven.)  My favorites of the evening were the chopped salad, fried calamari and the gnocchi.  Even though the food wasn't super special, it was nice to get to try so many different dishes and  to be able to eat family style with a group of people. Plus the service was good and the atmosphere was perfect for a celebratory group.   With some beer and two bottles of wine, at the end of the night the bill came to about 50 bucks per person. Not cheap. Not outrageous. It felt just right.

A LOT of food doesn't mean it's a lot of good food. Nothing extraordinary is going on at Maggiano's. It's all very very standard.  By American standards, you "get what you pay for." Everything is huge, slightly greasy, and I have to admit, pretty tastey. What irks me is just how standard this place is. I would say about 90% of the menu is food that is all too familiar. And it's pretty good, but it's not GREAT. I don't find myself in ecstacy when I bite into this food. It's more like, "Oh, I expected this to taste like this. That's....good......"

I went about three or four times in the period of five weeks. The service was great except for one small incident (which I will not go into detail about) and the food is good.  I would not call this "authentic" Italian cuisine because there isn't anything on the menu that I've never had before, but the food is rather tasty.  I had Chicken Pesto Linguine, Spaghetti, Spinach pasta, etc.  I enjoyed everything, I would place Maggiano's equal to Olive Garden and Carabba's.  The best part about the restaurant are the deals, one current promotion is buy one and take one home.  Which gives you a half size portion of an entree to eat at the restaurant and another to take home (of equal or lesser value).  While a half size portion does not sound like a mouthful, here it is MORE THAN ENOUGH.  I could not imagine eating a full size portion alone.

I went to Maggiano's and took of advantage of their current promotion: $12.95 for a dish at the restaurant and then they send you home with another selection (full sized) to bring home. Not bad. We started with Calamari.  Delicious.  We got a half order and it was more than enough for 2 people to share. We also had bread dipped in olive oil/parm. The Chicken Pesto Linguine I had at the restaurant was delicious. The pine nuts in the pasta was a perfect touch to the dish. We brought home Baked Ziti and Sausage and Chicken & Spinach Manicotti.  I reheated them in the oven and they came out tasting phenom.  What a deal.  Not having to cook 2 nights in a row? Not shabby. Our service wasn't the best so that's why it's losing a star... and the food is great but not the best Italian. It's pretty darn good though.  I'd come back for more.

I had only been to Maggiano's for private parties prior to visiting for lunch.  While my mother's Italian food will always be the best, this place isn't bad and has a great lunch special. The 12.95 special ensures you have a doggy-bag of another entree (full sized) packed and ready to go when you leave.  You select from a list. If you like to get bang for your buck, this deal is worth it.  Not to mention the free bread and olive oil prior to your meal-- I'm a carb whore and just can't resist.

We had a work dinner here on the banquet side. Service was so slow that 75% of us had left by the time they brought dessert out --- they refused to credit the bill and just boxed up all the "new" leftover dessert plates. The food we were served was pretty good, but not as tasty as the Oak Brook location. It's alright if you're desperately craving Italian and their current special (2 dinners today/tomorrow for $12.95) is a pretty good deal.

I went to Maggiano's on a Saturday night and will not rush back. The food is generic Italian. I ordered the spaghetti which was just okay. Nothing special and I've had better. My sister-in-law and brother ordered the baked ziti. I didn't think it was all that bad but they thought it was missing something, some sort of spice to kind of jazz it up a bit. My mom, on the positive side, ordered the chicken marsala which she was very happy with. I had a taste and the mushrooms were very tasty. The chicken wasn't swimming in olive oil, which is a plus too. Service wasn't too great. I realize it was a Saturday night and the place was packed, but my wine glass was empty more than it was full throughout the night. And I hate to say it but when the server brought my second glass of wine, it looked as though soap was still in the glass, kind of a fizzy look around the rim. I still drank it, not a huge deal, but still kind of made me wonder? The portions are ridiculous. You have the choice of ordering a half or full. The full plates are pretty much the size of a family style serving dish. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back. There's better Italian out there.

I know it's a chain but it's fantastic! They have awesome pasta, great salads, bruschetta and desserts! I prefer to sit in the bar area and not the dinning area and on the weekends they have a piano player that adds to the ambiance. Even when they deliver the food is good so you can't go wrong!

It's what the middle class defines as good Italian food. Oh that suburban crowd that visits Chicago should venture to Taylor Street to find real Italian food. Enough of the chain restaurants already...Explore and live, that's the fun of living in the Big City.   Fear not the independent, creative entrepeneur, stop being a sheep and eating at these chains...... Agnes Gooch... Live?

Yeah, I know it's a chain.  Not normally my thing, but I've eaten here enough (several times @ lunch w/groups and a couple times carry-out), so who am I to judge?  Anywho, I must say, almost everything on the menu is deelish: the bread w/oil and cheese is a nice thing, try the Maggiano salad, and if you like mushrooms, the Rigatoni D (kinda like chicken marsala with mostaciolli).  My only problem, and this isn't every time, is the uneven service in the dining room at lunch: we were a fairly large group, had reservations, didn't take too long to order but the wait between ordering, receiving our food, getting our check was ridiculous.  We were there over two hours, not cool if you're on 'lunch hour' from work.  It wasn't crowded, so speed it up!

I'm pretty sure if I brought my mama here she'd completely forget about her obession with the dreaded Olive Garden and that's saying a lot. I came her for a birthday party and we did the family style dining so I got to sample quite a few things. Everything I tried was exceptionally done. I even tried gnocci for the first time and I must say I'm hooked. I've been craving it ever since! But beware! If you have any special dietary needs you may not eat with the rest of your party. They were a little slow at bringing out dishes for my glutten free friend. I felt bad passing dishes and eating around her but she said to dig in so I did.

* Beep.  Thank you for flying with Maggiano's.  Beep.  * I have to say the waiter was a bit annoying.  He started off with what sounded like a pre-recorded announcement.  I was tempted to interrupt him and see if he had to start over from the top.   One of the rather dubious things he said was that the full portion of any dish was too large for an individual.  Oy.  That scared me - a place that focuses on massive quantity isn't a good thing normally.  He recommended half sizes for any pastas.  So I ordered a half portion of lobster ravioli and a side salad.   The Italian bread provided to start was fresh, warm, and served with a decent quality olive oil for dipping.   Nice start to lunch.   The side salad was standard fare with an Italian dressing that was overly vinegared and too salty.  It overpowered the simple veggies.   The lobster ravioli were prepared nicely.  The pasta was al dente and there were whole chunks of lobster meat inside.  The sauce was slightly over salted, but the creaminess of it cut the saltiness a bit.   But how could the waiter say a full portion would be too much?  The full was 7 ravioli.  The half which I got was 5.  I could have used the extra 2!   If I had Maggiano's in Vancouver it would be a 4 star.  But I have to say I much preferred my meal at A Tavola:   yelp.com/biz/a-tavola-ch…

Who cares if it's a chain. This place serves HUGE portions of very good Italian food. And it's great for families with lots of choices and a loud (but not totally obnoxious) dining room. In fact, coming with your family is almost the best way to share the portions "family style". Among the items: a great chopped salad (the half portion can easily feed 2) and gnocchi that could melt in your mouth.  Service was great (one of our party arrived late and they took care to make sure the food arrived quickly).  Very well done.

I used to love this Maggiano's, but on our most recent visit, they sat us outside. Normally, that's a good thing. I love al fresco dining as much as the next person, but NOT when . . .  1. The table is covered with debris from the awning/trees/you-name-it, and the staff can't be bothered to wipe it down before they seat you. 2. The staff openly take part in mocking rude valet customers. Yes, rude customers are rude customers, but still . . . Isn't it kind of a bad idea to make fun of them in front of the rest of your patrons? 3. Pretty much we had to sit outside because the piano entertainment inside was just loud and ridiculous. Kinda kills the whole enjoying-my-gnocchi experience, y'know? Come on, Maggiano's. The least you can do after absorbing the space that used to be my favorite Corner Bakery, is keep up appearances.

Came here for a company dinner and was seated in one of the banquet rooms. It was really nice that they had our whole menu typed out on each table so we all knew what we were going to get. The banquet room was a nice sized, and it was open, so it was easy to go from one table to another.  We started with the stuffed mushrooms and fried mozzarella with marinara sauce. Yum! The stuffed mushrooms were huge and so tasty. We then had a family styled dinner that consisted of bread & butter, Cesar Salad, Maggianos Salad, Rigatoni "D", Lasagna, Chicken Parmesan, and Salmon with Lemon and Herb. My favorites were the Cesar salad, rigatoni "D", and the Lasagna (and I normally do not like lasagna). The Chicken was okay too - but a little on the drier side. The salmon was overcooked, so I didn't care for it too much. For desert we had the apple crostada and the tiramisu. The Apple Crostada was so good - like eating hot apple pie with ice cream. Yum!  Overall, it was a very delicious meal. The service here was great. Always got us new drinks, and cleared our table pretty quickly. Great location spot to have dinner at esp if you are with a group. Portions were good sized too, to be able to fill up the 10 of us that were sitting at the table - and there were leftovers too! Prob. not the best italian food I've ever had, but it wasn't bad either.

Holy crap. This may not be the most authentic place, but it's so goddamn good. You can a half order of pasta for lunch for like $11.00. It's big enough to feed a small football team. It feeds me through 2 meals - not bad, not bad at all. Personally, I recommend the gnocchi with vodka sauce, basil and tomatoes. It comes with your own mini loaf of bread and a shit ton of butter. It's heaven. I sometimes can't stop myself and eat a lot more than I should...but that's the downside of Maggiano's and their sexy pasta.

Came here to grab some lunch while in Chicago and ordered the mussels. Pretty good but the mussels were so small. I also tried the white pasta with clam or something. The clams were also very small and wasnt as fulfilling as I thought it would be. The portions however were large so that is a good thing. The clam pasta didnt taste that good but was alright. The service was great though, the waitress was patient while we ordered and even suggested some dishes.

I just recently went to Maggiano's for my birthday and I have to say I was very pleased all around.  We had reservations but we were running late so we called and they had no problem with making it later for us.  I was a bit nervous thinking that changing the reservation may make our wait longer but I was wrong. We hardly waited 5 min. and our table was ready! And this was on a Friday night!  Our waiter was great and the food was delish!! Highly recommend this restaurant to everyone I know!!  Plus, the food you get for the money is excellent and enough to feed 2!!

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch a few weeks ago. I don't know if it was the fact that we came on a Tuesday, but service was awesome. The only drawback was that we waited almost 5 minutes for someone to bring us water. But whatever, it happens. Our waiter was wonderful. A sense of humor can do that to a person. Since it was my first time and I didn't know what to order, I just told him I liked bold flavors, and he suggested the Rigatoni D. My boyfriend went the opposite way, and our waiter (Kevin) recommended a subtle pesto something or other. We split a stuffed mushroom appetizer. The food was delicious (which proves that it's better to ask than run blind), the portions were huge, and with the free bread, we had plenty to take back home. For dessert, Kevin told us they didn't have the creme brulee shooters we wanted, so he gave us lemon cookies on the house. How sweet is that?!

I love this place!  The last time we went was after my nephew was baptized and there were about 15 of us.  We had some of everything, but I remember the salmon and Chicken & Spinach Manicotti.  Excellent!  For dessert we had creme brulee and pound cake.  We always get family style dining.  I love this place!

Somehow my company loves organizing pre-interview dinners at Lettuce Entertain You restaurants and Maggiano's is part of the group. They serve pretty decent Italian food but don't expect anything special from here. It's pretty much your regular Italian classics with consistent flavors. If I want to go for a good homestyle Italian meal, this is where I would go. Look for their Italian tossed salad. Salads are usually not the main focus of my meal but it was surprisingly fresh and simple.
This place reminds me of buca de bebbos.  Food is a little better because its not as salty, but nothing is memorable and many of the dishes are very bland.  nothing exciting here.

Maggiano's...I've always seen the place, never had a reason to try it out...that is until recently! Check it - the service may have been awesome for me only because I went on a tuesday afternoon, but our watier was most definitely on point - funny, attentive and got us what we needed almost instantly! For lunch I had the pesto pasta and you know what...someone has finally got it right! Great subtle pesto flavor without too much oil! Not only was it bowl-licken TASTY, there was some serious portions on my plate. Oh, AND I got a free dessert. AWESOME I heard they have these sweet @SS family dinners...I gotta find a hungry group to go with me....

Came here with a group for the birthday of my doppelganger.  We ordered family style and things seemed to run pretty efficiently.  I had: Mussels, stuffed mushrooms, chicken Parmesan, Caesar salad, gnocchi, apple crostada, tiramisu (can't believe I ate all of that food). Everything was really good! AND I tried mussels for the first time (not too shabby).  BUT beware...gnocchi is very filling so go easy on that.  I plan to go back and try some of the other dishes that sounded pretty awesome.

I'm a definite fan of Maggiano's.  Good food, great people, and substantial portions make this a great friend and family dining place.   A definite suggestion is getting a booth versus a table, because when the crowds get large, it's hard to hear your dinner partner.

One of my best friends and I had had a terrible, heinous day at work. We were emotionally destroyed and angry, and in horrible moods. My friend suggested we go to Maggianos to visit his friend (and awesome bartender Allie) to let off some steam and drink.  Apparently, Wednesday is their "free-pizza" day. Woohoo! I'll take any free food! We got there and were greeted immediately. Within two minutes I had a delightful glass of sparkling wine in my possession. Awesome.  The pizza was amazing! They had about 5 different kinds that they passed around to guests. My favorite was the balsamic pizza with mozzarella and basil. Before long, I was completely full on pizza.  Everyone who works there is incredibly friendly too. Definite props to the service!  One of the highlights of the evening (aside from great company, delicious pizza and booze) was that they had a guy come in and play the piano. He was kind of terrible. But then a woman named Trish busted out the show tunes, and she was AMAZING! We kept yelling for more after she stopped, but she didn't come back to sing more. Sad.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to take a break from reality after a hard day's work. I was so much happier for coming in. I will be back for sure.

My boyfriend and I went here on a Thursday night after work. We were greeted quickly and given a great seat by the window. Our server was definitely a little off and socially awkward. He forgot to give us bread after we ordered our meals which was greatly disappointing to a bread lover like myself. The spinach and artichoke dip app was amazing. We got a pasta & chicken dish and were very pleased. Food was great but the service was adequate. It took a while for our drinks to be refreshed and our server was not that attentive. Overall, we will return at some point but hope we get a different server.

I have known of the Maggiano's company for about ten years now and have never had a bad experience there.  I am at this Maggiano's every Saturday to sit at the bar, enjoy a glass of wine and talk with the staff and with the guests that also frequent the bar.  The food is excellent, best thing on the menu is the chicken arugula entree salad.  The drinks are good, but they could have better martinis, and the pasta always makes you feel like you're home.

review is of catering/delivery services. dinner for 10 delived to a hotel suite - very successful.  we wanted to have a hearty dinner before the bachelorette party drinking began and maggi's really delivered.  literally.  wow, terrible. wide variety of menu options (include gluten-free rice pasta) for reasonable prices.  the delivery dude provided serving spoon, warmers, buffett stands, etc etc etc. set up and clean up were easy and everything was delicious!  i'd recommend them to anyone looking to cater dinner to a small group.

My future mother-in-law and I went here to meet with the event planner because we are having the wedding in their wine cellar. We ate lunch there as well, which was quite the experience. We ate in the bar area and were served by the bar tender, who apparently doubles as an opera singer, because midway through the meal, he started serenading the table next to us. The lunch was good, the bartender was great (how could he not be?) and the event planner Jeff was very helpful and paid for our lunch. Why not give 5 stars? Well, when you've had really great Italian food, there's no going back. I think Maggiano's is good, but not quite to that level.

From my past experience, this place had good food and, at best, atrocious service.  I went here with a midsized group (around 10 people), and we waited for over two and a half hours for our main meals.  The waiter was not close to having it together, and our meal orders were taken numerous times since they had been "lost."  We decided to give dessert a try, but after waiting another 30 minutes, we decided to ask for the check (which took another 20 minutes, and when we got it they had charged us for the desserts which we had not eaten) and get dessert elsewhere.   Next time I'm in Chicago I'll give this place another try, but I advise every one of you to be wary of the level of service.  Be sure to make reservations, also!
Very easy carry-out service.  Generally prepared ahead of when they promise it to you (makes me wonder how long it sits there though). Their bread is heavenly!

I really like this Maggiano's.  I've eaten here 3-4 times in the last few years and always enjoy it.  The main dining area is a big open room and is nicely decorated with some fun pictures.  Besides that, the food is always consistently good.  I'm a fan of their lasagna and apple torte dessert. But the reason this place deserves 4 stars from me is that our company had 2 holiday events here.  The hosts were always very accomodating and willing to work with us to ensure everything went smooth.  If your company is looking for a party area with tremendous bang for your buck, this is your place.  Will suggest this venue again if our company goes forward with party plans this year.

Although I'm an Italian food purist, I have to give Maggiano's their rightful props.  Technically an Italian-American concept, it does the job.  I once took an Italian there and as the blood pressure was fitfully rising as he read the menu, I was able to calm him down with a nice selection from their well rounded and reasonably priced wine list. Appetizers run the gamut from authentic to not so much but I usually settle on a Caprese and call it a day.  They have awesome salad selections and lots to choose from in the caldo categories too.  Mussels, shrimp, bruschetta.  The usual suspects. Pastas are heapingly pleniful if a not a little bit dummied down for the Midwestern palate.  I usually skip them but have enjoyed them from time to  time.  My handsdown favorite is the roasted chicken.  It is off the hook fabulous,  The Vesuvio potatoes are a solid hit!  Great seafood offerings that vary from day to day and of course some hearty beef and tender veal selections. Having spent a lot of time  in Italy but having been raised in Chicago this is kind of where my worlds collide. Service is hit or miss, banquets are very highly recommended and family style service can't be be beat for value and quality.

I really think I'd like to give this 3.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous from all the wine and food I enjoyed tonight. I found out this morning that we were headed here: apparently my pseudo-grandpa (he's been dating my gran for like 10+ years) had a bunch of grandkids coming in to town, so he was taking everyone out to dinner. Yay free food! It ended up being 10 people, which was weird, because I never think of myself having that much family in one place at one time. On a Monday. But there we were, rolling into Maggiano's.  First: the wine. Pseudsgrands starts us all off with a pinot noir and I wish I knew what kind it was because it was amazing. It was all comforty and smooth and warm, like drinking a down blanket. Minus the feathers. Delish. Then the appetizers: Good salad, delicious spinachy-cheesy goodness, fried zucchini, stuffed mushrooms and some meh bruschetta. Good start. Then I had the veal and mushroom ravioli, which was super rich and pretty good. Dad had the pesto- delicious. Mom had sausage ziti- okay. Pseudsgrands had some sausage beefy goodness that was awesome. Didn't really get much further around the table than that as I was still fairly unacquainted with the other grandkids. Manners- lame. We finished with some apple carmely goodness for desert, which was rad. And at 8:00 PM sharp, they dim the lights dramatically to shoo the families out. I kind of couldn't refrain from letting out a Saved By the Bell era "oooooooooooh." People stared at me. Don't do that in a fancy (ish) restaurant. On the minus- the tables were kind of jammed together. At one point, I caught an elbow jab in the back from some kid at the table behind me. And when the waiter refilled our waters from behind, I felt kind of claustrophobic. So that was kind of intense. But actually, yeah, I feel it did earn that 4 stars overall. I'ts just regular Italian food, huge portions, nothing out of the ordinary, but very solid.

For the most part I'm a huge fan. Before I became allergic to wheat, I LOVED their chicken parmigiana. But for now, I just have to remember it fondly. I heard they have gluten free pasta so we headed over for lunch the other day. They do not have a gluten free menu per se, but they offer gluten free pasta.  So how it works here is the chef comes out and speaks to you about you allergy concerns. That is great, except during lunch that could take a while, in our case over 15 minutes. The manager and our waitress stopped by to say the chef would be out soon which was nice, but I'd rather have some menu I could just order form like they do at Wildfire. I ordered a variation of the Shrimp & Angel Hair al Arrabbiata . The gluten free pasta was more of a linguine which was fine. The noodles they use are great, not gummy or weird tasting. The sauce is flavorful, with just the right amount of heat.  The shrimp were good, but for the amount of money you pay for the entree, I think they could throw a few more in.  I'll be back to try more options.

If you forget to make reservations, sit in the bar area.  I think it's actually quieter!  Although, I got lucky and didn't have Fran Drescher in my ear either tonight....  But seriously, I keep wondering why the fuck I keep coming back for the Spaghetti and Meatballs...the simplest dish...the one that any kitchen moron can pull off.   I've always asked myself, "why go somewhere for spaghetti 'n meatballs?"  It's sooooooo easy to make at home...   Mag's does it well.  Great sauce.  Consistent.     Tip to Mag's: more sauce please.  =)   You give enough pasta to feed a colony!  Yum!

Every time I go to this place I order the Veal & Mushroom Ravioli al Forno. It is fantastic. I think the other dishes are good, but not so great. Service was always good, although I usually do not go during very busy periods.

Great Italian restaurant.  We went on a very busy saturday night after freezing our a$$s off and walking for miles downtown.  After being told that the wait is over 2 hours for the main dining room, we thought it would be even better to sit in the bar area where we could watch the pianist groove to some smooth beats. But after 10 mins of wait we miraculously got a table.  Service was great, very attentive and not too distracting. The food is amazing. The crab cakes and the beef brasciate (or something like it) was very fresh and flavorful. Decor is romantic with dimmed lights and candles. Not to expensive either, appetizer, drinks and 2 entrees came up to less than $70.

I love love love love love this place. I've been here for dinner and lunch and am never disappointed.  I dont know what they put in the food that makes it taste so good. I"ve had the eggplant parmesan with garlic spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. EXCELLENT! Dessert is good too!

Just went there for Xmas Eve dinner with the family and it was packed.  The service was absolutely fantastic and the food was just amazing.  We chose the Family Style serving for a family of four and it was worth it.  We were able to get an amazing variety of choices from appetizers to dessert.   The stuffed mushrooms were amazing, chicken parm was great.  The Chicken and Spinach Manicotti was good but not great as was the linguine.   The chicken marsala was also very tender for and there was plenty of food available that we were even able to bring home.   3 hours later we left satisfied full and with great conversation and memories.  I think it's a great place to take the family and will stop by whenever I'm in town.

I was going to give Maggiano's four solid stars - but they lose one for the reservation service.   The restaurant is really great - very dark, rich colors and very snazzy.  Great tableware and table settings.  We had really great waiter service - our server was very nice and accommodating.  We were out for our anniversary and she obviously recognized that we were having a special night, so she wasn't around too much but came by just when we needed her.   The food was delicious!!  I highly recommend almost everything on the menu.  I've also dined at the Oakbrook Location, so I've been able to try everything from the vegetarian lasagna to the caesar salad to the spaghetti and meatballs.  Everything really is great.  We started the meal with the caesar salad - great dressing and yummy, yummy croutons.  My boyfriend had a nice breaded veal chop with pasta and he said it was  great.  I got the vegetarian lasagna and it was perfect!  We ordered a reasonably priced bottle of red wine (around $30 - good deal) and it was great.  I had some coffee after the stuffing meal and I was good to go.   However, the one thing that really, really made me mad: they would not seat us, even though we had a reservation.  I am not at all sure what happened, but they just kept telling us to wait.  We had reservations for 7:45 and we arrived almost 10 minutes EARLY.  At 7:55 I said something (we had already been waiting for twenty minutes at this point) and the hostess disappeared and then came back and said we'd have to wait.  They never provided us a reason for the delay, nor were they polite or accommodating.  I felt like the hostesses were pissed at US for having a reservation and arriving on time.  God forbid people actually come when they say they will.  I was not at all happy with the hostesses or the restaurant in general, especially since the hostess asked me if we were coming in for a special occasion and I let her know that it was our anniversary.  Definitely loses a lot of my respect since we waited about 30 minutes to be seated for a reservation!

I went here for my dad's birthday on Sunday at around 4:00. I had reseravations, and I have dined at other Maggiano's, but I think this may be my last trip for a while. We were seated right away because the place was only 1/4 full. Then we waited....and waited....and waited. Finally I told the hostess and she had to run around to find a server for us. He finally came, and seemed annoyed that he had to help us. He took our drink order and then we waited forever to get them. Finally, I got the manager and things got better. They did screw the order up (gave us a wrong appetizer), but they let us keep it, and rectified it. They did give us one family style meal off the bill and free coffee, so that helped, but I am just annoyed by them at this point.
I absolutely LOVE Maggiano's...the pasta and shrimp together are wonderful.  I have ALWAYS had an exceptional experience at Maggiano's.

YUM. Fast for the entire day if you plan on going here for dinner--the portions are HUGE and delicious.  I ordered the mushroom alfredo ravioli at the waitress's suggestion--SO good (and made for good leftovers too!)  There was a problem with one of our entrees in the kitchen, and the chef came out in person to our table to apologize for the inconvenience and offered us an appetizer of stuffed mushrooms on the house while we waited.  Great food, great service, and a great ambiance to the restaurant.  I will definitely be returning to eat here!!
I was really disappointed when a coworker took me here on a business trip once. Please don't waste your time going to chain restaurants in Chicago!! There are too many good choices.

Good service has never been a problem, prefer to eat outside, the last time I was inside our table wobbled all night until I shoved a napkin under the problematic table leg. Not great for intimate conversation indoors, gets a little cramped at peak hours, but pasta has always been excellent, great bread, and a decent gin and tonic.

We went there a couple of years ago while in Chicago for a Giants series with the Cubs. I loved this place, decent "big shouldered" Italian food. Classic service and decor. It was what you would expect in a classic oldstyle Italian restaurant.  A special shout out to Wendy the bartender, a great person who also set us up with her friend, a bartender at Murphy's Bleachers.

-1 star for the fat ass waiter we had who kept going to the ladies who also happen to be big's table to give them food their ass could have waited and not died to eat!
