Okay the place is like an old mafia looking joint that we see in movies...you know the not much has changed but the prices and patrons but not the walls or art of naked chicks on the wall. Food was great I had the shrimp/garlic with fettucini and my guy got lasagna which I have to admit was a bit better than my meal. My drink was delicious the pomegranate martini is a must and its strong! Which got my mind right for the concert we were about to see.....alll in all reasonably priced, good food, and service with the exclusion of fat ass the waiter

Since I was in middle school, Maggiano's has been an old standby. Sure, it is a chain, usually located near a suburban mall, but in this case I can look past all of that. Their stuffed mushrooms are awesome, and the Rigatoni "D" is delicious and enough for four days of meals. I have also done the family style for Homecomings and whatnot in high school, and that has always been just as high-quality with something to please everyone at a reasonable price. They also have a nice but reasonably priced wine list. Like other LEYE restaurants, Maggiano's provides classic, well-serviced meals without pretension or obscene prices. This is a great place for groups large or small, out of town guests, or even carryout (complete with a full loaf of their crusty bread).

This was a great spot for a late night, after cocktailing evening. The gnocchi with tomato vodka sauce was perfect for the occasion!  (Hmmmm wonder if it was the vodka...!) At the table, we also had bruschetta, caesar salad and a few other pasta dishes. Good, solid food!

I was here attending a corporate event in a closed-off room. The event was organized far in advance, with nearly every aspect of the evening painstakingly choreographed. Service was stellar. Pretty much what I'd expect at Maggiano's. Food was typical, and in huge portions as usual. One memorable moment was when a few folks arrived well after dinner had been served and cleaned, Maggiano's staff put together plates of food for these stragglers - completely unnecessary and unexpected. Nice touches like that deserve mention and praise.

Wow..I've been here a couple times and can't believe I haven't written a review. For that..I am sorry because this place is so wonderful. My favorite has got to be the lasagna. I'm a big lasagna fan and Maggiano's steps it up with their awesome recipe. They are a chain restaurant, but don't perceive themselves to be one once your inside.  The bar/waiting area is nice and you can call-ahead seating. Be prepared to wait even if you do call ahead. It's worth it.

Maggiano's is a chain restaurant located in many states.  Their food, while consistent, is just o.k.  I think it's a good place to take fussy eaters or people who want simple, decent Italian-American food.  My bf never had Maggiano's, so we stopped here for lunch.  I had the braised beef cannelloni and he had the lasagna.  The portions were huge.  I'm not going to knock chain restaurants, but Chicago is a city where you can find better Italian and Italian-American restaurants.  Leave this one for the tourists  ;)

Hmm, I'm going to disagree with my friend Becky R., I'm pretty sure you that can go wrong with Maggiano's.   They serve way too much food with way too little imagination.  None of it is bad, but I couldn't say any of it is great either.  It's very reliable, and if you find an entree you love, it will always be the same, every time you go.  However, in a city that has so many really good and authentic Italian restaurants, I can't really see a reason to go to Maggiano's.

This update is about the bar area. The bar section makes for a nice waiting for your table area but is just a nice of a place to just grab a drink or two before going some place else. I came here with a friend on an early Friday evening, and we sat right at the bar. I liked the set-up. It wasn't crowded yet so we got to listen to the pianist play some tunes on the shiny grand piano.  I wasn't sure what I wanted to drink, so I asked for the wine menu. The bartendar could not have been nicer and offered his favorite suggestions. He let us try three different reds (his suggested wines), and my memory seems to have failed me now. Let's just say we chose the third option and probably had glasses each. We didn't order food with it, but I think you can order from the same menu as in the restaurant (maybe the appetizers only?).

Good reliable Italian food. Huge portions- a full order of spagetti and meatballs could feed 3 to 4 people! They offer half orders so keep that in mind when ordering. The stuffed mushrooms (appetizer) are a constant at our table. The creme brulee too.  Every once in a while they will have a really good special like a shirmp risotto or a Halibut.   They made a major blunder when they got rid of my favorite dish. They told me it was too many ingredients and too time consuming to prepare. WHAT! So this is actually 3.5 stars. They need to bring back the stuffed chicken!

I used to LOVE this place back in the day. That was before my tastes buds were fully developed and I thought authentic Italian came from Maggiano's on Clark. Now, it's just one of those restaurants on Clark for me. The last two times I visited Maggiano's, I was disappointed big time. It seems as if the food is pre-made and heated in an oven. I always order the chicken vesuvio, garlic mashed, sometimes switch it up with a little skrimps and angel hair pasta...never again.  NOTE TO ANY RESTAURANT: If you make powdered mashed and present them as "homemade," at least use enough butter, salt and water to make them half-way edible. Dummies! The mashed was just bad, bad bad bad... The chicken was dry, and they tried to cover it up with the sauce. I'm not even sure if they are using wine, or water...but the gravy is bland. It's easy to throw garlic in any dish and cover your mistakes...but damn. Isn't Maggiano's supposed to be a quality restaurant? The service is getting bad as well. These days, waiters and waitresses work only for that tip. They bust ass if they get a feeling you will take care of them, otherwise, it's half-ass and slow. The industry today is a lot different then it used to be. Today, waiters, servers, hosts and hostesses do the bare minimum because tipping is so the norm now. They all need a wake-up call...either perform well and get compensated for it,  or go back to school and get a real job.

I can't help it.  I love Maggiano's.  I do.  Even when I don't want to love it, it still lures me in. I get the same thing every time: a half portion of the angel hair shrimp arrabiatta.  And I still have enough for another meal at home!  It's not terribly spicy, but for some reason, I don't care.  The Maggiano's salad (with prosciutto!) is also pretty dern tasty.  The wine selection is solid and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. I'm not saying I want to eat here all the time, but you can never go wrong with Maggiano's.

I have held two private parties in the banquets at Maggianos.  Each and every staff member has been gracious, dependable and effective.  My concerns are always addressed immediately and my instructions are followed to the letter.   The food is always amazing.  I always have our events family style to maximize the variety to our guests.  Not only do I enjoy the meal but everyone has only positive feedback.  We have several people with food allergies and they are accommodated the same as a singular diner in their main restaurant.   The bartenders are generous, the wait staff is thoughtful and productive, and the banquet managers are always foreseeing our potential needs.  I am greatly appreciative and looking forward to another event in the coming spring.

I should start off by saying that Italian food frequently sends me on digestive misadventures that I probably should not discuss here.  I'll follow that up by saying that out of the probably 30 times I've dined in or carried out from Maggiano's, I've only had "the regrets" once.  And that makes me happy. My place of employment used to have parties in their banquet rooms yearly.  The service was always impeccable.  They have the best chopped salad in the city, IMO.  Gnocchi and tiramisu to die for.  I've sampled most of their dishes over the years and never had a complaint about any of them.   Although I've always had excellent service in the banquet rooms and the carryout room, I've gotten a little attitude in the dining room, hence the missing star up there.

Maggiano's is my favorite place to go for Italian. Their brushetta is wonderful, and even my Mom, who HATES brushetta was impressed. Granted, almost everything on the menu is loaded with calories and fat but it is delightful! To combat that, I usually order the appetizer portion of the cheese ravioli, which is more than enough after all the fresh bread and salad. Make sure to leave room for dessert, as they have wonderful selections. This location has valet parking for only $12.

I used to love coming to Maggiano's for this one pasta dish with eggplant that they had.  It was so delicious and I absolutely loved it.  It was great as leftovers as well when you followed the directions they gave you on the container.  I haven't really had a desire to come back ever since they took that off the menu.  However, if I see myself in there again, I would order the Rigatoni D which is quite tasty as well since I'm a sucker for Marsala sauce.  Their appetizers are nothing to write home about as it's just standard appetizer fare.

We had about a party of 30 here the other night... and oh my god the food was good.  I could have kept eating that ravioli until I exploded.  If I wasn't so full of vodka, I probably would have. Our private room had it's own private bar and bartender.  And our bartender made our drinks STRONG.  It was good times :)

the food portions are huge.  quality restaurant.  you really can not order a bad thing on the menu.  the service is really good.  this is a consistent restaurant everytime I go to here I always leave full and I never have a bad experience.  i love the chicken parmisan and also the Rigatoni.  I threw a private room event here recently and everyone was stuffed and happy.

One of my favorite restaurants.  The bread basket is delicious, chopped salad is mouth watering and I usually get their angel hair pasta with marinara sauce....It is even great as cold leftovers!! The only bad thing about this place is that I end up leaving waaaay to stuffed! A little pricey, but definitly worth it.

I went here once on a Saturday night and didn't make reservations so we ended going somewhere instead of waiting about an hour, luckily it's downtown with many other options. I've been back several times for lunch and the service was decent, actually one particular waitress was pretty nice. The food was good, at least in comparison to a lot of other pseudo Italian places I've been to.

Dishes are very good in both portion and taste here. But all of them have that little "chainy" taste to it as many others already have mentioned...  Except this one super dish called Rigatoni D! I'm not a big fan of cream based pastas as they tend to be too heavy on my liking. But Rigatoni D is not like the others. The sauce, which they call it a light Marsala cream, tastes pretty much like an awesome Alfredo sauce. But its texture is as light as a freaking cotton candy! It is just a heavenly plate made with rigatoni, mushroom, onion, and chicken all tossed in together with THE SPECIAL SAUCE. You will be able to see me munching vigorously on my D if you decide to have lunch or pass by Maggiano's tomorrow =).

I've been a long time customer of Maggianos in schaumburg, but the food on a tuesday evening was lame. I always order the Eggplant Parmigiana and it was under cooked and distasteful.  Service was good but don't understand why they screwed up on a slow day.

It's just okay. I kind of don't understand the huge rage about this place. The food is decent, typical italian food in my opinion. The environment/location is nice, but I really don't understand why everyone raves about it. I think there are so many better local italian restaurants that I'd rather go to. It's basically a glorified Olive Garden, chain italian food, busy restaurant... I have to say you get a lot for your money. The portions are ridiculously huge. Anyways, all in all, just OK. It's not a bad place to eat, just not exceptional. I feel like people unnecessarily rave about this place though and really it's not all that amazing.

The food is always consistent, that is why we opt for carry out often.  Unfortunately the service is consistently poor associated with carryout.  There used to be this guy that answered the phone, and he was always was just kind of dick.  Hard to explain how, just acted like we were bugging him by placing an order.  So I must say when I called to order tonight I was pleasantly surprised to hear a female answer the phone.  Well she must have been trained by the guy, same attitude.  Just weird for a lettuce restaurant, usually shine in the service area.  Whatever the fact, I can deal with it, food is good.,

Maggianos will always be a favorite of mine, despite the "chain." I've had the opportunity to eat at both this location and the Schaumburg location (which I do frequent more often).  I took my boyfriend here last year, just to take him out for a change. The portions are massive. I love the caprese (which I believe they simply call - tomato and mozzarella salad) and calamari. For an entree I usually order gnocchi (its freakin delish). A bottle of wine usually accompanies the meal and top it off with tiramisu and coffee; I leave the place ready to bust.  I have always encountered great service at Maggianos. Attentive hostesses/bartenders and waitstaff. No complaints from this Italian-food loving chica! Go on, enjoy! :)

Generally the service is good, but occasionally you run into just a so-so waiter/waitress.  Only once in 15 years have I had bad service so it is pretty decent overall. The food is really great, and very consistent.  For a number of reasons, we have eaten here 4 times in the last month, and I just never get tired of going back. If you are in need of a great place for a business lunch, date night out, or family night out, this places hits home runs for all of these situations. I especially recommend their Chicken Francese, Baked Ziti, Braciole (these are all their house specialties) and their fresh fish of the day.  Their veal is excellent, as are their chicken dishes.  Looking for a great lobster ravioli in a cream sauce?  Oh yeah baby!  They have that for sure. Wine prices are reasonable and selection is decent. Make reservations.  This place is always busy!

My experience was okay.  We had an attentive waiter who was kind of weird at the same time, but will definitely want him to be our waiter again.  The food was okay.  My boyfriend had a shrimp pasta which he loved and I had the chicken saltinbocca which was okay but I have had better.  The reason why I gave maggianos 4 stars was for the apple martinis, they are delicious.

We come here for most of our work functions.  It's not real Italian food, but it does taste good.  The cream sauce is probably the heaviest I've had anywhere.  The service has always been good, especially given that we're usually in a group of 10+. It's not a bad choice if you've got picky eaters, but there are much, much better choices for Italian out there.  Please do not trek intot the city and make a night out of going to this place.

To me, Maggiano's is overpriced. The only way this place makes sense is if three people all want the same thing. The portions are huge and the food is good, but it's not mind blowing. The half portions are big enough to feed three hungry people. Seriosuly, they use the equivelant to two boxes of any pasta they sell at Jewel for their regular portion.  I send guests here because suburbinites ask for it and some guests don't mind sharing a $20 dish for a party of four.

Free meals should not be complained about, but I'm shameless. Our work holiday meal was held here and there were about 10-15 of us there, along with about 10 other tables of 10+ corporate lunchers. I'd walked by this place a million times and was really hopeful. But boy was I disappointed ... I ordered the Mozerella Marinara appetizer, which turned out to just be a square piece of cheese breaded and covered with their absolutely benign marinara sauce. It wasn't sticks like mozarella sticks normally are, but just this square. And it wasn't even enough for more than two people to enjoy. The sauce was absolutely plain, nothing interesting about it. If anything, it was even too benign for a pasta sauce. A sidenote: The raspberry lemonade is delicious. Order it. For my main course I got the Chicken Parmesan, an easy, easy meal choice, no? Well, first they somehow lost it and nearly my entire table was done by the time I got my food. The same nothingness-filled marinara coated two pieces of chicken. I also got a salad with the meal, this being a choice I made between a side of pasta, salad, etc. I thought this was a pretty crappy setup. Most places you go offer the chicken Parmesan with pasta, with a side salad. Not this place. No sir. I ate about half the main course and shoved it off, hoping that the dessert would offer up something delicious. I ordered the apple ... something or other ... with vanilla bean ice cream. Talk about the most delicious part of the meal (save the lemonade, that is)! I highly recommend this. In fact, I recommend that if you go here ... get dessert and lemonade and call it a day. You can get better marinara in a can of Ragu. (Also of note: One of the gals with us is allergic to Parsley -- talk about inconvenient. She told the waiter this and when her salmon came, guess what it was covered in? Yah. Parsley. Morons!)

I agree with other posters that overall this food is just OK and nothing to write home about.  This is like Olive Garden, but with a bigger menu selection.  If you really do think Applebee's has good food, you'll love this place!

I've been in both the main dining room and the banquet facilities here.  The main dining room is fine.  It's huge, the service is good and the food is what you come to expect at an Italian restaurant.  It's awesome that it's family style so there's always enough food.  I'm a big fan of their chicken Parmesan.  Excellent.  Oh and their Caesar salad, also very good. I've been to their banquet facility twice.  Once for a retirement dinner and once for a wedding.  The retirement dinner left much to be desired.  The food was terrible, the chicken was dry, the pasta was cold, it just wasn't very good.  But when I went for the wedding, the food was really good.  There was plenty to eat and it was all very hot and tasty.  I think it didn't hurt that our server for our table was just outstanding.   So overall I like this place a lot.  I love the food in the main dining room and the second time the banquet was much better, it could have just been one of those days.
This place is good for group dinners.  They give you lots of food and the prices are reasonable.  The food is fine but nothing special. I really liked the linguine with clams and the maggiano salad.

I had dinner here for the first time last Friday after hearing tons of great things about the place. The wait was long, but the friendly host asked if we wanted to sit in their lounge area (must be Italian for hallway) and there wouldn't be a wait. We obliged, and although we ate dinner with the people who were waiting for tables, it wasn't all that bad. The service was really fast and pleasant (we had a train to catch).  The food was wonderful. Even the olive oil was extremely tasty. And the portions were over the top! Not so much for drinks though, the bloody mary and margarita were really small and expensive, They were both kind of gross as well. We gave our leftovers to a homeless man outside, and caught a cab to Union Station.

I've had lunch and dinner here, primarily with larger groups or for business functions, and in one case - when I was challenged to an eating contest (long story, don't ask!). Maggiano's is great for those occassions - banquets, business gatherings, large groups, etc. - but as other reviewers stated, there is much better Italian elsewhere in the city.

Quantity is not better than quality, and this place is a clear example of that.  If they would simply invest in more flavor in their dishes instead of overfeeding me and my waistline, I'd be loving the place (it's got good atmosphere and a great location), but overall the food is 'ok', and not anything to write home about.

Had dinner here last night....i've been passing by this place for years, and nothing about it has ever "dragged me in" per se. But last night I had a work group dinner forum that booked out one of the banquet rooms in the rear part of the restaurant. I have two words: OLD FASHIONED. this place reeked of old money, and old rich people. Plenty of wood beams, and burgundy colored trinkets, leather, and old spice. Nothing cutting edge or modern about the decor. This may be the way they want it to be - designed/themed or whatever, but it didn't work for me. THE FOOD. okay, we had platters brought out to our various tables - platters of baked tilapia in a lemon garlic olive oil & pea sauce over a bed of spinach, a hearty hearty meaty gigantic platter of lasagna, baked chicken breast with mozarella and marinara sauce, and angel hair with marinara. All were tasty enough for mass cooked meals for a large group. Usually a bit more in the taste dept may be compromised when dealing with large groups. Thing was, i was starving when I got here. But after two bites of the lasagna, i was full. So i became a glutton and tried everything they brought out: DECENT, at best. That lasagna was VERY filling. I wonder what else the added to it....hmm..... The servers,/waiters were attentive, and kept my water glass full regularly. and they were also on time with removing plates that werent in use any longer. In short, this is not a place i'd bring a date. there is WAY better italian in this city. bring your out of town clients here. They'll feel good about themselves, and may even agree to that deal you're trying to close. Only you would know that you coulda done better for them.

Is it good?  Yeah... Would I take a dear friend here from out of town? Not at all... Much better Italian all over Chicago.  If you are looking for big bowls of Pasta and bland food this is your place...Again though...would I eat it sure...just wouldnt bring my Italian family to dine there...

Kind of embarrassed to admit that I went to Maggiano's.  It was my first time and probably my last.  I went there with my bf's family so I had no choice. Let's start with the good: easy to get in on a Monday night, lots of dishes to choose from, big servings-we all got 1/2 serving pasta, and some of us had leftover.   The Bad: the food is just not good.  Go a few more blocks and you can be at La Scarola, drive 5 more mins and you can be at Le Luce or Rosale's in Little Italy.   The fettuccine alfredo sauce was like the make -it-yourself baggie powder that you get at grocery store.  The baked ziti(one of their signature dishes) was way too salty and the cheese on top was just baked globbed on.  This list can go on.... Service was okay, but not the top notch that I am used to at other Lettuce restaurants, e.g. Shaw's, Nacional 27.  Overall, it's a thumbs down for me.

This is only of those places you take your parents or grandparents to and they will enjoy themselves. Everyone should be able to find something on the menu that they can eat. With that said if I am going to eat at an Italian chain I am more of a fan of Buca.  There are better less crowded place you can eat at.

Back when I was partying like it's 1999 I was all about Maggianos. The parents would visit me at NU and we'd go to Old Orchard for shopping and HUGE portions of pasta (another thing that contributed to the freshman 15).  I wished we had an Italian restaurant like this back home...and then my wish came true and there was not only a Maggiano's in Boca Raton, but pretty much in any other mall around the United States.  But by this time I'd discovered the finer things in life (ex: La Scarola and Rose Angelis) and Maggianos just wasn't doing it for me anymore.  Yes, the portions were still enormous, but I  was busy dieting trying to lose that freshman 15! ;) And the Italian food is really just....bland (and this is coming from the girl who could eat pasta for breakfast, lunch, and dinner).   Until last night I've never even visited this downtown location of Maggiano's because why would I go here when I could get my fill of pasta at so many other amazing italian restaurants nearby.  This isn't the suburbs after all....we have options in Chicago!   That being said I do have to say that if you're planning a party they do have very nice banquet rooms. I attended a very well done party here last night where the downstairs space itself was lovely, the staff was attentive, and there was plenty of room to move around (people were even dancing).  I still found the food to be bland, but food is usually compromised at these events anyway when you're serving a bunch of people.

We had a big group to feed, and not a lot of time to get away from the MMM (magnificent mile mayhem), so for what it was, this place worked out great, especially since it fed us full for $20 a head, including wine.  The best way to describe the service was vague, and the food was adequate. The pastas and salads were good without being exciting. Similarly, our waiter seemed really out of it, albeit friendly.    In my book, the decor was as cheesy as a big bowl of parmesan. It was like a set for one of those joke mob movies, like "Analyze This!" And putting Frank Sinatra's greatest hits on repeat will get me singing along, but I wouldn't call it classy.
Love Maggiano's. Each entree is enough for a family of 4. Delicious. Not pretentious. Only complaint is the wait, but who can blame everyone?

Went for lunch twice here this year, and was impressed by the improved quality of the food and the very friendly service. The crispy zucchini fritte was not greasy, and the aioli cream sauce was an great accompaniment. I've enjoyed the angel hair and the vegetable farfalle as main courses, and would order both again. The tiramisu is awesome.

Maggiano's is exactly what it aims to be... The food is pleasing to the palate, but no one would ever call the menu daring. Old Italian classics, served in huge portions that two can share. You see a lot of families there, and with good reason. The ambiance is warm and friendly, usually with some Sinatra in the background.  I doubt many gastronomes will patronize Maggiano's, but it's a great old standby - consistent, and without surprises. Lettuce Entertain You has taken some chances over the years, but this chain isn't one of them.

Fantastic service!  Everyone is super friendly and always seems to be going out of their way to make sure you leave happy. I wish I could say the same for the food.  The appetizers (brushetta, calamari, stuffed mushrooms) were fairly good, however, I was less than impressed with the entrees.  I ordered the shrimp arribata and it was bland and lacking in flavor.  Now that I think about it, just about everything we ordered was lacking in flavor.  The strawberry lemonade was overly sweet that I let it water down before I took another sip.  Creme brulee was delicious. Again, I should reiterate what most have said, portions are humongous.  If you are ordering per person, it's easily enough for 2-3 meals. If you want great service and mediocre food, you'll be fine.  However, if you're looking for that extra kick when dining, I suggest you look for another restaurant.

I will not drawl on and on about the food; we did family style and it was stellar!  Our server, Margie, helped us with every detail and gave her personal recommendations for style of food prep.  She also boxed up the leftovers!  Big points with us recent graduates! I don't usually like to review franchise restaurants but I am making an exception.  Customer service here is out of this world! I set up a surprise going away party for a friend, and from the first phone call to the check, these people were on the ball, comprehensive, and discreet with our surprise. I set up the reservations, and brought my own cake in.  They whisked the cake to the back and were very accomodating with our boisterous group as we sat and waited for the guest of honor.  Drinks were always filled and the staff was so very personable--it's really an impeccable balance of accomodation and discretion.  They are genuinely talking to you and not just kissing your ass.   My favorite part of the entire experience was after the guest of honor arrived, we had a late arrival to the dinner party.  The host came over to check and be sure that we were ready for this guest...the host was under the impression that the late arrival was actually the guest of honor receiving the surprise.  This guy was a great watchdog and it really made me feel like they wanted to help the party go over smoothly. Excellent, excellent service!  I give this place the highest recommendation!

It used to be a better restaurant.. but it is still a decent place to go if you want cheap Italian-American.  The bread used to be better.. but now it's just okay.  The portions are pretty big.. so you can just share.  I'd make reservations if you are going on the weekend. I like the Tuscan mussels, chopped salad, linguine with white clam sauce, and pasta with shrimp arrabita.
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! I have to order their desert every time I come! I want to go there just to have all their desert! lol. If I have to pick one... I usually go with the creme brulee.

I'm not a fan of the food at Maggiano's.  I went once in 2002 and haven't made it back until last weekend.  I attended an event in their banquet hall.  My feelings about the food remain the same: blah Italian-American food that is pretty mediocre and bland. However, I do have to admit that the banquet hall is amazing.  Before the sit-down dinner, there was an open bar with appetizer stations.  The appetizers were pretty good (stuffed mushrooms and brushetta).  The bar staff was excellent.  I was having a great time until the dinner started.

I have been to this location a couple of times and I've had reservations. I never had to wait, even though the place has been crowded. Parking is right across the street and very convenient.  Yes, the serving size is ample, but the food is absolutely delicious! The stuff mushroons, calamari ... Oh Yeah!  The appetizers are fabulous. The cocktails have been perfect, whether its a mixed drink or wine the bartenders are excellent!   I have been to the Maggiano's in Oak Brook too.  They are excellent as well.   Maggiano's and most Italian restaurants have very very close seating. That's my only criticism.  I guess they have to have it that way because Italian food is great and so many people go to them to eat.   I have been to Maggiano's for group parties, conferences, dates and with family members.  Maggiano's has been consistently fantastic.

I don't understand why people think this place is so great.  Sure, portions are huge, but I feel like most of what I've had here, I can have elsewhere and have it taste better.   Its kind of a fun place to come as a group.  It was very loud in here though, so good luck hearing whoever is across the table from you.   Our waiter was quick about bringing things to us, but kept referring to the women at our table as "lady" which really rubbed me the wrong way.  "You done with that, lady?"  Maybe its just semantics, but it seemed more akin to "broad" than "miss."  Anyway, I digress.  On the plus side, my water and wine glasses were never empty.     Their tiramisu is good, everything else I've had is decent, but not great.   I'd come back here if someone else suggested it, but if given the choice, I'd try somewhere else.

No matter that it is at Lettuce Entertain You "chain."  Maggiano's is great, great, great Italian food.  The portions are huge, the pastas are tender beyond belief, and the bread is awesome.  I have never had a bad meal at any Maggiano's and I will continue to patronize as long as they are open.  Always crowded and always loud, but it is worth it.  You always know you will be satisfied here.
I refer to this place as "Over Priced Olive Garden"

I don't believe this is Italian but really great American Italian.  I really liked salad and pasta! I was casual clothes but the other people were wearing nice.  A lot older than me.  I felt like am I ok eating here?  I mean, I was not that bad.  The other people were just greater than the other place.

Very impressed with the Maggianos banquet rooms attached to the main dining area.  They have several options for rooms with big parties to small rooms for more intimate dining.  Food is always good...just keep passing me the salads and lasagna.   Just had a work party here and really had a nice evening.

I went here on New Year's Eve with my boyfriend for my birthday and I had Lasagna and he had Chicken Parmesan. My lasagna was horrid. There was way too much cottage cheese and it tasted so bland and the meat sauce was plain. My boyfriend's Chicken Parmesan, on the other hand was good, but it was also tiny. You would have better luck trying Barnelli's.

Had a great meal here with great service.  Can't complain at all, and will definitely go back.  However, they boxed up my wife's food, and when we got home, it was someone else's leftovers, which was strange...

The food at this location is OK and the service is OK at best. I feel generous giving 3 stars for the experience I had this weekend. My favorite part of the dinner was when my husband asked for a Coke, got a Diet Coke instead, and when he brought it up to the server, she didn't believe him! I had to take a sip to confirm his findings... grrrr! However, we were lucky and found parking on the street just a block away...   The FOOD: The lasagna had barely any meat, too much ricotta cheese and not enough sauce. There wasn't much garlic flavor in the garlic shrimp with linguine. But, the lobster ravioli was delicious.   The SERVICE: The server didn't ask what size dishes we wanted (full or half), she just decided for us. They asked if we wouldn't mind sitting outside since it was heated, but our propane heater went out 10 minutes after we sat down (I'm glad I wore a jacket). And what was once Corner Bakery are now crowded tables in a congested area in the main entrance.

This was some of the best wedding reception food I've ever had.  I'm not as excited about dining in the main restaurant, but even that's pretty darned good. My sister's reception was this weekend and it was seamless.  We had about 100 people in the downstairs dining room, and used the anteroom and bar for dancing and drinking/hanging out.  The service was really wonderful and hospitable and the food was mouthwatering.  The tenderest tenderloin of beef, grilled talapia, four cheese ravioli, shells & shrimp, and a bunch of other sides.  It was fantastic food.  100 seems like a small wedding, but the layout of this room made it seem very full, yet it was small enough to be able to find people and visit. Highly recommended for wedding receptions and corporate events.
Decent food, friendly staff. Had to stop eating, though, when my co-worker found a long hair cooked into her lasagna.

Consistent Italian food is great.  You can go to any location and get the same good meal.  Some standouts are the eggplant parmigiana, chicken saltimbocca, and the salads.  This is another place where you can go as a couple and sit right away.  Pop in, sit at the small tables near the waiting section and be served.

Overrated Italian restaurant.  The food is very similar to any fast food Italian place.  But if you are looking for your typical Italian food menu for reasonable price, then this is the place to go.  Large menu and large portions.  At this location, I think the seating is too crowded.

The food here is so yummy. I've never left hungry or disappointed!!! I love their stuffed mushrooms and the shrimp appetizers. Their fettucine alfredo and caesar salads are so good too. It's definately a treat for my fiance and I to eat here as it is quite expensive (for us anyway)! :)

Lots of food! This is the true definition of family style so go with a lot of people, order a lot of good Italian food, and be prepared still be eating it days later.  The food is good, but if I had my choice for Italian food I would stick with Rosebud and some of the other restaurants in the city....I like the atmosphere better.
The food is good, not GREAT or amazing, but good. What I like at this location is the great oldskool Chicago-style marble bar.

For great Italian food give Maggiano's a try.  The portions are enormous and are great for sharing and I recommend the 4 cheese ravioli.  The chicken parmisian is great too and is definitely not for one person.  Try the tiramisu for dessert and you won't be disappointed!
What a great place.  I went here on a first date and it was a great atmosphere.  The portions are huge so be sure to go with an appetite and make reservations because this place fills up fast.
I don't understand why this place is so popular.  The acoustics were horrible and I could hardly hear the people at my table.  The food was mediocre.

Food is great here - perhaps portions are a bit too big so I always tend to overeat and I always have plenty leftover to take home.  I once went on a date here which was a bit of a mistake - this place is definately geared towards groups instead.  Service, on the other hand - Our waiter was very rude-he directed all of his service to the large parties and every time we tried to get his attention - he just glared at us.

I went here last night for the first time believe it or not and I was kind of dissapointed.  We got the chicken which was pretty dry and flavorless but the salad was awesome and the dessert was to die for.  Our waitress was very nice and the portions were definitely huge, we split 2 half orders and were full! Next time I go I'm going to order pasta though!

An excellent choice for Italian food.  My recommendation is to dine "family style" with a group of people or be prepared to take some leftovers home with you.  The portions are ginormous!  I definitely recommend the mushroom ravioli and the house salad with crumbed bleu cheese!

I have always loved Maggianos. Huge portions and good food. The ambience is fantastic. I totally recommend the rigatoni d chicken marsala. my favorite. I love how the menu has wine recommendations for every dish. I also LOVE their onion bread. Its to die for.

Maggiano's is the place to fill up on Italian food, or bring a group along to digest the family-sized portions here. The building does look like those in Manhattan's Little Italy. The lasagna is an enormous cube of food, and the bowls of pasta are almost like salad bowls so such a large serving can be distributed amongst a table or portioned to save for lunch the following day. If you still have room, try a dessert like tiramisu. Maggiano's is also connected to the Corner Bakery, with sugary treats like brownies and lemon bars.

A favorite of mine for years... My advice is to get the full order of pasta and take half home for lunch tomorrow! The portions are plentiful as you would expect from an Italian restaurant. I agree that you can feel a bit rushed, but make reservations and take your time! Favorite dish is the classic spaghetti and meatballs. The chicken parmesan is awesome too!
Great Italian food! The way the menu and portions are set up it's a good idea to come with a group of people and share food. The pasta meal selection is endless!!!
